edocenter: <entryFree id="n15159" type="main" key="e_do^center"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ēdŏcenter</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. edoceo <sense id="n15159.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
edoceo: <entryFree id="n15160" type="main" key="e_do^ce^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ē-dŏcĕo</orth>, <itype>cŭi, ctum, 2</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n15160.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to teach thoroughly; to instruct</hi>, <hi rend="ital">inform</hi>, <hi rend="ital">apprise</hi> one of any thing (class.; for syn. cf.: doceo, perdoceo, erudio, praecipio, instituo). —With <hi rend="ital">acc. pers.</hi> and <hi rend="ital">rei</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">eadem haec intus edocebo, quae ego scio, Stratippoclem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:5:1:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ep. 5, 1, 56</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:2:2:91" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Trin. 2, 2, 91</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 16:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 16, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 20</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:26 al" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 26 al.</bibl>; cf. in the <hi rend="ital">pass.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Cicero per legatos cuncta edoctus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 45:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 45, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 25, 40</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:13:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 13, 47</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:1:587" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 1, 587</bibl>; and with <hi rend="ital">acc. pers.</hi> and <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Etruscam Edocuit gentem casus aperire futuros,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:559" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 15, 559</bibl></cit>; cf. in the <hi rend="ital">pass.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">edoctus tandem deos esse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:29:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 29, 18</bibl></cit>.— With <hi rend="ital">acc. pers.</hi> and <hi rend="ital">rel. clause</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quos ille edocuerat, quae dici vellet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:38:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 38, 4</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:108:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 3, 108, 2</bibl>; cf. in the <hi rend="ital">pass.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ante edocti, quae interrogati pronuntiarent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:20:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. G. 7, 20, 10</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:32:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 32, 26</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">eadem fere quae Volturcius de paratis incendiis senatum edocet (Kritz. docet),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 48:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 48, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ab Evandro edocti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:32:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 32, 26</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">tot cladibus edocti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:30:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 30, 37</bibl></cit>; and: <cit><quote lang="la">in qua (disciplina) edoctus esset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 24, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:1:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 1, 1, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnia ordine,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 24, 24</bibl></cit>.— With <hi rend="ital">interrog. clause</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid fieri velit, edocet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:3:18:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 3, 18, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">7, 19, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:37:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 37, 25</bibl>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Ter.</author> Ph. 3, 3, 7</bibl>; and with <hi rend="ital">obj. acc.</hi> and <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:8:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 8, 13</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut edoceas, ut res se habet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:3:3:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 3, 3, 20</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">acc. pers.</hi> and <hi rend="ital">subj. clause</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Phanium edocebo, Ne quid vereatur Phormionem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Ter.</author> Ph. 5, 2, 17</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n15160.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of abstract subjects: <cit><quote lang="la">fama Punici belli satis edocuerat, viam tantum Alpes esse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 27, 39</bibl></cit>: edocuit tamen ratio ... ut videremus, etc., * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:3:33:80" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 3, 33, 80</bibl>.—Hence, * <orth extent="full" lang="la">ēdŏcenter</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">instructively</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">scriptum est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:16:8:3" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 16, 8, 3</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
edolo: <entryFree id="n15161" type="main" key="e_do^lo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ē-dŏlo</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n15161.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to cut</hi> or <hi rend="ital">hew out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to prepare by hewing.</hi> * </sense><sense id="n15161.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">lingulas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:8:11:4" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 8, 11, 4</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n15161.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to work out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">prepare</hi>, <hi rend="ital">finish</hi> (rare): libellum, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 448, 17</bibl>: quod jusseras edolavi, <pb n="627" /> <cb n="EDUC" /> Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:13:47:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 13, 47, 1</bibl> (cf. R<bibl default="NO"><author>ib.</author> Trag. Fragm. p. 237</bibl>): puerum, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 392, 30</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
edom: <entryFree id="n15162" type="main" key="Edom"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Edom</orth>, <itype>indecl.</itype> <gen>m.</gen> <sense id="n15162.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Esau</hi>, <hi rend="ital">elder son of the patriarch Isaac</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Esau, ipse est Edom,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,001:36:1 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Gen. 36, 1 al.</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 7, 6, 33</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n15162.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A nation descended from Esau</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,004:20:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Num. 20, 14</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,014:3:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 4 Reg. 3, 26</bibl> et saep. —</sense><sense id="n15162.2" n="III" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">the country of the Edomites</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,004:21:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Num. 21, 4</bibl> et saep.</sense></entryFree>
edomino: <entryFree id="n15163" type="main" key="E_do^mi^no"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ē-dŏmĭno</orth>, <itype>āvi, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n15163.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to control absolutely; pass.</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 5</bibl>, <hi rend="ital">no.</hi> 11 <hi rend="ital">init.</hi></sense></entryFree>
edomito: <entryFree id="n15164" type="hapax" key="e_do^mi^to"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ē-dŏmĭto</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. freq. a.</pos>, <sense id="n15164.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to tame completely</hi>, <hi rend="ital">thoroughly</hi>, Ven. Carm. 9, 1, 143.</sense></entryFree>
edomo: <entryFree id="n15165" type="main" key="e_do^mo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ē-dŏmo</orth>, <itype>ŭi, ĭtum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n15165.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to tame completely</hi>, <hi rend="ital">conquer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">overcome</hi>, <hi rend="ital">vanquish</hi>, <hi rend="ital">subdue</hi> (rare; mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in postAug. prose). </sense><sense id="n15165.1" n="I" level="1"> Prop.: <cit><quote lang="la">(Roma) edomito sustulit orbe caput,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:4:256" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 4, 256</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:3:114" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. A. 3, 114</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n15165.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">pastinaca edomita, opp. agrestis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:9:4:5" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 9, 4, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aes igni,</quote> <trans><tr>to melt</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:33:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 33, 3, 20, § 65</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ramum oleae curvando,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:137" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 17, 19, 30, § 137</bibl></cit>: vitiosam naturam ab eo sic edomitam et compressam esse doctrina, ut, etc., * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,054:5:10" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fat. 5, 10</bibl> (al. domitam): <cit><quote lang="la">feritatem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:11:3:37" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 11, 3, 37</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 4, 25, 8</bibl>: nefas, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:5:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 5, 22</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">labores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:3:531" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 3, 531</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lumina,</quote> <trans><tr>to lull to sleep</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:10:343" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 10, 343</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
edoni: <entryFree id="n15166" type="main" key="E_do_ni"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ēdōni</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*)hdwnoi/</foreign>, <sense id="n15166.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a people of Thrace</hi>, <hi rend="ital">east of the Strymon</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 11, 18, § 40</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">celebrated as worshippers of Bacchus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:7:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 7, 27</bibl></cit>, v. Bacchus.—Derivv., </sense><sense id="n15166.1" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Ēdōnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">Edonic.</hi> </sense><sense id="n15166.2" n="1" level="3"> Edoni populi = Edoni, <bibl default="NO"><author>Sol.</author> 9, § 1</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n15166.3" n="2" level="3"> Esp., <usg type="style">poet.</usg> for <hi rend="ital">Thracian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Boreae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:365" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 365</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">venti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:6:340" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 6, 340</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hiemes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:5:78" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 5, 78</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">juga,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:4:1:42" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 4, 1, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">currus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:12:733" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 12, 733</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Bacchus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> R. Am. 593</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n15166.4" n="3" level="3"> As <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Ēdōnus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*)hdwno/s</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">a spur of the Pangaeus range</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in southeastern Thrace</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 11, 18, § 50</bibl>; also called <orth extent="full" lang="la">Edon</orth>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> Verg. A. 12, 365</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n15166.5" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Ēdō-nis</orth> (Edŏnis, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:4:778" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 4, 778</bibl> Drak.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:1:675" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 1, 675</bibl>), <itype>idis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">Edonic</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Thracian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">matres,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:11:69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 11, 69</bibl></cit>.—<pos>Subst.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">a Bacchante</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:1:3:5" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 1, 3, 5</bibl>; Sil. l. l.; Luc. l. l.</sense></entryFree>
edor: <entryFree id="n15167" type="gloss" key="edor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">edor</orth> = ador, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=10" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 10</bibl> Müll., v. ador.</entryFree>
edormio: <entryFree id="n15168" type="main" key="e_dormi^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ē-dormĭo</orth>, <itype>īvi or ii, 4</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> and <sense id="n15168.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to sleep out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sleep away; to sleep off</hi> (rare, but class.; usually of persons who are intoxicated). </sense><sense id="n15168.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Neutr. absol.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cumque (vinolenti) edormiverunt, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 17, 52</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n15168.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi>, with <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">edormi crapulam et exhala,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 2, 12 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nocturnum vinum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:6:10" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 6, 10 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>: Fufius ebrius olim Cum Ilionam edormit, i. e. <hi rend="ital">sleeps through the part of the sleeping Iliona</hi>, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:3:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 3, 61</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">dimidium ex hoc (tempore) edormitur,</quote> <trans><tr>is slept away</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 99" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 99</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
edormisco: <entryFree id="n15169" type="main" key="e_dormisco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ēdormisco</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, <sense id="n15169.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. inch. a.</hi> [edormio], <hi rend="ital">to sleep out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to sleep off</hi> a debauch (perh. only in the foll. passages): <cit><quote lang="la">crapulam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:2:7:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 2, 7, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc villi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:5:2:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 5, 2, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">unum somnum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:2:2:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 2, 2, 65</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
educatio: <entryFree id="n15170" type="main" key="e_du^ca_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ēdŭcātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>2. edŭco</etym>, <sense id="n15170.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a breeding</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rearing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">training</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bringing up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">education</hi> (good prose). </sense><sense id="n15170.1" n="I" level="1"> Of men, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:31:124" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 31, 124</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:3:13" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Leg. 3, 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:1:21" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 1, 21</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:2:6" default="NO">1, 2, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:3:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 3, 52</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,002:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> G. 20</bibl> et saep.—</sense><sense id="n15170.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n15170.3" n="A" level="2"> Of animals, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:3:19" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 3, 19</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:chapter=22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Am. 22 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:7:12:11" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 7, 12, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:8:11:1" default="NO">8, 11, 1</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n15170.4" n="B" level="2"> Of plants, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:94" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 25, 39, § 94</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 1, 7</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
educator: <entryFree id="n15171" type="main" key="e_du^ca_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ēdŭcātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n15171.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a rearer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bringer - up</hi> (rare, but good prose). </sense><sense id="n15171.1" n="I" level="1"> Prop., of a <hi rend="ital">foster-father</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:33:81" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Planc. 33, 81</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:1:14" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 7, 1, 14</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:34" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 34</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n15171.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of <hi rend="ital">tutors</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pedagogues</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:11:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 11, 1</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">12, 41</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">14, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:40:2:13" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 40, 2, 13</bibl> et saep.</sense></entryFree>
educatrix: <entryFree id="n15172" type="main" key="e_du^ca_trix"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ēdŭcātrix</orth>, <itype>īcis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>educator</etym>. <sense id="n15172.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">She who brings up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a nurse</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:8:11:14" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 8, 11, 14</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Don.</author> 14</bibl>, <hi rend="ital">no.</hi> 39.—</sense><sense id="n15172.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">earum (rerum) parens est educatrixque sapientia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:1:24:62" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 1, 24, 62</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
educatus: <entryFree id="n15173" type="hapax" key="e_du^ca_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ēdŭcātus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>2. edŭco</etym>, <sense id="n15173.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">bringing up</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Res Carn. 60</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
educo: <entryFree id="n15174" type="main" key="e_du_co1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ē-dūco</orth>, <itype>xi, ctum, 3</itype> (<sense id="n15174.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">imper.</hi>, educe, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:4:1:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Pers. 4, 1, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:5:6:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Stich. 5, 6, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">educ,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:1:5:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 1, 5, 10</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Alcim.</author> 5, 248 al.</bibl>—<hi rend="ital">Inf. pass. parag.</hi>, educier, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:5:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 5, 16</bibl>), <pos>v. a.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">to lead forth</hi>, <hi rend="ital">draw out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bring away</hi> (very freq. and class.). </sense><sense id="n15174.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">novam nuptam foras,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:4:3:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cas. 4, 3, 1</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">so with personal objects, fidicinam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ep. 3</bibl></cit>, <cb n="EDUC" /> 4, 36 (opp. introducere): <cit><quote lang="la">eram,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:4:6:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 4, 6, 53</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">virginem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:4:1:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pers. 4, 1, 11</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:3:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Q. Fr. 3, 3 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl> al.; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">also: populum e comitio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:2:9" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 2, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mulierem ab domo secum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:53:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 53, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rete foras,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:1:1:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 1, 1, 18</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">pisces everriculo in litus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 3:17:7" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 3, 17, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">radicem e terra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:ib. 3:10:5" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 10, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gladium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:44:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 44, 8</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 51:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 51, 36</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">gladium e vagina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:2:4:14" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 2, 4, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gladium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,002:14:47 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Marc. 14, 47 al.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sortem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 51 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquos ex urna,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 2, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tribus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:8:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Agr. 2, 8, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">telum corpore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:744" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 10, 744</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:83" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 20, 19, § 83</bibl> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">lacum (with emittere),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:44:100" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 44, 100</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">fistulam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 3:14:2" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 3, 14, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aquam in fossas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:179" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 19, 49, § 179</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:8:3:29" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 8, 3, 29</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">se foras,</quote> <trans><tr>to go out</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:3:3:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Hec. 3, 3, 4</bibl></cit> Ruhnk. ad loc.; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">se multitudini,</quote> <trans><tr>to withdraw one's self from the multitude</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Vit. Beat. 2" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Vit. Beat. 2 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n15174.2" n="II" level="1"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n15174.3" n="A" level="2"> In all periods. </sense><sense id="n15174.4" n="1" level="3"> Pub. law t. t. </sense><sense id="n15174.5" n="a" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">To bring</hi>, <hi rend="ital">summon</hi> before court (cf. duco, I. B. 1.): <cit><quote lang="la">cum in jus ipsum eduxi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 47</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ex domo in jus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:8:6" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 7, 8, 6</bibl></cit>: SI. QVIS. EORVM. AD. ME. EDVCTVS. FVERIT., Edict. Praet. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:11:17:2" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 11, 17, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem ad consules,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:chapter=23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Planc. 23</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">and simply aliquem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 26</bibl></cit> Zumpt <hi rend="ital">N. cr.;</hi> 2, 2, 37; 2, 3, 65.—Once also, <hi rend="ital">to bring up</hi> or <hi rend="ital">lead away</hi> for punishment (for which more commonly duco; v. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 26</bibl>): <cit><quote lang="la">ad tintinnaculos educi viros,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:4:3:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 4, 3, 8</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n15174.6" n="b" level="4"> Of persons in office, <hi rend="ital">to take out with one</hi> to one's province: quos educere invitos in provinciam non potuit, eos retinere qui potuit? Cic. Fragm. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:10:76" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 10, 76</bibl>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">medicum secum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:Pis. 34" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Pis. 34</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n15174.7" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="dom">Milit. t. t.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to lead forth</hi>, <hi rend="ital">march out</hi> troops (very freq. in Caes.): <cit><quote lang="la">Teleboae ex oppido Legiones educunt suas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:1:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 1, 1, 63</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praesidium ex oppido (opp introducere),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:13:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 13, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cohortes ex urbe,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 12, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">exercitum ab urbe,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">copias e castris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:50:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 50, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">2, 8</bibl> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>; 7, 13, 1; 7, 80, 1; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:43:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 1, 43, 3</bibl> et saep.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:31:37 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 31, 37 al.</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">for which also: copias castris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:51:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 51, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">4, 13</bibl> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:68:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 1, 68, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 11, 20</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">legiones ex hibernis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:10:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 10, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">5, 27, 9</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">7, 10, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 40, 39</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex finibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:4:1:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 4, 1, 4</bibl></cit> et saep.; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">also: impedimenta ex castris,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 68, 1</bibl></cit>.—Without designating the term. a quo: <cit><quote lang="la">cohortes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:3:26:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 3, 26, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:41:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 1, 41, 2</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 64, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 68:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 68, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 39, 15</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:Strat. 1:5:22" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> Strat. 1, 5, 22</bibl> et saep.; cf.: exercitum foras, Cato ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:15:13:5" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 15, 13, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">exercitum in expeditionem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:33:72" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 33, 72</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">copias adversus Afranium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:Strat. 1:5:9" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> Strat. 1, 5, 9</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:2:2:5" default="NO">2, 2, 5</bibl> et saep.—And <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi> of the general himself, <hi rend="ital">to move out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">march out</hi> (so mostly in Liv.; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">duco): ex hibernis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:10:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 10, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex oppido,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 81, 3</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">tribus simul portis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:41:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 41, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad legionem Pompeii duplici acie eduxit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:3:67:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 3, 67, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in aciem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 23</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:9" default="NO" valid="yes">8, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:39" default="NO" valid="yes">21, 39</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:Strat. 2:1:5" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> Strat. 2, 1, 5</bibl>, al. —</sense><sense id="n15174.8" n="3" level="3"> Naut. t. t., <hi rend="ital">to bring out</hi> a ship from the harbor, <hi rend="ital">to put to sea</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">naves ex portu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:57:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 57, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">2, 22, 5</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 26, 2</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">also: classem portu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 12, 9, § 55</bibl></cit>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n15174.9" n="b" level="4"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of goods, <hi rend="ital">to export</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">equos ex Italia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:43:5:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 43, 5, 9</bibl></cit> (cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">extra provinciam ducere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:49:16:12:section=1" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 49, 16, 12, § 1</bibl></cit>).—</sense><sense id="n15174.10" n="4" level="3"> In midwifery, t. t., <hi rend="ital">to assist at birth</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">attractus infantem educit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:7:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 7, 29 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">per ipsas manus (infans) commode educitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:ib" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib.</bibl></cit>— So of birds, to bring out of the egg, <hi rend="ital">to hatch</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pullos suos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:1:2:143" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 1, 2, 143</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">fetum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:152" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 54, 75, § 152</bibl></cit> (with excludere); 9, 10, 12, § 37.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n15174.11" n="b" level="4"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n15174.12" n="(a)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">To bring up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rear</hi>, a child (usually with reference to bodily nurture and support; while 2. educo refers usually to the mind; but the distinction is not strictly observed; cf. Krebs, Antibarb. p. 395), <hi rend="ital">to educate</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">non possunt militares pueri setanio educier,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:5:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 5, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bene ego istam eduxi meae domi et pudice,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:4:2:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Curc. 4, 2, 32</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:1:3:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Most. 1, 3, 29</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:1:3:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rud. 1, 3, 38</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:5:4:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 5, 4, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:2:1:14 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Heaut. 2, 1, 14 al.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:28:124" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 28, 124</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 39 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:43" default="NO" valid="yes">21, 43</bibl> Drak.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 4</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">41</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3:9:51" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 3, 9, 51</bibl> (4, 8, 51 M.); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:763" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 763</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">8, 413</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:3:10:16" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 3, 10, 16</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:3:12:16 al" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 3, 12, 16 al.</bibl>—<usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">senex plane eductus in nutricatu Venerio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:3:1:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 3, 1, 55</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n15174.13" n="(b)" level="5"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">to bear</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to produce</hi> = edere, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:765" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 765</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">779</bibl>: aura educit colores, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:64:90" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 64, 90</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n15174.14" n="5" level="3"> In vulg. lang., <hi rend="ital">to drink off</hi>, <hi rend="ital">toss off</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:5:5:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Stich. 5, 5, 18</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">5, 6, 1</bibl>.—With a punning allusion to the signif. 4. b. <foreign lang="greek">a</foreign>, <cb n="EDUR" /> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:1:274" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 1, 1, 274</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n15174.15" n="B" level="2"> Since the Aug. period. </sense><sense id="n15174.16" n="1" level="3"> Of motion in an upward direction (cf. effero and erigo), <hi rend="ital">to draw up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to raise</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">(Ortygia me) superas eduxit sub auras,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:5:641" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 5, 641</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">3, 113</bibl>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">trop.: (Pindarus) vires animumque moresque aureos educit in astra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:2:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 2, 23</bibl></cit> (cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">sustulit in astra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:2:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 2, 25</bibl></cit>).—</sense><sense id="n15174.17" n="b" level="4"> With the accessory idea of making, <hi rend="ital">to rear</hi>, <hi rend="ital">erect</hi>, <hi rend="ital">build up</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">turrim summis sub astra Eductam tectis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:461" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 461</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">aram sepulcri caelo,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 178</bibl></cit>; imitated by <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:15:388" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 15, 388</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">molem caelo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:186" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 186</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">turres altius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:12:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 12, 16</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 4, 30</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">pyramides instar montium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 2, 61</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">moenia caminis Cyclopum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:630" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 630</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">moles quam eductam in Rhenum retulimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:5:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 5, 18</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n15174.18" n="2" level="3"> Of time, <hi rend="ital">to pass</hi>, <hi rend="ital">spend</hi> (cf. duco, II. B. 3. b.): <cit><quote lang="la">pios annos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:9:47" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2, 9, 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">insomnem noctem ludo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:2:74" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 2, 74</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">somnos sub hiberno caelo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:11:405" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 11, 405</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nimbos luxu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:2:371" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 2, 371</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n15175" type="main" key="e_du^co2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ēdŭco</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>1. educo, II. A. 4. b.</etym>, <sense id="n15175.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to bring up</hi> a child physically or mentally, <hi rend="ital">to rear</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to educate</hi> (very freq. and class.): educit obstetrix, educat nutrix, instituit paedagogus, docet magister, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 447, 33</bibl> (but this distinction is not strictly observed; see the foll. and 1. educo, II. A. 4. b.). </sense><sense id="n15175.1" n="I" level="1"> Prop.: <cit><quote lang="la">hera educavit (puellam) magna industria,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:prol. 44 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cas. prol. 44 sq.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Athenis natus altusque educatusque Atticis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:3:4:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rud. 3, 4, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bene pudiceque educatu'st usque ad adolescentiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:5:3:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Capt. 5, 3, 16</bibl></cit> et saep.; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:5:5:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Men. 5, 5, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:2:4:111 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Trin. 2, 4, 111 al.</bibl>; Att. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 422, 14</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:1:2:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 1, 2, 37</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:3:4:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ad. 3, 4, 49</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:20:75" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 20, 75</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:21" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 2, 21</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 31</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:6:487" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 6, 487</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:314" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 3, 314</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,027:22:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Psa. 22, 2</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n15175.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to bring up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rear</hi>, <hi rend="ital">foster</hi>, <hi rend="ital">train</hi>, <hi rend="ital">educate</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque enim hac nos patria lege genuit aut educavit, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:4" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:chapter=13" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 13 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ars dicendi ea, quae sunt orta jam in nobis et procreata, educat atque confirmat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:87:356" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 87, 356</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in his (scholis) educatur orator,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:2:81" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 2, 81</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oratorem, id. prooem. § 5: illos in disciplina,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Ephes. 6, 4</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n15175.3" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose, of plants or animals, <hi rend="ital">to nourish</hi>, <hi rend="ital">support</hi>, <hi rend="ital">produce</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod pontus, quod terra, quod educat aër Poscit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:832" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 832</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Pont. 1, 10, 9</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">vitis mitem uvam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:62:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 62, 50</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pomum, non uvas (ager),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Pont. 1, 3, 51</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">herbas (humus),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:97" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 15, 97</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Caecuba,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:173" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 37, 67, § 173</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">florem (imber),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:62:41 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 62, 41 al.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lepores, apros,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 15, 22</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n15175.4" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To possess</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hold</hi> (cf. nutrire = <foreign lang="greek">tre/fein</foreign>), <bibl default="NO"><author>Verg.</author> Cul. 13</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
eductio: <entryFree id="n15176" type="main" key="e_ducti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ēductĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>1. educo</etym>, <sense id="n15176.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a moving out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">removal</hi>, <hi rend="ital">emigration</hi> (ante- and postclass.): <cit><quote lang="la">e castris, Cato ap. Fest. s. v. PROPERAM, p. 253, 33 Müll.: in qua eductione,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 4, 10, 6</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n15176.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A stretching forth</hi>, <hi rend="ital">formation</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">si unius uberis eductione pendebunt (sc. apum agmina),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> 7, 7, 6</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
eductor: <entryFree id="n15177" type="hapax" key="e_ductor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ēductor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>1. educo, II. A. 4. b.</etym>, <sense id="n15177.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a bringer-up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">tutor</hi> (for the usual educator), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1248,001:Ep. ad Amic. 15" default="NO"><author>Fronto</author> Ep. ad Amic. 15</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
edulco: <entryFree id="n15178" type="hapax" key="e_dulco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ē-dulco</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n15178.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to sweeten</hi>: vitam, Matius ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:15:25:2" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 15, 25, 2</bibl>, and ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 106, 25</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
edulia: <entryFree id="n15179" type="main" key="E^du_li^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ĕdūlĭa</orth> and <orth extent="full" lang="la">Ĕdūlĭca</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, v. Edusa.</entryFree>
edulis: <entryFree id="n15180" type="main" key="e^du_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĕdūlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>1. edo</etym>, <sense id="n15180.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">eatable</hi> (rare). </sense><sense id="n15180.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Adj.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">capreae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:4:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 4, 43</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n15180.2" n="II" level="1"> <pos>Subst.</pos>, in the <number>plur.</number>, <orth extent="full" lang="la">edulia</orth>, <itype>ium</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">eatables</hi>, <hi rend="ital">food</hi> (for syn. cf.: alimenta, cibus, cibaria, esca, penus, victus, opsonium, pulmentum, etc.), Afran. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 28, 30</bibl>; Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 108, 22</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:40" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 40</bibl> Oud. <hi rend="ital">N. cr.;</hi> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:1:16:6" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 1, 16, 6 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:7:16:4" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 7, 16, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:17:11" default="NO">17, 11</bibl> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 6:section=84" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 6, § 84</bibl> Müll.—In the postclass. per., heterocl., <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi> eduliorum, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 5, p. 160</bibl>; <case>dat.</case> eduliis, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:19:9:3" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 19, 9, 3</bibl>; <hi rend="ital">nom. sing.</hi> <orth extent="full" lang="la">edulium</orth>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Fulg.</author> 565, 9</bibl>; and perh. also <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 7:section=61" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 7, § 61</bibl> Müll. <hi rend="ital">N. cr.;</hi> whence <case>abl.</case> edulio, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,001:25:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Gen. 25, 34</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,003:7:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Lev. 7, 18</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
edulium: <entryFree id="n15181" type="main" key="e^du_li^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĕdūlĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <sense id="n15181.0" n="I" level="1"><xr><lbl>v.</lbl> <ref type="sym" targOrder="U">the preced.</ref></xr> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
eduresco: <entryFree id="n15182" type="hapax" key="e_du_resco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ē-dūresco</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, <sense id="n15182.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. inch. n.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to grow hard</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Acut. 2:34:182" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Acut. 2, 34, 182</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
eduro: <entryFree id="n15183" type="main" key="e_du_ro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ē-dūro</orth>, <itype>āre, 1</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> and <sense id="n15183.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a.</hi> </sense><sense id="n15183.1" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Neut.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to last out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">continue</hi>, <hi rend="ital">endure</hi> (post-Aug. and very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">solis fulgor in ortus edurat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,002:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> G. 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ulla effigies litterarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:14:1:18" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 14, 1, 18</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n15183.2" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to harden</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:11:1:7" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 11, 1, 7</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
edurus: <entryFree id="n15184" type="main" key="e_du_rus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ē-dūrus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n15184.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">exceedingly hard</hi>, <hi rend="ital">very hard</hi> (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">pirus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:145" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 145</bibl></cit>. —<usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">harsh</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cruel</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">eduro ore negare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:3:476" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 3, 476</bibl></cit>. <pb n="628" /> <cb n="EFFE" /></sense></entryFree>
edusa: <entryFree id="n15185" type="main" key="E^du_sa"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ĕdūsa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>1. edo</etym>, <sense id="n15185.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the goddess that presides over children's food</hi>, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 108, 22</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>August.</author> Civ. D. 4, 34</bibl>; called also <orth extent="full" lang="la">Ĕdūlĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, Don. <bibl default="NO"><author>Ter.</author> Ph. 1, 1, 15</bibl>; <orth extent="full" lang="la">Ĕdūlĭca</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <bibl default="NO"><author>August.</author> Civ. D. 4, 11</bibl>; and <orth extent="full" lang="la">Ĕdūla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> ad Nat. 2, 11</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
eetion: <entryFree id="n15186" type="main" key="E_e^ti^on"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ēĕtĭon</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*)heti/wn</foreign>, <sense id="n15186.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the father of Andromache</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and king of Thebe</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in Cilicia</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:5:5:44" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 5, 5, 44</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:4:280" default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 4, 280</bibl>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Ēĕtĭōnēus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">pertaining to Eëtion</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Thebae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:12:110" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 12, 110</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
effabilis: <entryFree id="n15187" type="main" key="effa_bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">effābĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>effor</etym>, <sense id="n15187.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that may be uttered</hi>, <hi rend="ital">utterable</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">nemini effabilis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Mag. p. 315, 41</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
effaecatus: <entryFree id="n15188" type="hapax" key="effaeca_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ef-faecātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>ex-faex</etym>, <sense id="n15188.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">purified from the dregs</hi>, <hi rend="ital">refined;</hi> trop.: <cit><quote lang="la">voluptas animi (with purgata),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Dogm. Plat. 2</bibl></cit>, pp. 22, 37.</sense></entryFree>
effafilatum: <entryFree id="n15189" type="gloss" key="effafilatum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">effafilatum</orth>, <itype>exertum, quod scilicet omnes exerto brachio sint exfilati, id est extra vestimentum filo contextum</itype>, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=83:6" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 83, 6</bibl>, v. Müll. ad h. l.</entryFree>
effamen: <entryFree id="n15190" type="main" key="effa_men"><orth extent="full" lang="la">effāmen</orth>, <itype>ĭnis</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>effor</etym>, <sense id="n15190.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an enunciation</hi>, <hi rend="ital">proposition</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 4, § 327</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
effarcio: <entryFree id="n15191" type="main" key="effarci^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ef-farcĭo</orth> and <orth extent="full" lang="la">-fercio</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">ec-f-</orth>), no <sense id="n15191.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">perf.</hi>, <itype>fertus, 4</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">to stuff</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cram</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fill out</hi> (very rare): intervalla grandibus saxis, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:23:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 23, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">bibite, este, ecfercite vos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:1:1:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 1, 1, 62</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">effer-tus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">filled out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">full</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ample</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">fame effertus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:3:1:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 3, 1, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hereditas effertissima,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 1, 8</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:2:2:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> As. 2, 2, 16</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
effascinatio: <entryFree id="n15192" type="main" key="effasci^na_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">effascĭnātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>effascino</etym>, <sense id="n15192.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a bewitching</hi>, <hi rend="ital">charming;</hi> in the <number>plur.</number>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:19:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 19, 4, 19, § 50</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:145" default="NO" valid="yes">37, 10, 54, § 145</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
effascino: <entryFree id="n15193" type="main" key="effasci^no"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ef-fascĭno</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n15193.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to bewitch</hi>, <hi rend="ital">charm</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fascinate</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 2, 2, § 16</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:9:4:7" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 9, 4, 7</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
effatio: <entryFree id="n15194" type="gloss" key="effa_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">effātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>effor</etym>, <sense id="n15194.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a speaking</hi>, acc. to <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> Verg. A. 3, 463</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
effatum: <entryFree id="n15195" type="main" key="effa_tum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">effātum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, v. effor <sense id="n15195.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
effatus: <entryFree id="n15196" type="main" key="effa_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">effātus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>effor</etym>, <sense id="n15196.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a speaking</hi> (postclass.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Anim. 6</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
effecte: <entryFree id="n15197" type="main" key="effecte"><orth extent="full" lang="la">effecte</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, <sense id="n15197.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">in fact</hi>, <hi rend="ital">really; effectually</hi>, v. <itype>efficio</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos>, 2. <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
effectio: <entryFree id="n15198" type="main" key="effecti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">effectĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>efficio</etym> (only in the philos. lang. of Cicero). <sense id="n15198.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A doing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">performing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">effecting</hi>, <hi rend="ital">practising</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">artis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:3:7:24" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 3, 7, 24</bibl></cit>: recta (a transl. of <foreign lang="greek">kato/rqwsis</foreign>), <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 14, 45</bibl>.—* </sense><sense id="n15198.1" n="II" level="1"> I. q. causa efficiens, <hi rend="ital">the producing</hi> or <hi rend="ital">efficient cause</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 1, 2, 6</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
effectivus: <entryFree id="n15199" type="main" key="effecti_vus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">effectīvus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n15199.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">effective</hi>, <hi rend="ital">productive</hi>: causa, velut pater filii, Boëth. in Porphyr. 2, p. 58 al.—Esp. as, <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">effectīva</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> (sc. ars), <hi rend="ital">practical art</hi>, <hi rend="ital">productive art</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sed effectivae quoque aliquid simile scriptis orationibus consequetur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:18:5" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 18, 5</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
effector: <entryFree id="n15200" type="main" key="effector"><orth extent="full" lang="la">effector</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n15200.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an effecter</hi>, <hi rend="ital">producer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">author</hi> (a Ciceronian word), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,072:chapter=5" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Univ. 5 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:26" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 2, 26</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:33:150" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 33, 150</bibl> (quoted in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:3:1" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 3, 1</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">for which,</quote> <trans><tr>perfector</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 60 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>).</sense></entryFree>
effectorius: <entryFree id="n15201" type="main" key="effecto_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">effectōrĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>effector</etym>, <sense id="n15201.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">effectual</hi>, <hi rend="ital">resistless</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>August.</author> Immort. Anim. 14</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">15</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Gen. ad Lit. Op. Imp. 4, 16</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
effectrix: <entryFree id="n15202" type="main" key="effectrix"><orth extent="full" lang="la">effectrix</orth>, <itype>īcis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n15202.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">she who effects</hi>, <hi rend="ital">produces</hi>, <hi rend="ital">causes;</hi> perh. only <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:17:55" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 2, 17, 55</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,072:10:32" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Univ. 10, 32</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
effectus: <entryFree id="n15203" type="main" key="effectus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">effectus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> and <pos>P. a.</pos>, from efficio.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n15204" type="main" key="effectus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">effectus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>efficio</etym>, <sense id="n15204.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a doing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">effecting.</hi> </sense><sense id="n15204.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">execution</hi>, <hi rend="ital">accomplishment</hi>, <hi rend="ital">performance</hi>: ad effectum consiliorum pervenire, Planc. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:10:8:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 10, 8, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">operis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad effectum aliquid adducere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:33:33:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 33, 33, 8</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">spei,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 21, 57</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3:9:27" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 3, 9, 27</bibl> (4, 8, 27 M.): <cit><quote lang="la">ut peccatum est, patriam prodere, etc., quae sunt in effectu: sic timere, etc., peccatum est, etiam sine effectu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:3:9:32" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 3, 9, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">effectum consilii morata tempestas est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:8:13:22" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 8, 13, 22</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">cum opera (sc. oppugnationis) in effectu erant, i. e. near completion,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:31:46:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 31, 46, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec verba, QVOD STATVERIT, cum effectu accipimus, non verbotenus,</quote> <trans><tr>in effect</tr>, <tr>in fact</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:2:2:1" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 2, 2, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum effectu,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Paul.</author> ib. 40, 7, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n15204.2" n="II" level="1"> In partic., with reference to the result of an action, <hi rend="ital">an operation</hi>, <hi rend="ital">effect</hi>, <hi rend="ital">tendency</hi>, <hi rend="ital">purpose</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quarum (herbarum) vim et effectum videres,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:20:47" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 20, 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Q, cujus similis effectu specieque Koppa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:4:9" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 4, 9</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:27:144" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 27, 13, 119, § 144</bibl>: <cb n="EFFE" /> effectus eloquentiae est audientium approbatio, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:2:1:3" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 2, 1, 3</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:17:25" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 17, 25</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:18:2" default="NO">2, 18, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne sine ullo effectu aestas extraheretur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:32:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 32, 9 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:34:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 34, 26</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:22" default="NO" valid="yes">40, 22</bibl> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum plura argumenta ad unum effectum deducuntur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:2:103" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 2, 103</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:4:9" default="NO">1, 4, 9</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut res haberet effectum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Judic. 18, 5</bibl></cit>.—In the <number>plur.</number>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:10:6" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 10, 6</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
effecundo: <entryFree id="n15205" type="hapax" key="effe_cundo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ef-fēcundo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">effoec-</orth>), <itype>āre, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n15205.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to make fruitful</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to fertilize</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Vop.</author> Prob. 21</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
effeminate: <entryFree id="n15206" type="main" key="effe_mi^na_te"><orth extent="full" lang="la">effēmĭnāte</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. effemino, <sense id="n15206.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">P. a. fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
effeminatio: <entryFree id="n15207" type="main" key="effe_mi^na_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">effēmĭnātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>effemino</etym>, <sense id="n15207.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">effeminacy</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">corporis, Firm. Math. 7, 16: animi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> in Isa. 14, 52, 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
effeminatus: <entryFree id="n15208" type="main" key="effe_mi^na_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">effēmĭnātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> and <pos>P. a.</pos>, from effemino.</entryFree>
effemino: <entryFree id="n15209" type="main" key="effe_mi^no"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ef-fēmĭno</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>femina</etym>, <sense id="n15209.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to make feminine.</hi> * </sense><sense id="n15209.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">effeminarunt eum (sc. aërem) Junonique tribuerunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:26:66" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 26, 66</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n15209.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to make womanish</hi>, <hi rend="ital">effeminate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to enervate</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">fortitudinis praecepta sunt, quae effeminari virum vetant in dolore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:29:94" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 2, 29, 94</bibl></cit>: corpus animumque virilem, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 11:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 11, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">animos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 1, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">homines (with remollescere),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 2</bibl></cit> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">cogitationibus mollissimis effeminamur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:40" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vultus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:in Clod. Fragm. 5, p. 153" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. in Clod. Fragm. 5, p. 153</bibl></cit> ed. Orell.: <cit><quote lang="la">illa elocutio res ipsas effeminat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8</bibl></cit> prooëm. § 20.—</sense><sense id="n15209.3" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Meton.</usg> (causa pro effectu), <hi rend="ital">to dishonor</hi>, <hi rend="ital">disgrace</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> in Eutrop. 1, 10</bibl>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">effēmĭnātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos> </sense><sense id="n15209.4" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Womanish</hi>, <hi rend="ital">effeminate</hi> (cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">mollis, luxuriosus, dissolutus): ne quid effeminatum aut molle sit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:35:129" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 35, 129</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:4:30" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 4, 30</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">intolerabile est servire impuro, impudico, effeminato,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:3:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 3, 5</bibl></cit>; so <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi>, Col. praef. § 15; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">histrio,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Spect. 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">furialis illa vox, religiosis altaribus effeminata,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:35:86" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Planc. 35, 86</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">effeminata ac levis opinio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:2:22:52" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 2, 22, 52</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">effeminata et enervis compositio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:4:142" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 4, 142</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:8:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1, 8, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:5:10 al" default="NO">2, 5, 10 al.</bibl>—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">multitudo Cypriorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:9:3" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 9, 3</bibl></cit> <hi rend="ital">fin.—Sup.</hi>: animi languor, Q. Cic. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:16:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 16, 27</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n15209.5" n="B" level="2"> In mal. part., <hi rend="ital">that submits to unnatural lust</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pathicus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:68" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 68</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Priap.</author> 58, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,013:14:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 3 Reg. 14, 24</bibl> al.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">effēmĭnāte</orth>, <hi rend="ital">effeminately</hi> (acc. to A.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:4" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 4 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Cons. ad Polyb. 36" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Cons. ad Polyb. 36</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:2:7:9" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 2, 7, 9</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
efferasco: <entryFree id="n15210" type="hapax" key="effe^rasco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">effĕrasco</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, <sense id="n15210.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. inch. n.</hi> [2. effero], <hi rend="ital">to become savage</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fierce</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 18, 7, 5</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
efferate: <entryFree id="n15211" type="main" key="effe^ra_te"><orth extent="full" lang="la">effĕrāte</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. 2. effero, <sense id="n15211.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">P. a. fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
efferatio: <entryFree id="n15212" type="main" key="effe^ra_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">effĕrātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>effero</etym>, <sense id="n15212.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a making savage</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> Ep. 107, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
efferatus: <entryFree id="n15213" type="main" key="effe^ra_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">effĕrātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> and <pos>P. a.</pos>, from 2. effero.</entryFree>
effercio: <entryFree id="n15214" type="main" key="efferci^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">effercĭo</orth>, v. effarcio.</entryFree>
efferitas: <entryFree id="n15215" type="main" key="effe^ri^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">effĕrĭtas</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">ecf-</orth>), <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>efferus</etym>, <sense id="n15215.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an excessively wild state</hi>, <hi rend="ital">wildness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">degeneracy</hi> (opp. mansuetudo), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:42:91" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sest. 42, 91</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quas (terras) peragrans undique omnem ecferitatem expuli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:Poet. 2:8:20" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. Poet. 2, 8, 20 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit> (al. feritatem); <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> Mort. Pers. 9, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
effero: <entryFree id="n15216" type="main" key="effe^ro1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ef-fĕro</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">ecfĕro</orth> (cf. Neue, Formenl. 2, 766), extŭli, ēlatum, efferre or <itype>ecferre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n15216.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to bring</hi> or <hi rend="ital">carry out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to bring forth</hi> (very freq. and class.). </sense><sense id="n15216.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n15216.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">ex navi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:2:1:82" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 2, 1, 82</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">tela, etc., ex aedibus Cethegi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:3:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 3, 3 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">argentum jubeo jam intus efferri foras,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:1:1:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 1, 1, 62</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 9, 127</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:2:1:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Most. 2, 1, 58</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:4:8:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 4, 8, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">argentum ad aliquem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Epid. 5, 1, 27</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:3:1:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Truc. 3, 1, 16</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">machaeram huc,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:2:5:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 2, 5, 53</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:2:2:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Stich. 2, 2, 28</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">puerum extra aedes usquam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:4:1:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Hec. 4, 1, 48</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cistellam domo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:4:6:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Eun. 4, 6, 15</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">cibaria sibi quemque domo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:5:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 5, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">frumentum ab Ilerda,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:78:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 1, 78, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">piscem de custodia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:8:17" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 8, 17 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">litteras,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:45:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 45, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mucronem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:2:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 2, 1, 2</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">vexilla, signa, arma (e castris, extra fines, etc.),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 10, 19</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:2" default="NO" valid="yes">27, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:29:21" default="NO" valid="yes">29, 21</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:3:31 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 3, 31 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ferrum a latere deripuit, elatumque deferebat in pectus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 1, 35 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: Colchis pedem, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 297, 20</bibl>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">pedem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:657" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 657</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">pedem aedibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:3:3:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 3, 3, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pedem portā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:6:8:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 6, 8, 5</bibl></cit>;
