<bibl default="NO">7, 2, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:38" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 38</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">pedem quoquam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:2:3:97" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 2, 3, 97</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se hinc (ignis),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:89" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 89</bibl></cit> and 385: <cit><quote lang="la">se vallo (equus),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:15:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 15, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Furium longius extulit cursus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 5</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">Messium impetus per hostes extulit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 4, 29</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n15216.3" n="B" level="2"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n15216.4" n="1" level="3"> Like the Gr. <foreign lang="greek">e)kfe/rw</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">to carry out</hi> (of the house) <hi rend="ital">for burial</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to bear to the</hi> <cb n="EFFE" /> <hi rend="ital">grave</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to bury</hi> (cf.: cremo, humo, sepelio, prosequor): optumum'st Loces illum efferendum; <cit><quote lang="la">nam jam credo mortuus est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:3:6:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 3, 6, 32</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:4:3:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Most. 4, 3, 8</bibl> sqq.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:1:1:90" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 1, 1, 90</bibl> Don. and Ruhnk.; 1, 1, 101; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:32:80" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 3, 32, 80</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,025:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Att. 17</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 33</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:18" default="NO" valid="yes">3, 18</bibl> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:5:21" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 5, 21</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:99" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 99</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:5:85" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 5, 85</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,003:7:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Luc. 7, 12</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n15216.5" n="b" level="4"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>: meo unius funere elata populi Romani esset res publica, <hi rend="ital">carried to burial</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">overthrown</hi>, <hi rend="ital">destroyed</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 28, 28</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:22" default="NO" valid="yes">24, 22</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:31:29" default="NO" valid="yes">31, 29</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n15216.6" n="2" level="3"> Of a fruit-bearing soil, <hi rend="ital">to bring forth</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bear</hi>, <hi rend="ital">produce</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">id, quod agri efferant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:4" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 2, 4 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:4:16" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 4, 16</bibl>; cf. also <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 47 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl default="NO">86 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n15216.7" n="b" level="4"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">ea, quae efferant aliquid ex sese, perfectiores habere naturas quam, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:33" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 33 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:109" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 1, 109</bibl>; <usg type="style">poet.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">(Italia) genus acre virum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:169" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 169</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n15216.8" n="3" level="3"> Of motion in an upward direction (cf.: erigo and educo, II. B. 1.), <hi rend="ital">to lift up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">elevate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">raise</hi>, <hi rend="ital">exalt</hi>, Lucil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 297, 25</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem in murum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 47 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pars operis in altitudinem turris elata,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 2, 8 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:103" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 103</bibl>; and <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:32" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 32</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">corvus e conspectu elatus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 7, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pulvis elatus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 4, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">elata super capita scuta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:3:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 3, 27</bibl></cit>: jubar (luna), Petron. Poët. 89, 2, 54; <usg type="style">poet.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">caput Auctumnus agris extulit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:2:18" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 2, 18</bibl></cit>.</sense><sense id="n15216.9" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n15216.10" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To set forth</hi>, <hi rend="ital">spread abroad</hi>, <hi rend="ital">utter</hi>, <hi rend="ital">publish</hi>, <hi rend="ital">proclaim</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">clamorem,</quote> <trans><tr>to raise</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:1:73" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 1, 1, 73</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod neque in vulgum disciplinam efferri velint, neque, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:6:14:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 6, 14, 4</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:12:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 12, 9</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">vocem ejus in vulgus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:12:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 12, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tuum peccatum foras,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:5:7:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 5, 7, 65</bibl></cit> Ruhnk.: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc foras,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:10:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 10, 3</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">clandestina consilia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:1:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 1, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 2, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">has meas ineptias,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:24:111" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 24, 111</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">divinitus dicta,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 1</bibl></cit> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi> et saep.—With a <hi rend="ital">rel. clause</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">posteaquam in volgus militum elatum est, qua arrogantia in colloquio Ariovistus usus, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:46:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 46, 4</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n15216.11" n="2" level="3"> In partic., of speech, <hi rend="ital">to utter</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pronounce</hi>, <hi rend="ital">express</hi>, <hi rend="ital">declare</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">verbum de verbo expressum extulit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:prol. 11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. prol. 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut verba inter se ra tione conjuncta sententiam efferant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 8:section=1" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 8, § 1</bibl></cit> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">si graves sententiae inconditis verbis efferuntur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:44:150" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 44, 150</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:4:13" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 4, 13</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae incisim aut membratim efferuntur, ea, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:chapter=67" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 67</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:4:33" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 4, 33</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:3:40" default="NO">8, 3, 40</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:2:17" default="NO">10, 2, 17</bibl>: pleraque utroque modo efferuntur, <hi rend="ital">luxuriatur</hi>, <hi rend="ital">luxuriat</hi>, etc., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:3:7" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 9, 3, 7</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:5:16" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1, 5, 16</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:64" default="NO">64</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:14:2" default="NO">2, 14, 2</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n15216.12" n="B" level="2"> In the <hi rend="ital">pass.</hi>, qs. to be carried out of one's self by passions, feelings, etc.; <hi rend="ital">to be carried away</hi>, <hi rend="ital">transported</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hurried away</hi>: usque adeo studio atque odio illius efferor ira, Lucil. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:4:21" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 4, 21 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">studio,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> de Sen. 23, 83</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:8:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 1, 8, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:20" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 1, 20 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:45:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 45, 2</bibl>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">cupiditate,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:24:49" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 24, 49</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vi naturae atque ingenii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:31:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mur. 31, 65</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">laetitia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,034:9:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Deiot. 9, 26</bibl></cit> (cf. <hi rend="ital">act.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">comitia ista praeclara, quae me laetitia extulerunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:2:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 2, 10</bibl></cit>): <cit><quote lang="la">incredibili gaudio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:10:12:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 10, 12, 2</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:3:30" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 3, 30</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:22" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 22</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">voluptate canendi ac saltandi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:54" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Calig. 54</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">popularitate,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:53" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ner. 53</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n15216.13" n="C" level="2"> (Acc. to I. B. 3.) <hi rend="ital">To raise</hi>, <hi rend="ital">elevate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">exalt</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pretia alicujus rei,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 3:6" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 3, 6 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quorum animi altius se extulerunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:3:3" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 3, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem ad summum imperium per omnes honorum gradus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:1:11:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cat. 1, 11, 28</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem supra leges,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 34</bibl></cit>; and: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem geminatis consulatibus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 3</bibl></cit>; cf. also <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 40</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem pecunia aut honore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 49:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 49, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">patriam demersam extuli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,015:31:87" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sull. 31, 87</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Dion. 6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Dion. 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,025:14:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Prov. Cons. 14, 34</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem maximis laudibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:10:36" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 2, 10, 36</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:87" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 87</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem summis laudibus ad caelum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:9:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 9, 14</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Dion. 7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Dion. 7 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid maximis laudibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:7:24" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 7, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem laudibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:3:72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 3, 72</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem verbis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:14:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 14, 52</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid versibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:14" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 1, 14</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">and simply aliquid,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 56</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 63</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem in summum odium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 4, 42</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">rem in summam invidiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:4:19" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 4, 19</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n15216.14" n="2" level="3"> In partic., with <hi rend="ital">se</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to raise</hi>, <hi rend="ital">elevate one's self; to rise</hi>, <hi rend="ital">advance</hi> (cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">appareo, eluceo, exsisto): cum (virtus) se extulit et ostendit suum lumen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:chapter=27" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 27</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">so with a figure borrowed from the heavenly bodies: qua in urbe (Athenis) primum se orator extulit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:7:26" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 7, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">volo se efferat in adolescente fecunditas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 21</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n15216.15" n="b" level="4"> In a bad sense, with <hi rend="ital">se</hi>, or in the <pb n="629" /> <cb n="EFFE" /> <hi rend="ital">pass.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to lift up one's self</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to carry one's self high; to be puffed up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">haughty</hi>, <hi rend="ital">proud</hi> on account of any thing (the figure being borrowed from a prancing horse; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:30:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 30, 20</bibl>; and <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:3:10" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 3, 10</bibl>): <cit><quote lang="la">nec cohibendo efferentem se fortunam, quanto altius elatus erat, eo foedius corruit (Atilius),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:30:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 30, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod aut cupias ardenter aut adeptus ecferas te insolenter,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:4:17:39" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 4, 17, 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui enim victoria se ecferunt, quasi victos nos intuentur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:9:2:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 9, 2, 2</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">se altius et incivilius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:1:26:8" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 1, 26, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sese audacia, scelere atque superbia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 14:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 14, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hic me magnifice effero,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:4:3:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 4, 3, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(fortunati) efferuntur fere fastidio et contumacia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:15:54" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 15, 54</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se efferre in potestate,</quote> <trans><tr>to be insolent in office</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:84:342" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 84, 342</bibl></cit>.—Esp. freq. in the <hi rend="ital">part. perf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">stulta ac barbara arrogantia elati,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:59:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 59, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">recenti victoria,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:47:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. G. 5, 47, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">spe celeris victoriae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 47, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gloria,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:79:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 3, 79, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">elatus et inflatus his rebus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:35:97" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Agr. 2, 35, 97</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">secunda fortuna magnisque opibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Alcib. 7:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Alcib. 7, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:7:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Milt. 7, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">elatus ad vanam fiduciam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:3:19:10" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 3, 19, 10</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">but also: ad justam fiduciam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:8:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 27, 8, 7</bibl></cit> et saep.—In the <hi rend="ital">act.</hi> (rare, and with a fig. perh. borrowed from the wind): is demum vir erit, cujus animum nec prospera (fortuna) flatu suo efferet (<hi rend="ital">elates</hi>, <hi rend="ital">inflates</hi>), nec adversa infringet, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:45:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 45, 8 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>—</sense><sense id="n15216.16" n="D" level="2"> Ante-class. and very rare, <hi rend="ital">to carry out to the end</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to support</hi>, <hi rend="ital">endure</hi>: laborem, Att. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:chapter=48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sest. 48</bibl>; cf.: malum patiendo, <hi rend="ital">to get rid of</hi>, <hi rend="ital">do away with</hi>, Cic. Poët. Tusc. 4, 29, 63 (but not in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:141" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 141</bibl>, where the better reading is sufferre).—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">ēlā-tus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos> (acc. to I. B. 3. and II. C. 2.), <hi rend="ital">exalted</hi>, <hi rend="ital">lofty</hi>, <hi rend="ital">high</hi> (rare; cf.: superbus, insolens, arrogans, etc.). </sense><sense id="n15216.17" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">modo in elatiora modo in depressiora clivi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:2:4:10" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 2, 4, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">elatissimae lucernae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Apol. 53</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n15216.18" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">animus magnus elatusque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:18:61" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 18, 61</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:40:96" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 1, 40, 96</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">verba,</quote> <trans><tr>high-sounding</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:36:124" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 36, 124</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">hoc casu elatior Julianus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 21, 4, 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,006:1:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Rom. 1, 30</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">insula opibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:7:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Milt. 7, 2</bibl></cit>. —<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">ēlāte</orth>, <hi rend="ital">loftily</hi>, <hi rend="ital">proudly</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">elate et ample loqui, opp. humiliter demisseque sentire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:9" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 5, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dicere (opp. summisse),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,041:4:10" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Opt. Gen. 4, 10</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">se gerere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,004:2:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Paus. 2, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">elatius et arrogantius praefatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:9:15:4" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 9, 15, 4</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n15217" type="main" key="effe^ro2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ef-fĕro</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>ex-ferus</etym>, <sense id="n15217.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to make wild</hi>, <hi rend="ital">savage</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fierce</hi> (class.; most freq. since the Aug. per.). </sense><sense id="n15217.1" n="I" level="1"> Physically: <cit><quote lang="la">terram immanitate beluarum efferari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:39:99" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 39, 99</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">speciem oris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 23</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">vultum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:50" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 50</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">efferantia sese ulcera,</quote> <trans><tr>becoming aggravated</tr>, <tr>malignant</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:26:146" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 26, 14, 87, § 146</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">Mars efferat aurum,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>works up into weapons</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Achill. 1, 425</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">homo qui magnae artis subtilitate tantum efferavit argentum,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>wrought into the figures of beasts</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 5, p. 159, 14</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n15217.2" n="II" level="1"> Mentally: <cit><quote lang="la">gentes sic immanitate efferatae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:23" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 1, 23</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:4:14:32" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 4, 14, 32</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">militem dux ipse efferavit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 23, 5</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 29</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">animos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1, 19</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:26" default="NO" valid="yes">25, 26</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ingenia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:8:2" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 8, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:9:19" default="NO">9, 19</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">efferavit ea caedes Thebanos omnes ad exsecrabile odium Romanorum,</quote> <trans><tr>exasperated</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:33:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 33, 29</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,056:8:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Dan. 8, 7</bibl>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">effĕrātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">wild</hi>, <hi rend="ital">savage</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fierce</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sunt enim multa ecferata et immania, quaedam autem humanitatis quoque habent primam speciem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:4:14:32" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 4, 14, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vultus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 82, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">animi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,024:5:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 2 Macc. 5, 11</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">mores ritusque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:34:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 34, 24</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">effectus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 121:4" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 121, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">canes in homines,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1672,001:Rer. Gest. Alex. M. 3:18" default="NO"><author>Jul. Val.</author> Rer. Gest. Alex. M. 3, 18</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">effĕrāte</orth>, <hi rend="ital">fiercely</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">saevire,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 5, 20, 10</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
effertus: <entryFree id="n15218" type="main" key="effertus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">effertus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> and <pos>P. a.</pos>, from effarcio.</entryFree>
efferus: <entryFree id="n15219" type="main" key="effe^rus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ef-fĕrus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n15219.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">very wild</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fierce</hi>, <hi rend="ital">savage</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and post-class.; <cit><quote lang="la">freq. in Verg.): proles,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:604" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 604</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">juventus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:8:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 8, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Dido,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 642</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Chimaera,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 787</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mens Caci,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 8, 205</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">vis animi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 10, 898</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">corda,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:1:798" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 1, 798</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ira,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:5:517" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 5, 517</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">virtus Bebrycis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:2:648" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2, 648</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">facta tyranni,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:8:484" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 8, 484</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">facinus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Phoen. 264" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Phoen. 264</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:4:12:12" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 4, 12, 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:4:12:48" default="NO">4, 12, 48</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Element. 1:13:4" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Element. 1, 13, 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
effervens: <entryFree id="n15220" type="main" key="effervens"><orth extent="full" lang="la">effervens</orth>, <itype>entis</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> and <pos>P. a.</pos>, from effervo.</entryFree>
effervesco: <entryFree id="n15221" type="main" key="effervesco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ef-fervesco</orth>, <itype>ferbui</itype> (so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:31:77 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cael. 31, 77 al.</bibl>; ante- and post-class. fervi, Cato R. R. <cb n="EFFI" /> 115, 1; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:74" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 74</bibl>), 3, <sense id="n15221.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. inch. n.</hi> </sense><sense id="n15221.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To boil up</hi> or <hi rend="ital">over</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to foam up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to effervesce</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ferment</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to grow violent</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rage</hi> (class.). </sense><sense id="n15221.2" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">dictum fretum a similitudine ferventis aquae, quod in fretum saepe concurrat aestus atque effervescat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 7:section=22" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 7, § 22</bibl></cit> Müll.; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">aquae, quae effervescunt subditis ignibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:10:27" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 10, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ubi satis efferverit (vinum mustum),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0022,001:115:1" default="NO"><author>Cato</author> R. R. 115, 1</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:25:4" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 12, 25, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">efferbuit coctio ejus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,053:24:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Ezech. 24, 5</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n15221.3" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> (a favorite expression of Cic.): <cit><quote lang="la">illae undae comitiorum, ut mare profundum et immensum, sic efervescunt quodam quasi aestu,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Planc 6, 15</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">Pontum armatum, effervescentem in Asiam atque erumpentem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,025:4:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Prov. Cons. 4, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">luxuriae effervescentis aestus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:2:24" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 2, 24 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">verbis effervescentibus et paulo nimium redundantibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si cui nimium efferbuisse videtur hujus vis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:chapter=31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cael. 31 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:1335" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 1335</bibl>; and <bibl default="NO"><author>Tac.</author> Or. 10</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">iracundaque mens facile effervescit in ira,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:295" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 295</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:70:246" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 70, 246</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">so of an ebullition of anger,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:74" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 74 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:1:26:8" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 1, 26, 8</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">interiora mea efferbuerunt,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Job, 30, 27</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n15221.4" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">sidera coeperunt toto effervescere caelo,</quote> <trans><tr>to light up</tr>, <tr>shine out</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 71</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n15221.5" n="III" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To boil out</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">to subside</hi>, <hi rend="ital">abate</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quoad iracundia effervesceret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:21:1:17:section=4" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 21, 1, 17, § 4</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
effervo: <entryFree id="n15222" type="main" key="effervo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ef-fervo</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype> (<sense id="n15222.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">praes.</hi> effervent, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:2:6:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 2, 6, 5</bibl>), <pos>v. n.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">to boil up</hi> or <hi rend="ital">over</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose): <cit><quote lang="la">in agros Aetna,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:471" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 471</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quatenus in pullos animales vortier ova Cernimus alituum vermesque effervere, qs. to come boiling forth,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>to swarm forth</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:928" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 928</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:556" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 556</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Dir. 15</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:4:664" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 4, 664</bibl>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">effer-vens</orth>, <itype>entis</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">boiling with passion</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">fervent</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ardent</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">siquidem laetitia dicitur exsultatio quaedam animi gaudio efferventior eventu rerum expetitarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:2:27:3" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 2, 27, 3</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
effeto: <entryFree id="n15223" type="main" key="effe_to"><orth extent="full" lang="la">effēto</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">effecto</orth>), <itype>āre</itype>, <sense id="n15223.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to put out of use</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to abolish</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> Var. 9, 15</bibl> <hi rend="ital">ante med.</hi></sense></entryFree>
effetus: <entryFree id="n15224" type="main" key="effe_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ef-fētus</orth> (not effoetus), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n15224.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that has brought forth young</hi>, <hi rend="ital">that has laid eggs</hi> (mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose). </sense><sense id="n15224.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> (mostly in Col.): <cit><quote lang="la">cum effetae loca genitalia tumebunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:7:7:4" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 7, 7, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:7:12:11" default="NO">7, 12, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:9:1:7" default="NO">9, 1, 7</bibl>.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">simul effetas linquunt examina ceras,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:9:285" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 9, 285</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n15224.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Meton.</usg> (causa pro effectu). </sense><sense id="n15224.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Exhausted</hi>, <hi rend="ital">worn out by bearing</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquae (gallinae) in tantum, ut effetae moriantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:146" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 53, 74, § 146</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 53:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 53, 5</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n15224.4" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, in gen., <hi rend="ital">exhausted</hi>, <hi rend="ital">worn out</hi>: tellus, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:1150" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 1150</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">effetum et defatigatum solum, Col. praef. § 1: natura (with lassa),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:6:21:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 6, 21, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tauri senio effeti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:6:24:1" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 6, 24, 1</bibl></cit>: corpus, * <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> de Sen. 9, 29</bibl>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">vires (corporis),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:396" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 396</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">spes,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>vain</tr>, <tr>delusive</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:4:380" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 4, 380</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">verique effeta senectus,</quote> <trans><tr>incapacitated for truth</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:440" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 440</bibl></cit> (cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">Vana veri,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 10, 630</bibl></cit>).— <hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">oratio effetior,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Flor. p. 366</bibl></cit>.— <hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi> and <pos>adv.</pos> do not occur.</sense></entryFree>
efficacia: <entryFree id="n15225" type="main" key="effi^ca_ci^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">effĭcācĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>efficax</etym>, <sense id="n15225.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">efficacy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">efficiency</hi>, <hi rend="ital">virtue</hi> (post-Aug.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 5, 4, § 12</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 14, 8, 5</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">16, 12, 25</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Sirach, 9, 4</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> de Ira D. 10, 37</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
efficacitas: <entryFree id="n15226" type="main" key="effi^ca_ci^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">effĭcācĭtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n15226.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">efficacy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">efficiency</hi>, <hi rend="ital">power;</hi> perh. only <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:4:13:31" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 4, 13, 31</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0478,001:Petit. Cons. 3:10" default="NO"><author>Q. Cic.</author> Petit. Cons. 3, 10</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
efficaciter: <entryFree id="n15227" type="main" key="effi^ca_ci^ter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">effĭcācĭter</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, <sense id="n15227.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">efficaciously</hi>, <hi rend="ital">effectually</hi>, v. efficax <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
efficax: <entryFree id="n15228" type="main" key="effi^cax"><orth extent="full" lang="la">effĭcax</orth>, <itype>ācis</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>efficio</etym>, <sense id="n15228.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">efficacious</hi>, <hi rend="ital">effectual</hi>, <hi rend="ital">powerful</hi>, <hi rend="ital">efficient</hi> (mostly postAug.; not in Cic. and Caes; but cf. efficacitas): nosti Marcellum, quam tardus et parum efficax sit, Cael. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:8:10:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 8, 10, 3</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ultor contemptae religionis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:1:1:19" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 1, 1, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Hercules,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:3:17" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 3, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">scientia (magica),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 17, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">preces,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">studium promerendi amoris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:3" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 3 <hi rend="ital">init.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">breve et efficax iter est per exempla,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 6:5" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 6, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">admonitiones,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:ib. 8:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 8, 2</bibl></cit> al.: <cit><quote lang="la">herba in dolore stomachi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:27:136" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 27, 13, 109, § 136</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">preces ad muliebre ingenium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 9 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; so with <hi rend="ital">ad</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 2:7" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ben. 2, 7 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; cf. in the <hi rend="ital">comp.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:1:41" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 1, 41</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:84" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 84</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">elatine oculorum fluxionibus efficax,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:27:74" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 27, 9, 50, § 74</bibl></cit>; so with <case>dat.</case>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:204" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 28, 14, 58, § 204</bibl>; in the <hi rend="ital">sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">continuatio in peragendis rebus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:41:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 41, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">frutex efficacissimus contra sagittarum ictus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:13:115" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 13, 21, 36, § 115</bibl></cit>; cf.: herba adversus<cb n="EFFI" />  serpentium venena, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:24:130" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 24, 15, 80, § 130</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad excitandam virtutem, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:1:8:1" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 1, 8, 1</bibl></cit>. —<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>, with <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">(cadus) amara Curarum eluere efficax,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:12:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 12, 20</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:2:7:10" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 2, 7, 10</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum sit efficacissimum de integro locum exarare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:2:17:3" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 2, 17, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">efficacissimum est hic quoque salem superponere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:4:4:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 4, 4, 16</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:4:22:11" default="NO" valid="yes">4, 22, 11</bibl>.—Hence, <pos>adv.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">effĭcācĭter</orth>, <hi rend="ital">effectually</hi>, <hi rend="ital">powerfully</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:13:25" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 13, 25</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Brev. Vit. 6" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Brev. Vit. 6</bibl> et saep.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:4:8" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 4, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,002:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> G. 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:6:6:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 6, 6, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:24:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 24, 6, 14, § 23</bibl>.— <hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:26:128" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 26, 12, 79, § 128</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:24:23" default="NO" valid="yes">24, 6, 14, § 23</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:2:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ep. 2, 13 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></sense></entryFree>
efficiens: <entryFree id="n15229" type="main" key="effi^ci^ens"><orth extent="full" lang="la">effĭcĭens</orth>, <itype>entis</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> and <pos>P. a.</pos>, from efficio.</entryFree>
efficienter: <entryFree id="n15230" type="main" key="effi^ci^enter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">effĭcĭenter</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, <sense id="n15230.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">efficiently</hi>, v. <itype>efficio</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos> 1.</sense></entryFree>
efficientia: <entryFree id="n15231" type="main" key="effi^ci^enti^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">effĭcĭentĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>efficio</etym>, <sense id="n15231.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">efficient power</hi>, <hi rend="ital">efficiency</hi>, <hi rend="ital">influence</hi> (rare; <cit><quote lang="la">mostly in philos. lang.),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:37:95" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 37, 95</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,054:9:19" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fat. 9, 19</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">spiritalis, Hil. in Psa. 131, 24: inenarrabilis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Trin. 3, 18</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> Opif. D. 19, 7</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
efficio: <entryFree id="n15232" type="main" key="effi^ci^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ef-fĭcĭo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">ecfacio</orth>), <itype>fēci, fectum, 3</itype> (<sense id="n15232.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">perf. subj.</hi> effexis, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:3:5:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 3, 5, 63</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:1:3:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Poen. 1, 3, 19</bibl>; <hi rend="ital">inf. pass.</hi> ecfiĕri, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:5:1:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pers. 5, 1, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:761" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 761</bibl>), <pos>v. a.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">to make out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">work out;</hi> hence, <hi rend="ital">to bring to pass</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to effect</hi>, <hi rend="ital">execute</hi>, <hi rend="ital">complete</hi>, <hi rend="ital">accomplish</hi>, <hi rend="ital">make</hi>, <hi rend="ital">form</hi> (very freq. in all periods and sorts of writing). </sense><sense id="n15232.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen. </sense><sense id="n15232.2" n="(a)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">male quod mulier facere incepit, nisi id ecficere perpetrat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:2:5:12 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 2, 5, 12 sq.</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:5:1:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pers. 5, 1, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 36 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 61, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">magna facinora,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:2:1:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 2, 1, 16</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">facinora,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:42:109" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 2, 42, 109</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">opus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 1, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:5:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 5, 17</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:4:18:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 4, 18, 1</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">7, 35, 4</bibl> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">pontem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 6, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:40:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 1, 40, 1</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 62</bibl> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ligneas turres, tormenta,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 9, 3</bibl></cit>; 3, 39 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">castella,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 44, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">panes ex hoc (genere radicis),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 48, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sphaeram (Archimedes),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:17" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">columnam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 56</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">Mosa insulam efficit Batavorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:4:10:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 4, 10, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib.</bibl> § 4; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:40:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 3, 40, 4</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">portum (insula),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 112, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:160" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 160</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">magnum numerum cratium, scalarum, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:81:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 81, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid dignum dono deorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:3:3" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 3, 3</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:26:120" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 26, 120</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">civitatem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:30" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 2, 30</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 32</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">varios concentus, septem sonos,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">magnas rerum commutationes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:68:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 68, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tantos progressus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:78:272" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 78, 272</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">clamores et admirationes in bonis oratoribus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:33:152" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 33, 152</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:3:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Q. Fr. 3, 1, 3</bibl> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">XIII. cohortes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:15:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 15, 5</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">delectu habito duas legiones,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 31, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">unam ex duabus (legionibus),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 89, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad duo milia ferme boum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 22, 16</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">lepide meum officium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:4:2:1 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 4, 2, 1 sq.</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">nostra munia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:5:4:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Stich. 5, 4, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">munus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:46" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 46 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:1:5:16" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Leg. 1, 5, 16</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nuptias alicui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:3:4:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 3, 4, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aurum alicui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:2:2:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 2, 2, 55</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:1:1:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Poen. 1, 1, 57</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:3:3:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 3, 3, 23</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">hanc mulierem tibi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:1:110" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 1, 1, 110</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">quod a Curione effeceram,</quote> <trans><tr>had procured</tr>, <tr>obtained</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:10:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 10, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amor mores hominum moros et morosos ecficit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:3:2:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 3, 2, 43</bibl></cit>.—With two <hi rend="ital">accs.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">fortuna eos efficit caecos, quos complexa est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:15:54" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 15, 54</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:1:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 1, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:42" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 2, 42</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:3:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 3, 24 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl> et saep.; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">hunc (montem) murus circumdatus arcem efficit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 38, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem consulem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:20:73" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 20, 73</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem dictatorem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:15:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 15, 21</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">also: quae res immani corporum magnitudine homines efficit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:4:1:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 4, 1, 9</bibl></cit>; and: <cit><quote lang="la">id (genus radicis) ad similitudinem panis efficiebant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:48:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 3, 48, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n15232.3" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">ut</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">eniti et efficere, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:16:59" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 16, 59</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:20" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 1, 20</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 31</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:2:5:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 2, 5, 5</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 17, 4</bibl> et saep.; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc si efficiam plane, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:3:3:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 3, 3, 62</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si id efficere non posset, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:50:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 50, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque polliceor me effecturum, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:24" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 24</bibl></cit> <hi rend="ital">fin. —Ellips. of ut</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">effice, di coëamus in unum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:3:683" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 3, 683</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n15232.4" n="(g)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">ne</hi> (rare): <cit><quote lang="la">efficio ne cui molesti sint publicani,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:6:1:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 6, 1, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui efficiant, ne quid inter privatum et magistratum differat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:43:67" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 1, 43, 67</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:4:4:10" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 4, 4, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:7:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 8, 7, 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">efficiam, posthac ne quemquam voce lacessas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:3:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 3, 51</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:3:3:78" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 3, 3, 78</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem or aliquid, ne, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:19:2:35" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 19, 2, 35</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:6:102" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 3, 6, 102</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:3:20" default="NO">8, 3, 20</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n15232.5" n="(d)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">quominus</hi> (very seldom), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:977" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 977</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:1:48" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 1, 48</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:49:14" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 49, 14</bibl>, <pb n="630" /> <cb n="EFFI" /> 29; so with <hi rend="ital">quo magis</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">saevitia collegae quo is magis ingenio suo gauderet effecit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:60:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 60, 1</bibl></cit>.—（<foreign lang="greek">e</foreign>) With <hi rend="ital">obj. acc.</hi> and <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi> (very rare, and not ante-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">vehementer efficit ea coire, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:2:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 2, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:38:2:14:section=8" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 38, 2, 14, § 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:47:11:10" default="NO">47, 11, 10</bibl>.—（<foreign lang="greek">z</foreign>) <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg> (freq. and class.): <cit><quote lang="la">si effecero, Dabin' mihi argentum?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:5:121" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 1, 5, 121</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 1, 39</bibl> sq.; 4, 8, 5; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:1:3:87" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pers. 1, 3, 87</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:26:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 26, 2</bibl> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">se a scientiae delectatione ad efficiendi utilitatem referre,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:5:3" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 5, 3</bibl></cit>.</sense><sense id="n15232.6" n="II" level="1"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n15232.7" n="A" level="2"> In econom. lang., <hi rend="ital">to produce</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bear</hi>, <hi rend="ital">yield</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">(ager Leontinus) plurimum efficit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 63 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ager efficit cum octavo, cum decumo,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 3, 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si (vineae) centenos sestertios in singula jugera efficiant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:3:3:3" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 3, 3, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum matres binae ternos haedos efficiunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:7:6:7" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 7, 6, 7</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Transf.</usg> to persons: <cit><quote lang="la">liciti sunt usque eo, quoad se efficere posse arbitrabantur,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>to make a profit</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 33 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n15232.8" n="B" level="2"> Of numbers, <hi rend="ital">to make out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">yield</hi>, <hi rend="ital">amount to</hi> a certain sum: <cit><quote lang="la">ea (tributa) vix, in fenus Pompeii quod satis sit, efficiunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:6:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 6, 1, 3</bibl></cit> (cf. shortly before: <cit><quote lang="la">nec id satis efficit [al. efficitur] in usuram menstruam),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:206" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 33, 38, § 206</bibl></cit>; cf. ib. § 209; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:5:2:6" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 5, 2, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:8" default="NO">8</bibl> sq.—</sense><sense id="n15232.9" n="C" level="2"> In philos. lang., <hi rend="ital">to make out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">show</hi>, <hi rend="ital">prove</hi> (with <case>acc.</case> and <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ut</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ne</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi>): <cit><quote lang="la">quod proposuit efficit, Cic. Par. prooem. § 2: in quibus (libris) vult efficere animos esse mortales,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:Tusc. 1:31" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 1, 31 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>—In the <hi rend="ital">pass. impers.</hi>: efficitur, <hi rend="ital">it follows</hi> (from something): <cit><quote lang="la">ita efficitur, ut omne corpus mortale sit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:N. D. 3:12:30" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 3, 12, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex quo efficitur, hominem naturae obedientem homini nocere non posse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:Tusc. 3:5:25" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 3, 5, 25</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ex quo illud efficitur, ne justos quidem esse natura,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:Rep. 3:11" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 3, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid igitur efficitur?</quote> <trans><tr>what follows from that?</tr></trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:ib. 3:12" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 12</bibl></cit>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n15232.10" n="1" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">effĭcĭens</orth>, <itype>entis</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos> </sense><sense id="n15232.11" n="A" level="2"> <pos>Adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">effecting</hi>, <hi rend="ital">effective</hi>, <hi rend="ital">efficient.</hi>—In philos. lang.: <cit><quote lang="la">proximus est locus rerum efficientium, quae causae appellantur: deinde rerum effectarum ab efficientibus causis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,042:chapter=14" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Top. 14 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 1, 6, 24</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:3:16:55" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 3, 16, 55</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:55:125" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 1, 55, 125</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,054:14:33" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fat. 14, 33</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:10:86" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 10, 86</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n15232.12" n="B" level="2"> <pos>Subst.</pos>, with <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>: virtus efficiens utilitatis, <hi rend="ital">the producer</hi> = effectrix, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:3:12" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 3, 3, 12</bibl>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">voluptatis (virtus),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 33</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ea, quae sunt luxuriosis efficientia voluptatum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:7:21" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 2, 7, 21</bibl></cit>; and: <cit><quote lang="la">(causae) efficientes pulcherrimarum rerum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,072:chapter=14" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Univ. 14 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>—* <hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">effĭcĭenter</orth>, <hi rend="ital">efficiently</hi> (for which in the post-Aug. per., efficaciter): <cit><quote lang="la">ut id ei causa sit, quod cuique efficienter antecedat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,054:15:34" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fat. 15, 34</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n15232.13" n="2" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">effectus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">worked out</hi>, i. e. </sense><sense id="n15232.14" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Effected</hi>, <hi rend="ital">completed</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">una (materia) diligenter effecta plus proderit quam plures inchoatae et quasi degustatae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:5:23" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 5, 23</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:13:34" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 5, 13, 34</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:3:88" default="NO">8, 3, 88</bibl>.—In the <hi rend="ital">comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid nitidius atque effectius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:10:45" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 10, 45</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n15232.15" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Effected</hi>, in philos. lang. (opp. causa efficiens), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,042:chapter=18" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Top. 18</bibl>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">res,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4</bibl></cit>; 14 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>; and <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">effectum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">an effect</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:3:66" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 3, 66</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:10:94" default="NO">5, 10, 94</bibl>. —<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">effecte</orth>. </sense><sense id="n15232.16" n="a" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">Effectively</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in fact</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:2:27:3" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 2, 27, 3</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 16, 5, 7</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n15232.17" n="b" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">Effectually</hi>, <hi rend="ital">efficaciously</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">effectius,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Flor. 16, p. 357</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi> does not occur.</sense></entryFree>
effictio: <entryFree id="n15233" type="hapax" key="efficti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">effictĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>effingo</etym>, rhet. t. t., <sense id="n15233.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a representing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">portraying</hi> of corporeal peculiarities, <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 4, 49, 63</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
effictus: <entryFree id="n15234" type="main" key="effictus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">effictus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from effingo.</entryFree>
effigia: <entryFree id="n15235" type="main" key="effi^gi^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">effĭgĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, v. effigies <sense id="n15235.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">init.</hi></sense></entryFree>
effigiatus: <entryFree id="n15236" type="hapax" key="effi^gi^a_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">effĭgĭātus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>effigio</etym>, <sense id="n15236.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a representing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">portraying</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Flor. 15, p. 350, 36</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
effigientia: <entryFree id="n15237" type="main" key="effi^gi^enti^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">effĭgĭentĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>effingo</etym>, <sense id="n15237.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the creating</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fashioning.</hi>—<usg type="style">Transf.</usg> = <hi rend="ital">the Creator</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 9, § 922</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
effigies: <entryFree id="n15238" type="main" key="effi^gi^es"><orth extent="full" lang="la">effĭgĭes</orth>, <itype>ēi</itype> (ante-class. form <sense id="n15238.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">nom.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">effĭgĭa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:2:4:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 2, 4, 7</bibl></cit>; Afran. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 493, 2</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 7416</bibl> <foreign lang="greek">l</foreign>.—<hi rend="ital">Nom. plur.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">effigiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:105" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 105</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Acc. plur.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">effigias,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 4, 42</bibl></cit> and 85), <gen>f.</gen> <etym>effingo, I.</etym>, <hi rend="ital">an</hi> (artistic) <hi rend="ital">copy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">imitation</hi> of an object (in concreto— for syn. cf.: imago, pictura, simulacrum, signum, statua, tabula). </sense><sense id="n15238.1" n="I" level="1"> (Class.) With the accessory idea of resemblance obtained by imitation, <hi rend="ital">a likeness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">portrait</hi>, <hi rend="ital">image</hi>, <hi rend="ital">effigy.</hi> </sense><sense id="n15238.2" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">formarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:105" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 105</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:ib. 42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 42</bibl> and 85: Veneris, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:2:4:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 2, 4, 7</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">deus effigies hominis et imago,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:37:103" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 1, 37, 103</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quandam effigiem spirantis mortui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:1:3:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Q. Fr. 1, 3, 1</bibl></cit>; cf. also: simulacrum deae (Veneris) non effigie humana,<cb n="EFFL" />  <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 2, 3 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; and: <cit><quote lang="la">quam satus Iapeto ... Finxit in effigiem moderantum cuncta deorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:83" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 83</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vix convenire videretur, quem ipsum hominem cuperent evertere, ejus effigiem simulacrumque servare,</quote> <trans><tr>his mere effigy</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 65 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">effigiem Xanthi Trojamque videtis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:497" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 497</bibl></cit>; of <hi rend="ital">shades</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ghosts</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">effigiem nullo cum corpore falsi finxit apri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:14:358" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 14, 358</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:13:778" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 13, 778</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">effigies, immo umbrae hominum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:40:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 40, 9</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">of the shade of a deceased person in a dream,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:3:5:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 3, 5, 4</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">or in the lower world,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:13:779" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 13, 779</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n15238.3" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: in <hi rend="ital">or</hi> ad effigiem <hi rend="ital">or</hi> effigie, <hi rend="ital">after the likeness of</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in the form of</hi>, <hi rend="ital">like</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:5:5" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 5, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 10, 11, § 62</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:23" default="NO" valid="yes">21, 5, 11, § 23</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n15238.4" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> (a favorite expression of Cic.): <cit><quote lang="la">perfectae eloquentiae speciem animo videmus, effigiem auribus quaerimus,</quote> <trans><tr>its imitation</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:chapter=3" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 3</bibl></cit> (v. the passage in connection); cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">consiliorum ac virtutum effigiem relinquere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,016:12:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Arch. 12, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Sex. Peducaeus reliquit effigiem et humanitatis et probitatis suae filium,</quote> <trans><tr>the image</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:18:58" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 2, 18, 58</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:3:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 3, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:43:193" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 43, 193</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 26, 41</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:56" default="NO" valid="yes">1, 56</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad effigiem justi imperii scriptus,</quote> <trans><tr>the ideal</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:Q. Fr. 1:1:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Q. Fr. 1, 1, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut res ipsas rerum effigies notaret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:de Or. 2:86" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 86 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">effingo, I. B.: ostensus est in alia effigie,</quote> <trans><tr>appeared in another form</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,002:16:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Marc. 16, 12</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n15238.5" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose, in gen., the plastic (less freq. the pictorial) representation of an object, <hi rend="ital">an image</hi>, <hi rend="ital">statue</hi>, <hi rend="ital">portrait</hi>: saxea ut effigies bacchantis, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:64:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 64, 61</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:167" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 167</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">184</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 148</bibl>; 7, 177; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:8:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 8, 30</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:20:239" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 20, 239</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:74" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 74</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">6, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:5:9 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 5, 9 al.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:1:32" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 1, 32</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:10:5" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 12, 10, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:1:7:7" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 1, 7, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,033:15:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Sap. 15, 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
effigio: <entryFree id="n15239" type="main" key="effi^gi^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">effĭgĭo</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>effigies</etym>, <sense id="n15239.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to form</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fashion</hi>, <hi rend="ital">portray</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">hominem (Deus),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> Cath. 10, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem imaginibus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 6, 12</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 14, 6, 9</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
