effiguratio: <entryFree id="n15240" type="main" key="effi^gu_ra_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">effĭgūrātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, rhet. t. t., = <foreign lang="greek">proswpopoii+/a</foreign>, <sense id="n15240.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a representation</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Rufin.</author> de Schem. p. 275</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
effindo: <entryFree id="n15241" type="hapax" key="effindo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ef-findo</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n15241.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to divide</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cleave</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">fluctus rectos,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Manil.</author> 4, 283</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
effingo: <entryFree id="n15242" type="main" key="effingo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ef-fingo</orth>, <itype>finxi, fictum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, orig., to work out by pressing = fingendo exprimere, <foreign lang="greek">e)kma/ssein</foreign> (v. fingo).—Hence, <sense id="n15242.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To form</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fashion</hi> (artistically—class.; most freq. in the trop. sense; cf.: formo, informo, conformo, fingo, reddo, instituo, etc.). </sense><sense id="n15242.1" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">oris lineamenta in tabula: Veneris Coae pulchritudinem aspersione fortuita,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:13:23" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 13, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sui dissimilia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:9:23" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 3, 9, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">deum imagines in species hominum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:5:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 5, 5</bibl></cit> et saep.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">(Daedalus) casus alicujus in auro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 32</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 10, 640</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:5:713" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 5, 713</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">horrentes effingens crine galeros,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:1:404" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 1, 404</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n15242.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to express</hi>, <hi rend="ital">represent</hi>, <hi rend="ital">portray</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">(natura) speciem ita formavit oris, ut in ea penitus reconditos mores effingeret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:1:9" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 1, 9</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:16:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Am. 16, 47</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 43 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:11:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 11, 14</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:2:17" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 2, 17</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">oratorem effingere (connected with corpora fingendo efficere),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:12:21" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 5, 12, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">effinge aliquid et excude (sc. scribendo), quod sit perpetuo tuum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:1:3:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 1, 3, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">imaginem virtutis,</quote> <trans><tr>to represent by imitation</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:2:15" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 2, 15</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:108" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 10, 1, 108</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:89" default="NO">11, 3, 89</bibl> sq.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:9:22:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 9, 22, 2</bibl>.—Of the conception of external objects: <cit><quote lang="la">visum impressum effictumque ex eo, unde esset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:Ac. 2:6:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ac. 2, 6, 18</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:Tusc. 1:25:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 1, 25, 61</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:de Or. 2:86" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 86 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>— </sense><sense id="n15242.3" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To wipe clean</hi>, <hi rend="ital">wipe out</hi> (only in the foll. passages): <cit><quote lang="la">fiscinas spongia effingat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0022,001:67:2" default="NO"><author>Cato</author> R. R. 67, 2</bibl></cit> (for which: fiscinas spongia <hi rend="ital">tergendas</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:15:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 15, 6, 6, § 22</bibl>): <cit><quote lang="la">spongiis sanguinem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:chapter=35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sest. 35 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>, v. Halm ad h. l.—</sense><sense id="n15242.4" n="III" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To rub gently</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stroke</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">manus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0800,001:Cons. ad Liv. 138" default="NO"><author>Albin.</author> Cons. ad Liv. 138</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:20:134" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 20, 134</bibl> (for which: manus <hi rend="ital">fingere</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:5:409" default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 5, 409</bibl>).</sense></entryFree>
effio: <entryFree id="n15243" type="main" key="effi_o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">effīo</orth>, <itype>ĕri</itype>, v. efficio <sense id="n15243.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">init.</hi></sense></entryFree>
effirmo: <entryFree id="n15244" type="hapax" key="effirmo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ef-firmo</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n15244.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to strengthen</hi>, <hi rend="ital">encourage</hi>, Att. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 256, 18</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
efflagitatio: <entryFree id="n15245" type="main" key="effla_gi^ta_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">efflāgĭtātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>efflagito</etym>, <sense id="n15245.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an urgent demand</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pressing request</hi> (very rare), * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:5:19:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 5, 19, 2</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">Plancus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 10, 24, 6</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
efflagitatus: <entryFree id="n15246" type="hapax" key="effla_gi^ta_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">efflāgĭtātus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n15246.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an earnest</hi> or <hi rend="ital">urgent request</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">coactu atque efflagitatu meo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 29</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
efflagito: <entryFree id="n15247" type="main" key="effla_gi^to"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ef-flāgĭto</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n15247.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to demand</hi> or <hi rend="ital">ask urgently</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to request earnestly</hi> (class.; <cit><quote lang="la">for syn. cf.: posco, flagito, exigo, obsecro, etc.): epistolam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:2:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Q. Fr. 2, 11</bibl></cit>: <cb n="EFFL" /> libros, Quint. Ep. ad Tryph. § <cit><quote lang="la">3: judicio rum desiderio tribunicia potestas efflagitata est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,004:3:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Div. in Caecil. 3, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">collationes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:38" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">notum ensem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:759" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 759</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:12" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 12 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">signum pugnae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 60</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">misericordiam alicujus (with requirere),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:chapter=34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mil. 34</bibl></cit> et saep.—With <hi rend="ital">ut</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum iste a Cn. Dolabella efflagitasset, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 24</bibl></cit>; Quint. Ep. ad Tryph. § 1; cf.: aliquem, ut, Auct. B. Hisp. 29, 7; and with <hi rend="ital">simple subj.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tit.:5" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tit. 5</bibl>.—<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">a multis efflagitatus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:36:92" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 36, 92</bibl></cit> Zumpt <hi rend="ital">N. cr.;</hi> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:5:10" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 4, 5, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=dom.:3" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Dom. 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
efflammans: <entryFree id="n15248" type="hapax" key="efflammans"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ef-flammans</orth>, <itype>antis</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>flammo</etym>, <sense id="n15248.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">emitting flames</hi>, <hi rend="ital">flaming</hi>, <hi rend="ital">blazing</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">stellae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 2, § 207</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
effleo: <entryFree id="n15249" type="main" key="effle^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ef-flĕo</orth>, <itype>ēvi, 2</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n15249.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to weep out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">exhaust by weeping</hi>: oculos, Quint. decl. 6, 4.</sense></entryFree>
efflicte: <entryFree id="n15250" type="main" key="efflicte"><orth extent="full" lang="la">efflicte</orth> and <orth extent="full" lang="la">efflictim</orth>, <sense id="n15250.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">advv.</hi>, v. effligo.</sense></entryFree>
efflicto: <entryFree id="n15251" type="hapax" key="efflicto"><orth extent="full" lang="la">efflicto</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. freq. a.</pos> <etym>effligo</etym>, <sense id="n15251.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to strike dead</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:4:2:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Stich. 4, 2, 26</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
effligo: <entryFree id="n15252" type="main" key="effli_go"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ef-flīgo</orth>, <itype>xi, ctum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n15252.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to strike dead</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to kill</hi>, <hi rend="ital">destroy</hi> (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">qui filium misit ad effligendum Pompeium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:9:19:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 9, 19, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nisi pedatu tertio omnis efflixero (with obtruncavero and occidero),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,007:2:1:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cist. 2, 1, 50</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">rabidos canes (with caedere),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ira, 1:15" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ira, 1, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">viperas et natrices,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:ib. 2:31" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 31</bibl></cit> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:4:2:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 4, 2, 9</bibl>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n15252.1" n="1" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">efflictim</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">to death</hi>, <hi rend="ital">desperately.</hi> —With amare, deperire, etc., i. e. amare usque donicum effligatur, Prob. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> p. 178</bibl> (ante-class.); Naev. ap. Charis. l. l.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:3:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 1, 3, 19</bibl> (twice); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:prol. 49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cas. prol. 49</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:prol. 96" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Poen. prol. 96</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">5, 2, 15</bibl>; Laber. and Pompon. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 104, 24 sq.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n15252.2" n="2" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">efflicte</orth>, <itype>in like sense</itype> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">cupere aliquid,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 5, p. 171, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">diligere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:Ep. 1:84" default="NO"><author>Symm.</author> Ep. 1, 84</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
efflo: <entryFree id="n15253" type="main" key="efflo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ef-flo</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> and <gen>n.</gen>, <sense id="n15253.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to blow</hi> or <hi rend="ital">breathe out</hi> (mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg> and post-Aug. prose). </sense><sense id="n15253.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi> </sense><sense id="n15253.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">(Sol) suos efflavit ignes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:652" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 652</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ignes Aetnaeos faucibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:786" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 786</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ignes ore et naribus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:85" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 85</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lucem elatis naribus (equi solis),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:115" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 115</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mare patulis naribus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:686" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 3, 686</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">nimbos in sublime (balaenae),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 6, 6, § 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pulverem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:29:138" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 29, 6, 39, § 138</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vina somno,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:5:209" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 5, 209</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnem colorem,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>to lose</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:833" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 833</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">bestiolae si efflantur (vento),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:12:2" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 12, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n15253.3" n="B" level="2"> Esp. freq.: <cit><quote lang="la">animam,</quote> <trans><tr>to breathe out one's life</tr>, <tr>to expire</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:9" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 9 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:4:4:86" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Pers. 4, 4, 86</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">a milite omnis spes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:4:4:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Truc. 4, 4, 23</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:chapter=18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mil. 18 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,004:5:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Paus. 5, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=dom.:2" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Dom. 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:99" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Aug. 99</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">for which also: extremum halitum, Cic. poët. Tusc. 2, 9, 22: vitam in nubila,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:17:557" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 17, 557</bibl></cit>; and <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi>: (anguem) Abicit efflantem, Cic. poët. Div. 1, 47, 106.—</sense><sense id="n15253.4" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> * </sense><sense id="n15253.5" n="(a)" level="5"> Of wounds: <cit><quote lang="la">efflantes plagae,</quote> <trans><tr>deadly</tr>, <tr>which let out life</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:8:168" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 8, 168</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n15253.6" n="(b)" level="5"> With an <hi rend="ital">obj. acc.</hi> and <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to say with one's last breath</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quam verum est, quod moriens (Brutus) efflavit, non in re, sed in verbo tantum esse virtutem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:4:7:11" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 4, 7, 11</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n15253.7" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Neutr.</hi> (very seldom): <cit><quote lang="la">flamma,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:681" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 681</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:699" default="NO" valid="yes">699</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:10:109" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 10, 109</bibl>; Ven. Fort. 4, 26, 128.</sense></entryFree>
effloreo: <entryFree id="n15254" type="main" key="efflo_re^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ef-flōrĕo</orth>, <itype>ēre</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, <sense id="n15254.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to bloom</hi> or <hi rend="ital">blossom forth</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Jud. Dom. 209</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,027:102:14 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Psa. 102, 14 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
effloresco: <entryFree id="n15255" type="main" key="efflo_resco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ef-flōresco</orth>, <itype>rui, 3</itype>, <sense id="n15255.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. inch. n.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to bloom</hi> or <hi rend="ital">blossom.</hi> </sense><sense id="n15255.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> (eccl. Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Sirach, 51, 19</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,048:18:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Isa. 18, 5</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n15255.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> (repeatedly in Cic.), <hi rend="ital">to bloom</hi>, <hi rend="ital">spring up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">flourish</hi> (in youth, beauty, etc.): <cit><quote lang="la">ex rerum cognitione efflorescat et redundet oportet oratio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:6:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 6, 20</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">utilitas ex amicitia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:chapter=27" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 27</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:29" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 1, 29</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">amor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:1:20:69" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 1, 20, 69</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si quidem efflorescit ingenii laudibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:31:76" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cael. 31, 76</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
effluesco: <entryFree id="n15256" type="main" key="efflu^esco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">efflŭesco</orth>, <itype>ĕre, 3</itype>, <sense id="n15256.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. inch.</hi> [effluo], <hi rend="ital">to revel</hi>, <hi rend="ital">riot</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sumptuosis conviviis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Ambros.</author> de Off. M. 2, 21, 109</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
effluo: <entryFree id="n15257" type="main" key="efflu^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ef-flŭo</orth>, <itype>xi, 3</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> (and very rarely <sense id="n15257.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a.</hi>), <hi rend="ital">to flow</hi> or <hi rend="ital">run out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to flow forth</hi> (class.; esp. freq. in the trop. sense). </sense><sense id="n15257.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">facit effluere imbres,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:512" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 512</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">una cum sanguine vita,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:2:24" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 2, 24 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">umor e cavis populi nigrae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:24:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 24, 8, 32, § 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sucina petris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 37, 2, 11, § 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amnis in oceanum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:ib" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne qua levis effluat aura,</quote> <trans><tr>escape</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:6:233" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 6, 233</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">ambrosiae et nectari' linctus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:971" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 971</bibl></cit>, v. Lachm. ad h. l.—</sense><sense id="n15257.2" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne (amphorae) effluant vinum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 71, 11</bibl></cit>; cf. Claud. Prob. et Olyb. <pb n="631" /> <cb n="EFFO" /> 52.—</sense><sense id="n15257.3" n="C" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of non-fluid bodies, <hi rend="ital">to go out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">issue forth</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose): <cit><quote lang="la">Epicuri figurae, quas e summis corporibus dicit effluere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:2:15" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 2, 15</bibl></cit> Spald.; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:5:16:3" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 5, 16, 3</bibl>: effluit effuso cui toga laxa sinu, *<bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:6:40" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 6, 40</bibl> (dub.—Müll. et fluit); cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> IV. Cons. Honor. 208</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">manibus opus effluit,</quote> <trans><tr>slips from</tr>, <tr>drops from</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:795" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 795</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 3, 39</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:8:14" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 8, 14</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n15257.4" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To vanish</hi>, <hi rend="ital">disappear</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">de pectore caedis notae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:6:670" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 6, 670</bibl></cit>; cf. * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:97" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 97</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:27:138" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 27, 13, 111, § 138</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n15257.5" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: utrumque hoc falsum est: effluet, i. e. <hi rend="ital">it will go abroad</hi>, <hi rend="ital">become known</hi> = emanabit, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:1:2:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 1, 2, 41</bibl>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">Auct. Or. pro Domo, 46, 121: impropria interim effluunt,</quote> <trans><tr>slip out</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:3:20" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 3, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tanta est intimorum multitudo, ut ex iis aliquis potius effluat, quam novo sit aditus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:6:19:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 6, 19, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne effluant haec ab oculis tuis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,029:3:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Prov. 3, 21</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n15257.6" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To pass away</hi>, <hi rend="ital">disappear</hi>, <hi rend="ital">vanish</hi> (cf. I. B. 2.): <cit><quote lang="la">praeterita aetas quamvis longa cum effluxisset,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> de Sen. 2, 4</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 19, 69</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:12:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 12, 43 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:2:44" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 2, 44</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">viso mens aegra effluxit hiatu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:6:245" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 6, 245</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">effluet in lacrimas,</quote> <trans><tr>to melt</tr>, <tr>dissolve</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:9:106" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 9, 106</bibl></cit>.—So esp. <hi rend="ital">to escape</hi> from the memory: <cit><quote lang="la">ut istuc veniam ante quam plane ex animo tuo effluo,</quote> <trans><tr>am forgotten</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:7:14:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 7, 14, 1</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:1:12:41" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 1, 12, 41</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:61:219" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 61, 219</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 26</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> R. Am. 646</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
effluus: <entryFree id="n15258" type="main" key="efflu^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">efflŭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>effluo</etym>, <sense id="n15258.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">flowing out</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">ignis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Avien.</author> Progn. Arat. 1717</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amnis in pontum cadit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Perieg. 1162</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
effluvium: <entryFree id="n15259" type="main" key="efflu^vi^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">efflŭvĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n15259.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a flowing out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">an outlet</hi> (post-Aug. and very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">umoris e corpore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:171" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 51, 52, § 171</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lacus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:12:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 12, 57</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cerebri effluvio exspirare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:120" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 120 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>, v. Kritz. ad h. l.</sense></entryFree>
effoco: <entryFree id="n15260" type="hapax" key="effo_co"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ef-fōco</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>faux</etym>, <sense id="n15260.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to suffocate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">smother.</hi>—<usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">bonis suis effocantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Brev. Vit. 2:3" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Brev. Vit. 2, 3</bibl></cit> dub. (al. offoco).</sense></entryFree>
effodio: <entryFree id="n15261" type="main" key="effo^di^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ef-fŏdĭo</orth>, also <orth extent="full" lang="la">exf-</orth> and <orth extent="full" lang="la">ecf-</orth> (cf. Neue, Formenl. 2, 767, 769), fōdi, fossum, 3 (<sense id="n15261.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">inf. pass.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ecfodiri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:2:3:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 2, 3, 44</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">2, 4, 21</bibl>), <pos>v. a.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">to dig out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dig up</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">nec ferrum, aes, argentum, aurum effoderetur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:3" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 2, 3 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">carbones e sepulcris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 35, 6, 25, § 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lapides puteis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:161" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 36, 22, 45, § 161</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aulam auri plenam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:4:8:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 4, 8, 9</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">thensaurum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:3:3:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Trin. 3, 3, 53</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">4, 4, 8</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">opes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:140" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 140</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">and facetiously: ex hoc sepulcro vetere (i. e. ex sene avaro) viginti minas Ecfodiam ego hodie,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:4:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 1, 4, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">signum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 22, 3 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">saxum medio de limite,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:16:38" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 16, 38</bibl></cit> et saep,: <cit><quote lang="la">spoliatis effossisque eorum domibus,</quote> <trans><tr>ransacked</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 42 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">terram altius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:3:2" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 3, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">humum rastello,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:19" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">montem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:25" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Claud. 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tellurem, Petr. poët. 128, 6, 2: lacum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=dom.:4" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Dom. 4</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">cavernas,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>to make by digging</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:48" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ner. 48</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sepulcra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:497" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 497</bibl></cit> et saep.—In the <hi rend="ital">voc. part. pass.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex sterquilinio effosse,</quote> <trans><tr>thou dug from a dung-hill!</tr></trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:1:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cas. 1, 26</bibl></cit>.—Esp. freq.: <cit><quote lang="la">ecfodere oculos or oculum (alicui),</quote> <trans><tr>to scratch out</tr>, <tr>tear out</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:1:1:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 1, 1, 14</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:3:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Curc. 3, 26</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:1:2:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Men. 1, 2, 46</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:2:3:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 2, 3, 44</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:2:4:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Trin. 2, 4, 62</bibl>; * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:4:6:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 4, 6, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 4 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:3:17" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 3, 17</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=dom.:17" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Dom. 17</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,014:25:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 4 Reg. 25, 7</bibl> et saep.; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">lumen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:663" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 663</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">and transf.: hi duo illos oculos orae maritimae effoderunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:38:91" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 3, 38, 91</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">effossum alterum Romani imperii lumen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:52:3" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 52, 3</bibl></cit>.—So, too, vesicam, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:2:8:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cas. 2, 8, 22</bibl>; and <usg type="style">poet.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">viscera,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>to cause abortion</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:2:14:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 2, 14, 27</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
effoecundo: <entryFree id="n15262" type="main" key="effoecundo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">effoecundo</orth>, v. effecundo.</entryFree>
effoemino: <entryFree id="n15263" type="main" key="effoemi^no"><orth extent="full" lang="la">effoemĭno</orth>, v. effemino.</entryFree>
effoetus: <entryFree id="n15264" type="main" key="effoetus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">effoetus</orth> and <orth extent="full" lang="la">effœto</orth>, v. effet-.</entryFree>
effor: <entryFree id="n15265" type="main" key="effor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ef-for</orth>, <itype>ātus, 1</itype>, <sense id="n15265.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. dep. a.</hi> (<hi rend="ital">defect.</hi> In use only: effor, Cav. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Diom.</author> p. 375</bibl> P.: <cit><quote lang="la">effaris,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 7, 25, p. 199, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">effatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:523 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 10, 523 al.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">effamini,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 7, 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">effantur, App. Mund. prooem. p. 56, 22: effabor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:104" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 104</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">effabere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:8:346" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 8, 346</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">effabimur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 30, 97</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">effantes,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Mund. p. 65, 5</bibl></cit>; <hi rend="ital">imp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">effare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:560" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 560</bibl></cit>; <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">effari,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 76</bibl></cit>; as <hi rend="ital">pass.</hi>, poët. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:2:17:39" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 2, 17, 39</bibl>; <hi rend="ital">part.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">effatus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:463 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 463 al.</bibl></cit>; as <hi rend="ital">pass.</hi> <xr><lbl>v.</lbl> <ref type="sym" targOrder="U">infra</ref></xr>: <cit><quote lang="la">effando,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:15:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 15, 10</bibl></cit>: effatu, Pl. 3, 21, 25, § 139 al.), <hi rend="ital">to speak</hi> or <hi rend="ital">say out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to utter.</hi> </sense><sense id="n15265.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen. (an old relig. and <usg type="style">poet.</usg> word; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:38:153" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 38, 153</bibl>; esp. freq. in Verg.): sed tamen effabor, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:104" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 104</bibl>: haec effatu' pater, repente <cb n="EFFR" /> recessit, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:20:40" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 20, 40</bibl> (Ann. v. 48 ed. Vahlen); cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:450" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 450</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:463" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 3, 463</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 30</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">76</bibl>; 456 et saep.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:17:37" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 17, 37</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:8:347" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 8, 347</bibl> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">et tacendo forsitan, quae dii immortales vulgari velint, haud minus, quam celanda effando, nefas contrahi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 15 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:49" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 49</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">effatu digna nomina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:139" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 21, 25, § 139</bibl></cit> et saep.—<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,027:93:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Psa. 93, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,029:18:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Prov. 18, 23</bibl>.—* </sense><sense id="n15265.2" n="II" level="1"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n15265.3" n="1" level="3"> As t. t. in the language of augurs, <hi rend="ital">to fix</hi>, <hi rend="ital">define</hi>, <hi rend="ital">determine</hi> a place for a religious purpose: <cit><quote lang="la">templum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:13:42:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 13, 42, 3</bibl></cit>; cf. <hi rend="ital">pass.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">templa effari ab auguribus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 6:7:section=53" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 6, 7, § 53</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n15265.4" n="2" level="3"> In dialectics, <hi rend="ital">to state a proposition</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod ita effabimur,</quote> <trans><tr>Aut vivet cras Hermarchus</tr>, <tr>aut non vivet</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 30, 97</bibl></cit>; cf. in the foll.: effatum.!*? <orth extent="full" lang="la">effātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, in passive signif., <hi rend="ital">pronounced</hi>, <hi rend="ital">established</hi>, <hi rend="ital">determined</hi>, <hi rend="ital">designated: effata</hi> dicuntur, quod augures finem auspiciorum caelestum extra urbem agris sunt effati ubi esset; <cit><quote lang="la">hinc effari templa dicuntur ab auguribus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 6:section=53" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 6, § 53</bibl></cit> Müll.; cf. Libri Augur. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:13:14" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 13, 14</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> Verg. A. 6, 197</bibl>; Fest. S. V. MINORA TEMPLA, p. 157, 28 Müll.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:8" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 2, 8 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 10, 37 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">FATIDICORVM ET VATVM EFFATA INCOGNITA,</quote> <trans><tr>announcements</tr>, <tr>predictions</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:8:20" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 2, 8, 20</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 24</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n15265.5" n="B" level="2"> In partic.: <orth extent="full" lang="la">effātum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a dialectical proposition</hi>, <hi rend="ital">an axiom</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 29 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl> (a transl. of the Gr. <foreign lang="greek">a)ci/wma</foreign>), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 117" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 117</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
efforo: <entryFree id="n15266" type="hapax" key="effo^ro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ef-fŏro</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n15266.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to bore through</hi>, <hi rend="ital">perforate</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">truncum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:9:1:3" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 9, 1, 3</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
effossio: <entryFree id="n15267" type="hapax" key="effossi^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">effossĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>effodio</etym>, <sense id="n15267.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a digging out;</hi> in the <number>plur.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">laboriosae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cod. Just.</author> 11, 6, 3</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
effoveo: <entryFree id="n15268" type="hapax" key="effo^ve^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ef-fŏvĕo</orth>, <itype>ēre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n15268.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to refresh</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">carnem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> 4, 28, 2</bibl></cit> dub.</sense></entryFree>
effractarius: <entryFree id="n15269" type="hapax" key="effracta_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">effractārĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>effractor</etym>, <sense id="n15269.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a house-breaker</hi>, <hi rend="ital">burglar</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 68:4" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 68, 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
effractor: <entryFree id="n15270" type="main" key="effractor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">effractor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>effringo</etym>, <sense id="n15270.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a housebreaker</hi>, <hi rend="ital">burglar</hi> (jurid. Lat.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:1:15:3" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 1, 15, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:47:17:1" default="NO">47, 17, 1</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 9, 7</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
effractura: <entryFree id="n15271" type="main" key="effractu_ra"><orth extent="full" lang="la">effractūra</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n15271.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">house-breaking</hi>, <hi rend="ital">burglary</hi> (jurid. Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">effracturae fiunt plerumque in insulis in horreisque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:1:15:3:section=2" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 1, 15, 3, § 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:38:2:48" default="NO">38, 2, 48</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
effrenate: <entryFree id="n15272" type="main" key="effre_na_te"><orth extent="full" lang="la">effrēnāte</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, <sense id="n15272.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">unrestrainedly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">violently</hi>, v. effreno, <hi rend="ital">P. a. fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
effrenatio: <entryFree id="n15273" type="hapax" key="effre_na_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">effrēnātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>effreno</etym>, <sense id="n15273.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">unbridled impetuosity</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">impotentis animi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:5:8:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 5, 8, 22</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
effrenatus: <entryFree id="n15274" type="main" key="effre_na_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">effrēnātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> and <pos>P. a.</pos>, from effreno.</entryFree>
effrenis: <entryFree id="n15275" type="main" key="effre_nis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">effrēnis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, v. effrenus <sense id="n15275.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">init.</hi></sense></entryFree>
effreno: <entryFree id="n15276" type="main" key="effre_no"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ef-frēno</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">ecfr-</orth>, no <sense id="n15276.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">perf.</hi>, <itype>ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">to unbridle</hi>, <hi rend="ital">let loose</hi> (very rare).— <usg type="style">Poet.</usg> transf.: <cit><quote lang="la">Vulturnum Effrenat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:9:496" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 9, 496</bibl></cit>.—Far more freq., <orth extent="full" lang="la">effrēnātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos> </sense><sense id="n15276.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Unbridled</hi>, <hi rend="ital">without a rein</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">equi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:40:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 40, 40, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">equi velut effrenati passim incerto cursu feruntur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:37:41:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 37, 41, 10</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n15276.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">ungoverned</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unrestrained</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unruly</hi> (a favorite word of Cicero): <cit><quote lang="la">homines secundis rebus effrenatos tamquam in gyrum rationis duci oportere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:26:90" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 26, 90</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">populi soluti effrenatique,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:34" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 1, 34</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">libido effrenata et indomita,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:chapter=6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Clu. 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 24</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cupiditas effrenata ac furiosa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:1:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cat. 1, 10</bibl></cit>; and: <cit><quote lang="la">mens effrenata atque praeceps,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:15:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cael. 15, 35</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">libertas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:34:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 34, 49</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">insolentiă multitudo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:42" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 42 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:3:5:11" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 3, 5, 11</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ferocia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">violentia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:12:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 12, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">petulantia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:4:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 4, 25 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mente,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,024:13:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 2 Macc. 13, 9</bibl></cit> et saep.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vox (with libera),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 53 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">libido (Appii),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 50</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">iracundia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:2:3" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 2, 3</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">affectus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 88" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 88</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">ef-frēnāte</orth>, <hi rend="ital">unrestrainedly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">violently</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> de Sen. 12, 39</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:14:9:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 14, 9, 26</bibl>.— <hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi> appears not to occur.</sense></entryFree>
effrenus: <entryFree id="n15277" type="main" key="effre_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ef-frēnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype> (also effrenis mula, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:171" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 44, 69, § 171</bibl>; Sen. de Ira, 3, 15, 2), <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>ex-frenum</etym>, <sense id="n15277.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">free from the bridle</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unbridled</hi> (not ante Aug., and mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg> for effrenatus; cf. also: infrenus, infrenatus). </sense><sense id="n15277.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">equus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:33:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 33, 7</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n15277.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">unbridled</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unrestrained</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">gens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:382" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 382</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:6:465" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 6, 465</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">juventa,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Achill. 1, 277</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">profatu,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Silv. 5, 3, 103</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
effrico: <entryFree id="n15278" type="main" key="effri^co"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ef-frĭco</orth>, <itype>xi</itype> (<bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Marc. 4, 12</bibl>), <itype>ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n15278.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to rub off</hi> or <hi rend="ital">out</hi> (post-Aug. <cb n="EFFU" /> and very rare). </sense><sense id="n15278.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">sordium enormem illuviem operose,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 1, p. 105, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">calices,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4</bibl></cit>, p. 145, 31: spicas decerptas, Tert. l. l.—</sense><sense id="n15278.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">rubigo animorum effricanda est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 95:37" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 95, 37</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
effringo: <entryFree id="n15279" type="main" key="effringo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ef-fringo</orth>, <itype>frēgi, fractum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> and <gen>n.</gen> <sense id="n15279.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to break off</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to break open</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">effringere quam aperire putant robustius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:12:1" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 12, 1</bibl></cit> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">cardines foribus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:4:2:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 4, 2, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:2:3:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> As. 2, 3, 8</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">more freq.: fores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:2:2:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Stich. 2, 2, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:4:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Bacch. 4, 2, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:4:6:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 4, 6, 35</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:1:2:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 1, 2, 8</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">23</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">40</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 23</bibl>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">valvas,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">januam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:15:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mur. 15, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tabernas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:26" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">carcerem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 21</bibl></cit>: cistam, * <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 17, 54</bibl>; <usg type="style">poet.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">urbem,</quote> <trans><tr>to storm</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:9:556" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 9, 556</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Judith, 2, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">jugum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:5:2:40" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 5, 2, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cerebrum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:480" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 480</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">corpus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Phoen. 159" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Phoen. 159</bibl></cit>; cf. <usg type="style">poet.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">animam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Herc. Oet. 1451" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Herc. Oet. 1451</bibl></cit>.—*</sense><sense id="n15279.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Neutr.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to break out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">break forth</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">(spumeus fluctus) vestras effringet in urbes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:1:647" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 1, 647</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
effrondesco: <entryFree id="n15280" type="hapax" key="effrondesco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ef-frondesco</orth>, <itype>dui, 3</itype>, <sense id="n15280.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. inch. n.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to put forth leaves</hi>, <hi rend="ital">be covered with foliage</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Vop.</author> Prob. 19, 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
effrons: <entryFree id="n15281" type="hapax" key="effrons"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ef-frons</orth>, <itype>ntis</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> (putting forth the forehead, i. e. trop.), <sense id="n15281.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">barefaced</hi>, <hi rend="ital">shameless</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">consilium,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Vop.</author> Num. 13</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
effrutico: <entryFree id="n15282" type="main" key="effru^ti^co"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ef-frŭtĭco</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> and <gen>n.</gen> (late Lat.). * <sense id="n15282.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to put forth</hi>, <hi rend="ital">produce</hi>, <hi rend="ital">transf.</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Anim. 27 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>—* </sense><sense id="n15282.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Neutr.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to shoot</hi> or <hi rend="ital">grow forth</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> ad Nat. 1, 5</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
effugatio: <entryFree id="n15283" type="main" key="effu^ga_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">effŭgātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>effugo</etym>, <sense id="n15283.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a putting to flight</hi>: dolorum, [Hilar.] Anon. in Job, 3, p. 238.</sense></entryFree>
effugia: <entryFree id="n15284" type="gloss" key="effu^gi^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">effŭgĭa</orth> <itype>vocari veteri more solet hostia, quae ad aras adducta est immolanda, si casu effugeret</itype>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> Verg. A. 2, 140</bibl>.</entryFree>
effugio: <entryFree id="n15285" type="main" key="effu^gi^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ef-fŭgĭo</orth>, <itype>fūgi</itype> (<sense id="n15285.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">inf. pass.</hi> effugiri, Pseud. Syr. Sent. 815 Rib.), <itype>3</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> and <hi rend="ital">a.</hi> (class. and freq., esp. in the active sense). </sense><sense id="n15285.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Neutr.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to flee away;</hi> or, with reference to the result, <hi rend="ital">to escape</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">effugias ex urbe inanis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:3:2:75" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 3, 2, 75</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">ex urbe,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 4, 196</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">e proelio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 2, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">e manibus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> de Imp. Pomp. 9 al.</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">transf.: ex sitella (sors),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:2:6:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cas. 2, 6, 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">a vita marituma,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:2:3:108" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Bacch. 2, 3, 108</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">a quibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:chapter=54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sest. 54 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">patriă,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:3:4:75" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Merc. 3, 4, 75</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">foras,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:1:4:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Most. 1, 4, 3</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:5:1:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Curc. 5, 1, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:5:5:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 5, 5, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad regem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:4:15" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 4, 15</bibl></cit>.— <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">pisces ne effugiant, cavet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:1:1:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 1, 1, 16</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:58:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 58, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:16:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 1, 16, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:3:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 3, 49</bibl> et saep.; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">via Nolam ferente,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 8, 26</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">ne</hi>: parum effugerat ne dignus crederetur (= aegre impediebat, quin, etc.; Greek <foreign lang="greek">par) o)li/gon e)ce/fugen</foreign>, etc.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:3:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 3, 39 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">propinque clade urbis ipsi, ne quid simile paterentur, effugerunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:36:25:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 36, 25, 8</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n15285.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi> </sense><sense id="n15285.3" n="A" level="2"> Of personal subjects: aliquid, <hi rend="ital">to flee from</hi>, <hi rend="ital">escape</hi>, <hi rend="ital">avoid</hi>, <hi rend="ital">shun</hi> (cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">vito, caveo, fugio): ita vix poteris effugere infortunium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:1:295" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 1, 1, 295</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pauca (with subterfugere),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:5:2:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Capt. 5, 2, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">malam rem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:2:4:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> As. 2, 4, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">impias propinquorum manus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:6:12" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 6, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dolores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:1:4:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Q. Fr. 1, 4, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mortem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:6:30:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 6, 30, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">periculum celeritate,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 35, 1</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:41:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 2, 41, 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">equitatum Caesaris,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 65, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec vincula,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:3:71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 3, 71</bibl></cit> et saep.; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">haec morte effugiuntur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:36" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ea aetas tua, quae cupiditates adolescentiae jam effugerit,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>has passed beyond them</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 1, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">effugere cupiditatem regnum est vincere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0622,001:154" default="NO"><author>Pub. Syr.</author> 154</bibl></cit> (Rib.).—Rarely with a <hi rend="ital">rel. clause</hi>: numquam hodie effugies, quin mea moriaris manu, Naev. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 6, 1</bibl> (Trag. Rel. ed. R<bibl default="NO"><author>ib.</author> p. 8</bibl>).—Of inanimate subjects: res (me) effugit, <hi rend="ital">it escapes me</hi>, <hi rend="ital">I do not observe it</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ubi eum locum omnem cogitatione sepseris, nihil te effugiet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 34 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nullius rei cura Romanos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 22, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque hoc parentes Effugerit spectaculum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:5:102" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 5, 102</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">somniculosum plurima effugiunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:11:1:13" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 11, 1, 13</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">petitiones corpore effugi,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>narrowly</tr>, <tr>barely</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:1:6:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 1, 6, 15</bibl></cit>.— Rarely with a <hi rend="ital">subject-clause</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">custodis curam non effugiat observare desilientem matricem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:8:11:12" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 8, 11, 12</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
effugium: <entryFree id="n15286" type="main" key="effu^gi^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">effŭgĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>effugio</etym>, <sense id="n15286.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a flecing away</hi>, <hi rend="ital">flight</hi> (rarely, but class.; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">perfugium, refugium, asylum): effugiumque fugae prolatet copia semper,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:983" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 983</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">effugium praecludere eunti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:523" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 3, 523</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:974" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1, 974</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">dare effugium alicui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:1:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 23, 1, 8</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 1, 43</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">patēre in publicum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 24</bibl></cit>, <pb n="632" /> <cb n="EFFU" /> 26: <cit><quote lang="la">nullam ne ad effugium quidem navem habentibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 21, 43</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">mortis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 64 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>—In the <hi rend="ital">piur.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ob nostra effugia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:140" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 140</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:12:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 12, 56</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">15, 63</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n15286.1" n="II" level="1"> Concr., <hi rend="ital">a means</hi> or <hi rend="ital">way of escape</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">alias (bestias) habere effugia pennarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:47:121" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 47, 121</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 47</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 42</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">12, 31</bibl>; 16, 15; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,012:15:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 2 Reg. 15, 14</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
effugius: <entryFree id="n15287" type="main" key="effu^gi^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">effŭgĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>effugio</etym>, <sense id="n15287.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">escaping</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">hostia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> Verg. A. 2, 140</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
effugo: <entryFree id="n15288" type="main" key="effu^go"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ef-fŭgo</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n15288.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to put to flight</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> Ep. 18</bibl>, <hi rend="ital">no.</hi> 19; <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Sirach, 30, 20</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,023:1:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1 Macc. 1, 56</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
effulgeo: <entryFree id="n15289" type="main" key="e^ffulge^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĕf-fulgĕo</orth>, <itype>si, 2</itype> (<sense id="n15289.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">inf.</hi> effulgĕre, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:8:677" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 8, 677</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> VI. Cons. Hon. 546</bibl>), <pos>v. n.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">to shine</hi> or <hi rend="ital">gleam forth</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to glitter</hi> (not anteAug.). </sense><sense id="n15289.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">nova lux oculis effulsit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:731" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 9, 731</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 22, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:15" default="NO" valid="yes">28, 15</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:41:21" default="NO" valid="yes">41, 21</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">auro Ductores longe effulgent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:133" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 133</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">auro (fluctus),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 8, 677</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nimbo (Pallas),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 616</bibl></cit> (Forbig. ad loc.; <cit><quote lang="la">Rib. and Lad. limbo): veste nivea (sacerdos),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:3:695" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 3, 695</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ornatu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:13:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 13, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sol,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Sirach, 50, 7</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n15289.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnis Graeciae fabulositas ex hoc primum sinu effulsit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:H. N. 4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> H. N. 4 <hi rend="ital">init.</hi></bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:45:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 45, 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">audacia aut insignibus effulgens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 4, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sensus aliquis argută et brevi sententiă,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 20</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:6:5" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 6, 5</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
effultus: <entryFree id="n15290" type="main" key="effultus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ef-fultus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> [fulcio], <sense id="n15290.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">propped up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">supported</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-class. prose): <cit><quote lang="la">effultus stratis velleribus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:94" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 94</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 8, 368</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:3:1:5" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 3, 1, 5</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 2, p. 123</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
effumigatus: <entryFree id="n15291" type="hapax" key="effu_mi^ga_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ef-fūmĭgātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> [fumigo], <sense id="n15291.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">smoked out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">driven out by smoke</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">coluber,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> ad Mart. 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
effumo: <entryFree id="n15292" type="hapax" key="effu_mo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ef-fūmo</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, <sense id="n15292.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to emit smoke</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to smoke</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">moles,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Aetn.</author> 497</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
effundo: <entryFree id="n15293" type="main" key="effundo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ef-fundo</orth> (or <orth extent="full" lang="la">ecf-</orth>), <itype>fūdi, fūsum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n15293.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to pour out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pour forth</hi>, <hi rend="ital">shed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">spread abroad</hi> (class.; esp. freq. in the transf. and trop. signif.). </sense><sense id="n15293.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">vinum in barathrum (i. e. ventrem),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:1:2:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 1, 2, 28</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:chapter=10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Pis. 10</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aquam oblatam in galea,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:Strat. 1:7:7" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> Strat. 1, 7, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">humorem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:7:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 7, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lacrimas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:126" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 126</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:42:101" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Planc. 42, 101</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">imbrem (procella),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:8:13" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 8, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se in oceanum (Ganges),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:243" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 108, 112, § 243</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Sangarius flumen in Propontidem se effundit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:38:18:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 38, 18, 18</bibl></cit>; cf. <hi rend="ital">pass.</hi> in mid. force: <cit><quote lang="la">mare neque redundat umquam neque effunditur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:45:116" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 45, 116</bibl></cit>; v. also under <pos>P. a.</pos>—</sense><sense id="n15293.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of non-liquid bodies. </sense><sense id="n15293.3" n="1" level="3"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">to pour out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pour forth</hi>, <hi rend="ital">drive out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cast out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">send out</hi> (mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in postAug. prose; <cit><quote lang="la">a favorite word of Vergil): saccos nummorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:3:149" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 3, 149</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">frumentum in flumen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:9:2:27:section=19" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 9, 2, 27, § 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ei oculus effunditur,</quote> <trans><tr>is knocked out</tr>, <tr>put out</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:19:2:13:section=4" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 19, 2, 13, § 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tela,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>to shoot in great numbers</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:509" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 9, 509</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 27, 18</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">auxilium castris apertis,</quote> <trans><tr>to send forth</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:522" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 522</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">equus consulem lapsum super caput effudit,</quote> <trans><tr>threw</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:3:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 22, 3, 11</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 10, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:32" default="NO" valid="yes">27, 32</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:160" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 42, 65, § 160</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:8:14:34" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 8, 14, 34</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:574" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 10, 574</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">893</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:8:358" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 8, 358</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">(quae via) Excutiat Teucros vallo atque effundat in aequum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 9, 68</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sub altis portis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 11, 485</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem solo,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 12, 532</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">caput in gremium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:7:7:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 7, 7, 4</bibl></cit>. —<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">carmina molli numero fluere, ut per leve severos Effundat junctura ungues,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>lets it slip over smoothly</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:1:65" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 1, 65</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n15293.4" n="2" level="3"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n15293.5" n="a" level="4"> With <hi rend="ital">se</hi>, or mid. of persons, <hi rend="ital">to pour out</hi> in a multitude, <hi rend="ital">to rush out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">spread abroad</hi> (a favorite expression with the historians): <cit><quote lang="la">omnis sese multitudo ad cognoscendum effudit (sc. ex urbe),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:7:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 2, 7, 3</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">se,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 7, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 26, 19</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:34:8" default="NO" valid="yes">34, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:33:12:10" default="NO" valid="yes">33, 12, 10</bibl>; 35, 39, 5; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:7:6:6" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 7, 6, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:112:4" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 112, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:4" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 4 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:44" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Caes. 44</bibl> et saep.
