(but not in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:19:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 19, 2</bibl>, where the better reading is: <cit><quote lang="la">se ejecerat, v. Schneider ad h. l.): omnibus portis effunduntur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:38:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 38, 6</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">so mid.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 23</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:40:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 40, 40, 10</bibl>; and esp. freq. in the <hi rend="ital">part.</hi> effusus, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 55:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 55, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:69:2" default="NO" valid="yes">69, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 14</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:31" default="NO" valid="yes">9, 31</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 4, 25 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl default="NO">12, 31</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">15, 23</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:305" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 305</bibl> et saep.—<hi rend="ital">Ellips. of se</hi>: ubi se arctat (mare) Hellespontus vocatur; Propontis, ubi expandit; ubi iterum pressit, Thracius Bosporus; <cit><quote lang="la">ubi iterum effundit, Pontus Euxinus,</quote> <trans><tr>spreads out</tr>, <tr>widens</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:1:1:5" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 1, 1, 5</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n15293.6" n="b" level="4"> With the accessory notion of producing, <hi rend="ital">to bring forth</hi>, <hi rend="ital">produce abundantly</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">non solum fruges verum herbas etiam effundunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:15:48" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 15, 48</bibl></cit>; cf.: fruges (auctumnus),<cb n="EFFU" />  <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:7:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 7, 11</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">copiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:9:36" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 9, 36</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n15293.7" n="c" level="4"> Of property, <hi rend="ital">to pour out</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">to lavish</hi>, <hi rend="ital">squander</hi>, <hi rend="ital">waste</hi>, <hi rend="ital">run through</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">patrimonium per luxuriam effundere atque consumere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:2:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 2, 6</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">patrimonium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:3:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 3, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aerarium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:1:5:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Agr. 1, 5, 15</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:3:20:48" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 3, 20, 48</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sumptus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:24:68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Am. 24, 68</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">opes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:94" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 25, 26, § 94</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnes fortunas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:14:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 14, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">reditus publicos non in classem exercitusque, sed in dies festos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:6:9:3" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 6, 9, 3</bibl></cit>; and <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">effundite, emite, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:5:9:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 5, 9, 34</bibl></cit>.</sense><sense id="n15293.8" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n15293.9" n="A" level="2"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">effudi vobis omnia, quae sentiebam,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>have freely imparted</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 34 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:16:7:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 16, 7, 5</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fl. 17, 41</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:2:10" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 2, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:3:17" default="NO">10, 3, 17</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:7:434" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 7, 434</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">procellam eloquentiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:158" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 158</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">totos affectus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:1:28" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 4, 1, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tales voces,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:723" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 723</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">questus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 780</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">carmina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:12:139 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 12, 139 al.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vox in coronam turbamque effunditur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fl. 28 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">questus in aëra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:9:370" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 9, 370</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnem suum vinulentum furorem in me,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:12:25:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 12, 25, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">iram in aliquem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 39, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omne odium in auxilii praesentis spem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:31:44:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 31, 44, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">indignationem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,053:20:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Ezech. 20, 8</bibl></cit> et saep.—</sense><sense id="n15293.10" n="B" level="2"> In partic. (acc. to I. B. 2. a. and c.). </sense><sense id="n15293.11" n="1" level="3"> With <hi rend="ital">se</hi>, or mid., <hi rend="ital">to give one's self up to</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to give loose to</hi>, <hi rend="ital">yield to</hi>, <hi rend="ital">indulge in</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui se in aliqua libidine effuderit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,047:3:1:21" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Par. 3, 1, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se in omnes libidines,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:14:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 14, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(Pompeius) in nos suavissime hercule effusus,</quote> <trans><tr>has treated me with the most flattering confidence</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:4:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 4, 9</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">more freq., mid.: in tantam licentiam socordiamque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:20:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 25, 20, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in venerem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:29:23:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 29, 23, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in amorem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 54</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:8:4:25" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 8, 4, 25</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">in laetitiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:12:3:7" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 12, 3, 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:5:1:37" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 5, 1, 37</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">in jocos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:98" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 98</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in cachinnos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:32" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Calig. 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in questus, lacrimas, vota,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in lacrimas,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 23</bibl></cit>; 4, 8; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 2, 45</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">for which, lacrimis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:651" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 651</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ad preces lacrimasque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:44:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 44, 31 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad luxuriam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:34:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 34, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">terra effunditur in herbas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 8, 4, § 48</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">quorum stomachus in vomitiones effunditur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:23:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 23, 1, 23, § 43</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n15293.12" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To cast away</hi>, <hi rend="ital">give up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">let go</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dismiss</hi>, <hi rend="ital">resign</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">collectam gratiam florentissimi hominis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:2:16:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 2, 16, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">odium,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 9, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vires,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 10, 28</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:12:107" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 12, 107</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">curam sui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ira, 2:35" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ira, 2, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">verecundiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 11" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">animam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:98" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 98</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">vitam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:7:181" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 7, 181</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> Somn. Scip. 1, 1, 9</bibl>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 11, 25</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">spiritum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:70" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 70</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n15293.13" n="3" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To relax</hi>, <hi rend="ital">loosen</hi>, <hi rend="ital">slacken</hi>, <hi rend="ital">let go</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">manibus omnis effundit habenas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:818" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 818</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sive gradum seu frena effunderet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:9:182" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 9, 182</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">irarum effundit habenas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:499" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 499</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">effūsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos> </sense><sense id="n15293.14" n="I" level="1"> (Effundo, I. B. 1.) <hi rend="ital">Poured out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cast out;</hi> hence, <number>plur.</number> as <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">effusa</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the urine</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">reliquias et effusa intueri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Const. Sap. 13:1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Const. Sap. 13, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n15293.15" n="II" level="1"> (Effundo, I. B. 2.) <hi rend="ital">Spread out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">extensive</hi>, <hi rend="ital">vast</hi>, <hi rend="ital">broad</hi>, <hi rend="ital">wide</hi> (not freq. till after the Aug. per.).— <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n15293.16" n="1" level="3"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">effusumque corpus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:113" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 113</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">late mare,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 11, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">loca,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,002:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> G. 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">effusissimus Hadriatici maris sinus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:43" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">incendium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:30:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 30, 5</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">caedes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 42, 65</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cursus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 50</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:102" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 33, 52, § 102</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">membra,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>full</tr>, <tr>plump</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:6:841" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 6, 841</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n15293.17" n="2" level="3"> Esp., <hi rend="ital">relaxed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">slackened</hi>, <hi rend="ital">loosened</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dishevelled</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">habenis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:Strat. 2:5:31" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> Strat. 2, 5, 31</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">quam posset effusissimis habenis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:37:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 37, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">comae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:7:70" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 7, 70</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:1:9:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Am. 1, 9, 38</bibl> et saep.; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">also transf.: (nymphae) caesariem effusae nitidam per candida colla,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:337" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 337</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n15293.18" n="3" level="3"> Of soldiers or a throng of people, etc., <hi rend="ital">straggling</hi>, <hi rend="ital">disorderly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">scattered</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dispersed</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">effusum agmen ducit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:25:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 25, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aciem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:4:743" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 4, 743</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">huc omnis turba effusa ruebat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:305" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 305</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sine armis effusi in armatos incidere hostis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:30:5:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 30, 5, 8</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n15293.19" n="III" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n15293.20" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Profuse</hi>, <hi rend="ital">prodigal</hi>, <hi rend="ital">lavish</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quis in largitione effusior?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:6:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cael. 6, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">munificentiae effusissimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:41" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 41</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n15293.21" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Extravagant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">immoderate</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">licentia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:44:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 44, 1</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">laetitia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:35:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 35, 43 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cursus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:6:20:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 6, 20, 11</bibl></cit> et saep.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cultus in verbis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:8:58" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 3, 8, 58</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">laudationes,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 48, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">studium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:40" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 40</bibl></cit>.— <hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">effūse</orth>. </sense><sense id="n15293.22" n="1" level="3"> (Acc. to I.) <hi rend="ital">Far spread</hi>, <hi rend="ital">far and wide</hi>, <hi rend="ital">widely.</hi> </sense><sense id="n15293.23" n="a" level="4"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">ire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 105:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 105, 3</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">fugere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 22</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:48" default="NO" valid="yes">40, 48</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">persequi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:43:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 43, 23</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:9:8" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 9, 8</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">vastare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 10</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:44:30" default="NO" valid="yes">44, 30</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">effusius praedari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:34:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 34, 16</bibl></cit> et saep.: spatium annale effuse interpretari. <hi rend="ital">in a wide sense</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cod. Just.</author> 7, 40, 1</bibl>. <cb n="EGEO" /> —</sense><sense id="n15293.24" n="b" level="4"> Esp., <hi rend="ital">profusely</hi>, <hi rend="ital">lavishly</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">large effuseque donare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:chapter=8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 8 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">vivere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:chapter=16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cael. 16 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: liberalem esse, Aug. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:71" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 71</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">affluant opes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 26</bibl></cit>. —In the <hi rend="ital">comp.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 4, 62</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n15293.25" n="2" level="3"> (Acc. to II.) <hi rend="ital">Extravagantly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">immoderately</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum inaniter et effuse animus exsultat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:4:6:13" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 4, 6, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:6:26:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 6, 26, 2</bibl></cit>.— <hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">dicere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:1:20:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 1, 20, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fovere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:ib. 7:24:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 24, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">excipere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:22" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">favere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 1, 19</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">diligere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:7:30:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 7, 30, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:84:4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Pan. 84, 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
effuse: <entryFree id="n15294" type="main" key="effu_se"><orth extent="full" lang="la">effūse</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. preced. <sense id="n15294.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
effusio: <entryFree id="n15295" type="main" key="effu_si^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">effūsĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>effundo</etym>, <sense id="n15295.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a pouring out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pouring forth</hi>, <hi rend="ital">shedding</hi> (a Ciceron. word). </sense><sense id="n15295.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">atramenti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:49:127" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 49, 127</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aquae liquor et effusio, i. e. its property of pouring forth,</quote> <trans><tr>fluidity</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 10, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sanguinis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Judic. 9, 24</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">alvi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Capitol.</author> Gord. Tert. 28, 6</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n15295.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n15295.3" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A pouring</hi> or <hi rend="ital">rushing out</hi> of people: <cit><quote lang="la">effusiones hominum ex oppidis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:22:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Pis. 22, 51</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n15295.4" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Profusion</hi>, <hi rend="ital">prodigality</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Part. 23, 81</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:7:3:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 7, 3, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:44:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 44, 9</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Vop.</author> Flor. 1</bibl>.—In the <number>plur.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">pecuniarum effusiones,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:16:56" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 2, 16, 56</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:46:134" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Am. 46, 134</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n15295.5" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">extravagance</hi>, <hi rend="ital">excess</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">animi in laetitia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:4:31:66" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 4, 31, 66</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
effusor: <entryFree id="n15296" type="hapax" key="effu_sor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">effūsor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n15296.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a prodigal</hi>, <hi rend="ital">waster</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Serm. de Divers. 27" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Serm. de Divers. 27 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></sense></entryFree>
effusorie: <entryFree id="n15297" type="hapax" key="effu_so_ri^e"><orth extent="full" lang="la">effūsōrĭe</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>effusus, effundo</etym>, i. q. effuse, 1., <sense id="n15297.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">far and wide</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dispersedly</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 31, 16 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></sense></entryFree>
effusus: <entryFree id="n15298" type="main" key="effu_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">effūsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> and <pos>P. a.</pos>, from effundo.</entryFree>
effuticius: <entryFree id="n15299" type="hapax" key="effu_ti_ci^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">effūtīcĭus</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">-tĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>effutio</etym>, <sense id="n15299.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">prattling</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unmeaning</hi>, <hi rend="ital">inarticulate: euax</hi> verbum nihil significat, sed effuticium naturaliter est, <hi rend="ital">a mere natural utterance</hi> or <hi rend="ital">sound</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 7:section=92" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 7, § 92</bibl> Müll.</sense></entryFree>
effutio: <entryFree id="n15300" type="main" key="effu_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ef-fūtĭo</orth>, no <sense id="n15300.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">perf.</hi>, <itype>ītum, 4</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>FVTIO, acc. to <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 631</bibl> P.</etym>, <hi rend="ital">to blab out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">babble forth</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to prate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">chatter</hi>, <hi rend="ital">utter</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">multa ore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:910" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 910</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:30:84" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 1, 30, 84</bibl></cit>; * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:231" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 231</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:5:1" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 5, 1</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">effutita temere (vaticinia),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:55:113" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 55, 113</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">de mundo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:37:94" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 2, 37, 94</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n15300.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg> </sense><sense id="n15300.2" n="(a)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">To blab</hi>, <hi rend="ital">tell secrets</hi>: eo perperam olim dixi, ne vos foris effutiretis; and <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Ter.</author> Ph. 5, 1, 19</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n15300.3" n="(b)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">To talk idly</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex tempore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:31:88" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 5, 31, 88</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
effutuo: <entryFree id="n15301" type="main" key="effu^tu^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ef-fŭtŭo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">ec-f-</orth>), <itype>ŭi, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n15301.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to waste in debauchery</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ecfututa latera,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:6:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 6, 13</bibl></cit>: aurum, Poëta ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:51" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 51 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></sense></entryFree>
egelido: <entryFree id="n15302" type="hapax" key="e_ge^li^do"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ē-gĕlĭdo</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>gelidus</etym>, <sense id="n15302.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to thaw away</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 4, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
egelidus: <entryFree id="n15303" type="main" key="e_ge^li^dus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ē-gĕlĭdus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <sense id="n15303.0" n="I" level="1"> (<hi rend="ital">Ex</hi> priv. as in effrenare.) <hi rend="ital">Not cold; lukewarm</hi>, <hi rend="ital">tepid</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose): <cit><quote lang="la">potio et frigidae propior,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:4:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 4, 18 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">aqua (opp. frigida),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:6:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 6, 18</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:82" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 82</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">tepores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:46:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 46, 1</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">ver (with mollissimus annus), Col. poët. 10, 282: hiemes,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Ep. 24, 97</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Notus (opp. gelidus Boreas),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:2:11:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 2, 11, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Mosella,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Ep. 2, 4</bibl></cit>.—* </sense><sense id="n15303.1" n="II" level="1"> (<hi rend="ital">Ex</hi> intensive, as in edurus, efferus, etc.) <hi rend="ital">Chilly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">chill</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cold</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">flumen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:8:610" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 8, 610</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">Forbig. ad loc. (Rib. ecgelido): Hister,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Caes. 21, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aquae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:31:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 31, 2, 6, § 10</bibl></cit>: exhalatio, App. de Mundo, 8.</sense></entryFree>
egelo: <entryFree id="n15304" type="main" key="e_ge^lo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ē-gĕlo</orth>, no <sense id="n15304.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">perf.</hi>, <itype>ātus, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">to take off the chill</hi>, <hi rend="ital">make lukewarm</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">leviter egelatum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Acut. 3:5:58" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Acut. 3, 5, 58</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 4:3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tard. 4, 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
egens: <entryFree id="n15305" type="main" key="e^gens"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĕgens</orth>, <itype>entis</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> and <pos>P. a.</pos>, from egeo.</entryFree>
egenulus: <entryFree id="n15306" type="hapax" key="e^ge_nu^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĕgēnŭlus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <sense id="n15306.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">adj. dim.</hi> [egenus], <hi rend="ital">needy</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Paul. Nol.</author> 29, 12</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
egenus: <entryFree id="n15307" type="main" key="e^ge_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĕgēnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>egeo</etym>, <sense id="n15307.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">in want of</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in need of</hi>, <hi rend="ital">destitute</hi> or <hi rend="ital">void of</hi> any thing (rare, and mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg> for egens). </sense><sense id="n15307.1" n="(a)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">(nos) omnium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:599" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 599</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnis spei,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 53</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aquarum (regio),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 15, 3</bibl></cit> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 30</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">decoris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:6:304" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 6, 304</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n15307.2" n="(b)" level="5"> With <case>abl.</case>: <cit><quote lang="la">commeatu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:12:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 12, 46</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">15, 12</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n15307.3" n="(g)" level="5"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">res,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>indigent</tr>, <tr>needy</tr>, <tr>necessitous</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:2:3:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 2, 3, 46</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:1:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Poen. 1, 1, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:91" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 91</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">8, 365</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">10, 367</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">frater,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,005:15:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Deut. 15, 11</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n15307.4" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Poor</hi>, <hi rend="ital">worthless</hi>, <hi rend="ital">beggarly</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad infirma et egena elementa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,009:4:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Gal. 4, 9</bibl></cit>. —<pos>Subst.</pos> </sense><sense id="n15307.5" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">ĕgēnus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a poor man</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">et pauper,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,027:34:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Psa. 34, 10</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Sir. 4, 4 al.</bibl> —</sense><sense id="n15307.6" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">ĕgēnum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a poor soil</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">in egeno,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:3:10:4" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 3, 10, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:4:31:1" default="NO">4, 31, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
egeo: <entryFree id="n15308" type="main" key="e^ge^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĕgĕo</orth>, <itype>ŭi, 2</itype> (<sense id="n15308.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">part. fut.</hi> egitura, <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Marc. 4, 24</bibl>), <pos>v. n.</pos> <etym>cf. Gr. <foreign lang="greek">a)xh/n</foreign>, poor; root <foreign lang="greek">ax-, agx</foreign>, in <foreign lang="greek">a)/xos, a)/gxw</foreign>, etc.; Lat. angustus,<pb n="633" /> <cb n="EGER" />  angina</etym>, <hi rend="ital">to be needy</hi> (for syn. cf.: indigeo, careo, vaco). </sense><sense id="n15308.1" n="I" level="1"> Prop. </sense><sense id="n15308.2" n="a" level="4"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg> (so usually in Plaut. and Ter.), <hi rend="ital">to be needy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to be in want</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to be poor</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">me in divitiis esse agrumque habere, egere illam autem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:3:2:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 3, 2, 57</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:1:3:73" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Most. 1, 3, 73</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:2:1:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Truc. 2, 1, 12</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 2, 32</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:2:2:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Trin. 2, 2, 49</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:3:4:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Capt. 3, 4, 49</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:5:2:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 5, 2, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,003:chapter=8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Com. 8</bibl> (opp. locupletem esse); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:2:103" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 2, 103</bibl> (opp. dives); <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 1, 2, 56</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 1, 228</bibl> et saep.—<hi rend="ital">Pass. impers.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">amatur atque egetur acriter,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:3:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 1, 3, 39</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n15308.3" n="b" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">To need</hi>, <hi rend="ital">want</hi>, <hi rend="ital">lack</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to be in need of</hi>, with the thing needed. </sense><sense id="n15308.4" n="(a)" level="5"> In the <case>abl.</case>: <cit><quote lang="la">earum rerum, quibus egeremus, invectio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:3" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 2, 3 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:5" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 2, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:10:16:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 10, 16, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnibus necessariis rebus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:32:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 32, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">copiis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:16" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 16 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oculis ad cernendum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:57:143" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 2, 57, 143</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bibliothecis Graecis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:2:2:6" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 2, 2, 6</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:2:5" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 2, 2, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">medicină,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:chapter=3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nullo,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 9, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">consilio, opera nostra,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 14</bibl></cit> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">auxilio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:2:17:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 2, 17, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sapiens eget nulla re: egere enim necessitatis est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 9" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 9 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></cit> (cf. I. a. supra).—Of inanimate subjects: <cit><quote lang="la">opus eget exercitatione non parva,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:5:17" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 5, 17</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:6:38" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 6, 38</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:8:4" default="NO">1, 8, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:10:7" default="NO">1, 10, 7</bibl> et saep.—</sense><sense id="n15308.5" n="(b)" level="5"> In the <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi> (in Cic. dub., <xr><lbl>v.</lbl> <ref type="sym" targOrder="U">the foll.</ref></xr>): <cit><quote lang="la">si pudoris egeas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:2:2:187" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 2, 2, 187</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tui, admonitricis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:2:6:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Truc. 2, 6, 20</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:4:2:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 4, 2, 42</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 18, 67</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">auxilii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:6:11:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 6, 11, 4</bibl></cit>: medicinae (al. medicina; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">the preced.),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:9:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 9, 3 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">medici, curatoris,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 1, 102</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">custodis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:4:118" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> S. 1, 4, 118</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aeris (opp. locuples mancipiis),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 1, 6, 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nullius,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 17, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nutricis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:6:135" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 6, 135</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alienae facundiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:13:3 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 13, 3 al.</bibl></cit>—Of inanimate subjects: <cit><quote lang="la">nec prosum quicquam nostrae rationis egere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 44</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:14:5" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 14, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:16:13" default="NO">2, 16, 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:8:63 al" default="NO">3, 8, 63 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n15308.6" n="(g)" level="5"> In the <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec quicquam eges,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:1:2:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 1, 2, 12</bibl></cit>; cf. the foll.—</sense><sense id="n15308.7" n="(d)" level="5"> Supplied by <hi rend="ital">inf. pass.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">clariores quam ut indicari egeant, Athenae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:3:4" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 2, 3, 4</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:4:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2, 4, 1</bibl>.</sense><sense id="n15308.8" n="II" level="1"> Sometimes transf. </sense><sense id="n15308.9" n="A" level="2"> (For the usual careo.) <hi rend="ital">To be without</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to be destitute of</hi>, <hi rend="ital">not to have</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">C. Macer auctoritate semper eguit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:67:238" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 67, 238</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">donis tuis, somne,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:5:4:2" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 5, 4, 2</bibl></cit>.—Of inanimate subjects: <cit><quote lang="la">res proprio nomine,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:134" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 134</bibl></cit>. —* </sense><sense id="n15308.10" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To do without</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to bear the want of</hi>: si quid est, quod utar, utor; si non est, egeo, Cato ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:13:23:1" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 13, 23, 1</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n15308.11" n="C" level="2"> Like the Gr. <foreign lang="greek">de/omai</foreign> (cf. also the Engl. <hi rend="ital">to want</hi>), <hi rend="ital">to desire</hi>, <hi rend="ital">wish for</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tui amans abeuntis egeo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:3:3:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 3, 3, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">plausoris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:154" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 154</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tantuli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:1:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> S. 1, 1, 59</bibl></cit>; cf. in the <case>abl.</case>: <cit><quote lang="la">pane,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 1, 10, 11</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">ĕgens</orth>, <itype>entis</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">needy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">necessitous</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in want</hi>, <hi rend="ital">very poor</hi> (class.; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">egenus, indigens, indigus, inops, pauper, mendicus): quocirca (amici) et absentes assunt egentes abundant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:chapter=7" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:1:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Pers. 1, 1, 1</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 3, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:2:2:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Stich. 2, 2, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:3:3:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 3, 3, 30</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:2:3:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phorm. 2, 3, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:59:163" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 59, 163</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fl. 15, 35</bibl> et saep.; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">opp. locuples,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:59:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 59, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:22:5:3" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 22, 5, 3</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">opp. abundans,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,047:6:1:43" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Par. 6, 1, 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">delectus egentium ac perditorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:4:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 4, 2</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 31:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 31, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:18:4" default="NO" valid="yes">18, 4</bibl>.— <hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil rege egentius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:6:1:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 6, 1, 4</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">egestates tot egentissimorum hominum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:9:7:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 9, 7, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:52:111" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sest. 52, 111</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:chapter=8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Am. 8 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">opp. locuples,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 47</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi> does not occur.</sense></entryFree>
egeria: <entryFree id="n15309" type="main" key="E_ge^ri^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ēgĕrĭa</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">Aeg-</orth>), <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*)hgeri/a</foreign>, <sense id="n15309.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a nymph</hi> or <hi rend="ital">Camoena celebrated in Roman mythology</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the wife and instructress of Numa</hi>, with two sacred groves and fountains, the one near Rome, opposite the Porta Capena, the other in the neighborhood of Aricia, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 19</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21" default="NO" valid="yes">21</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:1:2:1" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 1, 2, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:3:154" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 3, 154</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">261</bibl> sq.; 4, 669; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:482 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 15, 482 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:763" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 763</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">775</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:3:12 sq" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 3, 12 sq.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
egeries: <entryFree id="n15310" type="main" key="e_ge^ri^es"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ēgĕrĭes</orth>, <itype>em, e</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>egero</etym>, <sense id="n15310.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">excrement</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dung</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Sol.</author> 40, 11</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Paul. Nol.</author> Carm. 32, 281</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
egermino: <entryFree id="n15311" type="main" key="e_germi^no"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ē-germĭno</orth>, <itype>āvi, 1</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, <sense id="n15311.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to put forth</hi>, <hi rend="ital">shoot</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sprout</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:4:17:4" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 4, 17, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:27:4" default="NO">27, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:32:5" default="NO">32, 5</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
egero: <entryFree id="n15312" type="main" key="e_ge^ro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ē-gĕro</orth>, <itype>gessi, gestum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n15312.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to carry</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bear</hi> or <hi rend="ital">bring out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to lead</hi> or <hi rend="ital">draw out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to discharge</hi> (not ante-Aug.). </sense><sense id="n15312.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">praedam ex hostium tectis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 6, 3</bibl></cit> Drak.; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 9, 31</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:25" default="NO" valid="yes">25, 25</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">pecuniam ex aerario,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:30:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 30, 39 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fluctus (e navi),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:11:488" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 11, 488</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">stercus e columbariis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:2:14:1" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 2, 14, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">humanas opes a Veiis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">humum scrobibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:2:2:19" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 2, 2, 19</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:243" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 7, 243</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">tantum nivis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">silices umeris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 33</bibl></cit>, <cb n="EGO" /> 4, 21, § <cit><quote lang="la">71: aquam vomitu,</quote> <trans><tr>to discharge</tr>, <tr>void</tr>, <tr>vomit</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:7:5" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 7, 5</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">dapes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:6:664" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 6, 664</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">urinam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:29:102" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 29, 5, 32, § 102</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sanguinem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:31:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 31, 6, 33, § 62</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:10:136" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 10, 136</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">multum vitalis spiritus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:15:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 15, 64</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">viscera sua,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,016:21:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 2 Par. 21, 19</bibl></cit>.—Of inanimate subjects: <cit><quote lang="la">gravitas caeli egerit populos,</quote> <trans><tr>drives out</tr>, <tr>drives forth</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 91" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 91</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n15312.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Poet.</usg> for efferre (I. B. 1.), <hi rend="ital">to carry to the grave</hi>: (Phoebus) egessit avidis Dorica castra (i. e. Graecos) rogis (<case>dat.</case>), <hi rend="ital">sent the Greeks to the funeral piles;</hi> acc. to others, <hi rend="ital">exhausted</hi>, <hi rend="ital">made empty the Grecian camp</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4</bibl> (5), 6, 34; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:1:37" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 1, 37</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n15312.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: tales pietas paritura querelas Egerit, <hi rend="ital">pours forth</hi>, prodit, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:2:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 2, 64</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">iras ululatibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:4:280" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 4, 280</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sermones, i. q. edere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 66:4" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 66, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">expletur lacrimis egeriturque dolor,</quote> <trans><tr>is expelled</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:4:3:38" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 4, 3, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tota querelis Egeritur fletuque dies,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>is passed</tr>, <tr>spent</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:8:455" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 8, 455</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">noctem metu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:5:299" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 5, 299</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">animam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:3:718" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 3, 718</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
egersimon: <entryFree id="n15313" type="greek" key="e^gersi^mon"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĕgersĭmon</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">e)ge/rsimon</foreign>, <sense id="n15313.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a means of excitement</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 9, § 911</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
egesta: <entryFree id="n15314" type="main" key="Egesta"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Egesta</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n15314.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the Greek name of Segesta</hi> (sc. <foreign lang="greek">*)/egesta</foreign>), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=340:5" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 340, 5</bibl> Müll.</sense></entryFree>
egestas: <entryFree id="n15315" type="main" key="e^gestas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĕgestas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>egeo</etym>, <sense id="n15315.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">indigence</hi>, <hi rend="ital">extreme poverty</hi>, <hi rend="ital">necessity</hi>, <hi rend="ital">want</hi> (very freq. and class.; <cit><quote lang="la">for syn. cf.: indigentia, inopia, penuria, paupertas, mendicitas): ista paupertas, vel potius egestas ac mendicitas,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Parad. 6, 1, 45</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:2:4:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 2, 4, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:2:2:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Trin. 2, 2, 57</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">77</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 2, 5 al.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:chapter=49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 49 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:2:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cat. 2, 11 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:1:47:88" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Inv. 1, 47, 88</bibl>; * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:6:24:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 6, 24, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:146" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 146</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 319</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:276" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 6, 276</bibl> et saep.; cf. in <number>plur.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">egestates tot egentissimorum hominum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:9:7:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 9, 7, 5</bibl></cit>.—Of inanimate things: <cit><quote lang="la">patrii sermonis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:832" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 832</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:260" default="NO" valid="yes">3, 260</bibl>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">linguae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:139" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1, 139</bibl></cit>; and: <cit><quote lang="la">animi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:chapter=11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Pis. 11</bibl></cit>. —With an <hi rend="ital">object-genitive</hi>, <hi rend="ital">want of</hi> something: <cit><quote lang="la">pabuli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 44:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 44, 4</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">cibi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:6:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 6, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rei familiaris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vit.:7" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Vit. 7</bibl></cit>: rationis, <hi rend="ital">want of knowledge</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">ignorance</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:1211" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 1211</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
egestio: <entryFree id="n15316" type="main" key="e_gesti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ēgestĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>egero</etym>, <sense id="n15316.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a carrying out</hi> or <hi rend="ital">off</hi>, <hi rend="ital">an emptying</hi>, <hi rend="ital">voiding</hi> (post-Aug. and rare): <cit><quote lang="la">cadaverum et ruderum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:38" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ventris et urinae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 5:10" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Tard. 5, 10</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">for which simply egestio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:44" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Claud. 44 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> Vet. 5, 14, 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">publicarum opum,</quote> <trans><tr>a wasting</tr>, <tr>squandering</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:8:6:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 8, 6, 7</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
egestivus: <entryFree id="n15317" type="hapax" key="e_gesti_vus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ēgestīvus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>.—In medic. lang., <sense id="n15317.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">purgative</hi>: vis, Macer de Anetho, 14.</sense></entryFree>
egestosus: <entryFree id="n15318" type="main" key="e^gesto_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĕgestōsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>egestas</etym>, <sense id="n15318.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">very poor</hi>, <hi rend="ital">indigent</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:Epit. 12 al" default="NO"><author>Aur. Vict.</author> Epit. 12 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
egestus: <entryFree id="n15319" type="main" key="e_gestus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ēgestus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from egero.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n15320" type="main" key="e_gestus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ēgestus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>egero</etym>, <sense id="n15320.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a carrying out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">emptying</hi>, <hi rend="ital">voiding</hi> (post-Aug. and very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">alto egestu penitus cavare terras,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:4:3:42" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 4, 3, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ventris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 3:30:4" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 3, 30, 4</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
egigno: <entryFree id="n15321" type="hapax" key="e_gigno"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ē-gigno</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, <sense id="n15321.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to procreate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">produce</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bring forth</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">et altos interdum ramos egigni corpore vivo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:703" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 703</bibl></cit> Lachm. <hi rend="ital">N. cr.</hi></sense></entryFree>
eglecopala: <entryFree id="n15322" type="foreign" key="eglecopala"><orth extent="full" lang="la">eglecopala</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, a Gallic name for <sense id="n15322.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">blue marl</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 8, 4, § 46</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
egnatia: <entryFree id="n15323" type="main" key="Egna_ti^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Egnātĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <sense id="n15323.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A city and harbor on the coast of Appulia</hi>, <hi rend="ital">now Torre d' Agnazzo</hi> or <hi rend="ital">Monopoli</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:240" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 107, 111, § 240</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">the same called Gnatia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:5:97 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 5, 97 sq.</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:4:7" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 2, 4, 7</bibl>; Inscr. in Avellino Bull. Arch. Ottobre, 1845.—</sense><sense id="n15323.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The name of a female</hi>, v. Egnatius <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
egnatius: <entryFree id="n15324" type="main" key="Egna_ti^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Egnātĭus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n15324.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Roman proper name.</hi> </sense><sense id="n15324.1" n="1" level="3"> L. Egn. Rufus, <hi rend="ital">friend of Cicero</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:13:43 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 13, 43 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:7:18:4 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 7, 18, 4 al.</bibl>— </sense><sense id="n15324.2" n="2" level="3"> M. Egn. Rufus, <hi rend="ital">the name of an edile</hi>, 733 A. U. C., <hi rend="ital">who set on foot a conspiracy against Augustus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:19" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 19</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:91 sq" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 91 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Clem. 1:9" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Clem. 1, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Brev. Vit. 5" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brev. Vit. 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 10</bibl>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Egnātĭānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of Egnatius</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">scelus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:93" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 93</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n15324.3" n="3" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Egnatia</orth> <itype>Maximilla</itype>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:15:71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 15, 71</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
egnatuleius: <entryFree id="n15325" type="main" key="Egna_tu^le_i^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Egnātŭlēĭus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, L., <sense id="n15325.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a quaestor who deserted with the</hi> legio Martia <hi rend="ital">from Antony to Octavius</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:3:3:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 3, 3, 7</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
ego: <entryFree id="n15326" type="main" key="e^go_^"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĕgō^</orth> (ŏ always in poets of the best age, as Cat., Verg., Hor., etc.; ō ante-class. and post-Aug., as <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:17:357" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 17, 357</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Epigr. 54, 6</bibl>, v. Corss. Ausspr. 2, 483; <sense id="n15326.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">gen.</hi> mei; <case>dat.</case> mihi; <case>acc.</case> and <case>abl.</case> me; <number>plur.</number>, <case>nom.</case>, and <case>acc.</case> nos; <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>, mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg>, nostrum; <hi rend="ital">gen. obj.</hi> nostri, rarely nostrum; for the <hi rend="ital">gen. possess.</hi> the <pos>adj.</pos> noster was used, q. v.; cf. <cb n="EGRE" /> Roby, Gram. 1, § 388; <case>dat.</case> and <case>abl.</case> nobis; mi in <case>dat.</case> for mihi, <hi rend="ital">part.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:5" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:106" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 106</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:104" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 104</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">in prose,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:7:24:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 7, 24, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:8:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 1, 8, 3</bibl> et saep.; old form also MIHEI, C. I. L. 1, 1016 al.; v. Neue, Formenl. 2, 180; old form of the <case>acc.</case> MEHE, acc. to <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:5:21" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 5, 21 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:2:3:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 2, 3, 45</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:1:244" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Am. 1, 1, 244</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 2497</bibl>; <hi rend="ital">gen. plur.</hi> nostrorum, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:2:2:110" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 2, 2, 110</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:3:1:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Poen. 3, 1, 37</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 2, 39</bibl>; id. Am. Fragm. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 285, 26</bibl>; <case>dat.</case> and <case>abl.</case> NIS = nobis, acc. to Fest. S. V. CALLIM, p. 47, 3 Müll.; <case>acc.</case> ENOS, Carm. Arval., Wordsworth, Fragm. and Spec. p. 160.—But as to me = mihi, cited in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=181:6 sq" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 181, 6 sq.</bibl> Müll., me is there not <case>dat.</case>, but <case>acc.</case>, v. Vahl. ad <bibl default="NO"><author>Enn.</author> p. 21</bibl>), <hi rend="ital">pron. pers.</hi> [Gr. <foreign lang="greek">e)gw/</foreign>; Sanscr. aham; Goth. ik; Germ. ich; Engl. I, etc.; <number>plur.</number> nos; Gr. <foreign lang="greek">nw=i+, nw=i+n</foreign>, from same stem with <hi rend="ital">acc. sing.</hi> me, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:Gr. Etym. p. 533" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> Gr. Etym. p. 533</bibl>], <hi rend="ital">I.</hi> </sense><sense id="n15326.1" n="I" level="1"> Prop.: <cit><quote lang="la">meruimus et ego et pater de vobis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:prol. 40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. prol. 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tum te audes Sosiam esse dicere, Qui ego sum?</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 1, 218</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ego tu sum, tu es ego: unanimi sumus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Sticn. 5, 4, 49</bibl></cit>; the combination alter ego v. under alter.—</sense><sense id="n15326.2" n="II" level="1"> Emphasized. </sense><sense id="n15326.3" n="A" level="2"> By the suffixes <hi rend="ital">met</hi> and <hi rend="ital">pte: Am.</hi> Quis te verberavit? <hi rend="ital">So.</hi> Egomet memet, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:2:1:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 2, 1, 60</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">credebam primo mihimet Sosiae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 1, 50</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quasi per nebulam nosmet scimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:5:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ps. 1, 5, 48</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">med erga,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:2:3:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Capt. 2, 3, 56</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cariorem esse patriam nobis quam nosmetipsos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:3:19" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 3, 19 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit> et saep.: mihipte, Cato ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=103" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 103</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">mepte fieri servom,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:5:8:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 5, 8, 10</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n15326.4" n="B" level="2"> By repetition: <cit><quote lang="la">meme ad graviora reservat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:9:651" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 9, 651</bibl></cit> (but <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:427" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 9, 427</bibl>, is written me, me); cf.: met and pte.—</sense><sense id="n15326.5" n="III" level="1"> Esp. to be noted are, </sense><sense id="n15326.6" n="1" level="3"> Mihi and nobis as <hi rend="ital">dativi ethici</hi> (Zumpt Gr. § 408; <cit><quote lang="la">A. and S. Gr. § 228 N.): quid enim mihi L. Pauli nepos quaerit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:19" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 19</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,047:5:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Par. 5, 2</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 3, 15</bibl>; and in the <number>plur.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid ait tandem nobis Sannio?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:2:4:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 2, 4, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sit mihi (orator) tinctus litteris, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:20:85" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 20, 85</bibl></cit>; cf. Liv. praef. § 9; 2, 29 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:11:14" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 11, 14</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:4:9" default="NO">2, 4, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:2:31" default="NO">12, 2, 31</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 45</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:1:46" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 1, 46</bibl> Drak.; and in the <number>plur.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">nobis jam paulatim accrescere puer incipiat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:2:1" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 2, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hic mihi Q. Fufius pacis commoda memorat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:8:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 8, 4</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 52:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 52, 11</bibl> Kritz; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:24:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 24, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">tu mihi seu magni superas jam saxa Timavi, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:8:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 8, 6</bibl></cit> et saep.—</sense><sense id="n15326.7" n="2" level="3"> Mecum, nobiscum (v. cum, II. <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>).—</sense><sense id="n15326.8" n="3" level="3"> Ad me veni, i. e. ad meam domum, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:16:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 16, 10</bibl>, v. ad, A. 2. a. </sense><sense id="n15326.9" n="(b)" level="5">. —</sense><sense id="n15326.10" n="4" level="3"> Nos, etc., for ego, etc., in grave or official lang., etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">nobis consulibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:3:8:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 3, 8, 18</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:1:7:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 1, 7, 4</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:1:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 1, 4</bibl>; so with <hi rend="ital">sing. constr.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec merito nobis inimica merenti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:3:6:55" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 3, 6, 55</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:107:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 107, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">absente nobis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:4:3:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 4, 3, 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:2:2:204" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 2, 2, 204</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
egomet: <entryFree id="n15327" type="main" key="e^go^met"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĕgŏmet</orth>, <sense id="n15327.0" n="I" level="1"><xr><lbl>v.</lbl> <ref type="sym" targOrder="U">the preced.</ref></xr> art. and met.</sense></entryFree>
egranatus: <entryFree id="n15328" type="hapax" key="e_gra_na_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ē-grānātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>granum</etym>, <sense id="n15328.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">shelled</hi>, <hi rend="ital">emptied</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">carinae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Plin. Val.</author> 3, 14</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
egredior: <entryFree id="n15329" type="main" key="e_gre^di^or"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ē-grĕdĭor</orth>, <itype>gressus, 3</itype> (<sense id="n15329.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">inf.</hi> egredier, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:3:4:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 3, 4, 32</bibl>), <hi rend="ital">v. dep. n.</hi> and <hi rend="ital">a.</hi> </sense><sense id="n15329.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Neutr.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to go</hi> or <hi rend="ital">come out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">come forth</hi> (class.). </sense><sense id="n15329.2" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n15329.3" n="1" level="3"> In gen., with <hi rend="ital">e</hi> or <hi rend="ital">ex</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">foras e fano,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:2:3:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 2, 3, 4</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">e fano huc,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 2, 49</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">e cubiculo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:12" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex oppido,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:2:13:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 2, 13, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">7, 11, 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex suis finibus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 31, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex castris,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 36, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">e curia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 48</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:31" default="NO" valid="yes">7, 31</bibl> et saep.—With <hi rend="ital">a</hi> or <hi rend="ital">ab</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ab sese,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:4:3:78" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 4, 3, 78</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Epid. 3, 2, 44</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:1:3:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 1, 3, 21</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ph. 5, 1, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:23" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Claud. 23</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">a nobis foras,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:3:2:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 3, 2, 50</bibl></cit>. —With simple <case>abl.</case>: <cit><quote lang="la">domo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:1:2:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 1, 2, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">portă,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:7" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:28:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B.
