G. 7, 28, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 16</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Romă,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Quint. 6, 24</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:5:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 5, 1</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:53" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 53</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:40" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tib. 40</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">tabernaculo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:91" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Aug. 91</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">triclinio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:36" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Calig. 36</bibl></cit> et saep.; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">domo foras,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:4:6:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Merc. 4, 6, 5</bibl></cit>.—With <pos>adv.</pos>: <cit><quote lang="la">hinc,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:2:2:74" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 2, 2, 74</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">intus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:2:4:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pers. 2, 4, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">unde,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:37:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 37, 4</bibl></cit> et saep.—<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">placide egredere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:1:3:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 1, 3, 1</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:3:2:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cas. 3, 2, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:2:6:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 2, 6, 59</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:3:2:36 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Poen. 3, 2, 36 sq.</bibl> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">foras,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:5:1:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 5, 1, 27</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:4:1:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Curc. 4, 1, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:2:1:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cas. 2, 1, 15</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:4:1:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 4, 1, 40</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 5, 16</bibl> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">obviam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">per medias hostium stationes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 5, 46</bibl></cit>; cf. <usg type="style">poet.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">per Veneris res,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:437" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 437</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">extra munitiones,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:6:35:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 6, 35, 9</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">6, 36, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:65:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 3, 65, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">extra fines, terminos, cancellos,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Quint. 10, 35 sq.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">extra portam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 68</bibl></cit>; cf.: ad portam, i. e. <hi rend="ital">out to the gate.</hi> id. <pb n="634" /> <cb n="EGRE" /> 33, 47 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">in vadum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 8, 24</bibl></cit> et saep.— </sense><sense id="n15329.4" n="b" level="4"> In an upward direction, <hi rend="ital">to go up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">climb</hi>, <hi rend="ital">mount</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ascend</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">scalis egressi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 60:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 60, 6</bibl></cit> Kritz.; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ad summum montis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:ib. 93:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 93, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in tumulum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 26, 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in altitudinem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 40, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in vallum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:3:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 3, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in tectum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 71</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in moenia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in sublime (liquor),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:111" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 42, 42, § 111</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">altius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:136" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 136</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n15329.5" n="2" level="3"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n15329.6" n="a" level="4"> <usg type="dom">Milit. t. t.</usg> </sense><sense id="n15329.7" n="(a)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">To step out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">leave</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne quispiam ordine egrederetur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 45:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 45, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n15329.8" n="(b)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">To move out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">march out</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">e castris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:36:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 36, 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">7, 58, 2 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">castris,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 11, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 91:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 91, 3</bibl>.—<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:77:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 77, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 91:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 91, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:106:4" default="NO" valid="yes">106, 4</bibl>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">also: in pacata,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 10, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad proelium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:35:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 2, 35, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad oppugnandum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 59:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 59, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n15329.9" n="b" level="4"> Naut. t. t. </sense><sense id="n15329.10" n="(a)" level="5"> (Ex) navi or <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to disembark</hi> from a vessel, <hi rend="ital">to land</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex navi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,023:5:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Vatin. 5, 12</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:4:26:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 4, 26, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:106:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 3, 106, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">navi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:4:21:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. G. 4, 21, 9</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:45:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 45, 13</bibl>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">ratibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:153" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 153</bibl></cit>; and <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:4:23:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 4, 23, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:21:91" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 21, 91</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">in terram,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 51</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:Strat. 2:5:44" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> Strat. 2, 5, 44</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">in litus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:ib. 1:5:7" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 5, 7</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n15329.11" n="(b)" level="5"> E portu, or <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to set sail</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:6:8:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 6, 8, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:7:23" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 7, 23</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:1:10:6" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 1, 10, 6</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n15329.12" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> in speaking, <hi rend="ital">to digress</hi>, <hi rend="ital">depart</hi>, <hi rend="ital">deviate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">wander</hi> (rarely): <cit><quote lang="la">a proposito ornandi causa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:21:82" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 21, 82</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ex quibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:9:4" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 3, 9, 4</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:3:15" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 4, 3, 15</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">extra praescriptum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:1:27" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1, 1, 27</bibl></cit>.</sense><sense id="n15329.13" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to go beyond</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to pass out of</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to leave</hi> (freq. in the historians, partic. since the Aug. per.; not ante-class., nor in Cic.). </sense><sense id="n15329.14" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">fines,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:44:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 44, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">munitiones nostras,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 3, 52 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">flumen Mulucham,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 110" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 110 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">urbem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 29 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:57" default="NO" valid="yes">3, 57</bibl> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>; 22, 55 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi> al.: <cit><quote lang="la">tecta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:6:20:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 6, 20, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tentoria,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 30</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:5:510" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 5, 510</bibl> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">navem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:Strat. 1:12:1" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> Strat. 1, 12, 1</bibl></cit> Oud. <hi rend="ital">N. cr.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">portum (navis),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:1:61" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 4, 1, 61</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n15329.15" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to overstep</hi>, <hi rend="ital">surpass</hi>, <hi rend="ital">exceed</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">per omnia fortunam hominis egressus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:40:2" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 40, 2</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">vetus familia neque tamen praeturam egressa,</quote> <trans><tr>yet had attained no higher honor than</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:3:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 3, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quintum annum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6</bibl></cit> prooem. § <cit><quote lang="la">6: modum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:6:16" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 8, 6, 16</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:4:146" default="NO">9, 4, 146</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:13:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 13, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sexum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 16, 10</bibl></cit> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">clementiam majorum suasque leges,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">relationem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">medios metus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:2:277" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 2, 277</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">tecta altitudinem moenium egressa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:3:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 3, 30 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
egregiatus: <entryFree id="n15330" type="main" key="e_gre^gi^a_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ēgrĕgĭātus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>egregius, II.</etym>, <sense id="n15330.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the rank and title of an</hi> Egregius <hi rend="ital">in the later per. of the empire</hi>, similar to <hi rend="ital">Your Excellency</hi>, Cod. Th. 8, 4, 3; 10, 7, 1 al.</sense></entryFree>
egregie: <entryFree id="n15331" type="main" key="e_gre^gi^e"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ēgrĕgĭe</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. egregius <sense id="n15331.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
egregius: <entryFree id="n15332" type="main" key="e_gre^gi^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ē-grĕgĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype> (<sense id="n15332.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">sup.</hi>: mulier egregiissimă formă, Pac. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> 3, p. 600 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl> P.; R<bibl default="NO"><author>ib.</author> Fragm. Trag. p. 105</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">egregiissime grammatice,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:14:5:3" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 14, 5, 3</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Vocat.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">egregi or egregie,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:14:5:1 sq" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 14, 5, 1 sq.</bibl></cit>), <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>ex-grex, Corss. Ausspr. 1, 504; hence, chosen from the herd, i. e.</etym>, <hi rend="ital">distinguished</hi>, <hi rend="ital">surpassing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">excellent</hi>, <hi rend="ital">eminent</hi> (for syn. cf.: praeclarus, eximius, divinus, magnificus). </sense><sense id="n15332.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen. (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">in procuratione civitatis, egregius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:49:215" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 49, 215</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">in bellica laude,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:21:84" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 21, 84</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in aliis artibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 82:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 82, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vir,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:19:69" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 19, 69</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">civis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:25:95" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 25, 95</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">poëta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:3:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 3, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">senatus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 49</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">par consulum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 27, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Caesar,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:6:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 6, 11</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">3, 25, 4</bibl> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">et praeclara indoles ad dicendum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 29</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:1:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 1, 1, 2</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Tac.</author> Or. 9</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">forma,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:1:1:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 1, 1, 45</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">facies,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:1:2:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phorm. 1, 2, 50</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">colores, odores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:739" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 739</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:20:64" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 2, 20, 64</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">corpus,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>exceedingly beautiful</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:6:67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 6, 67</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:5:13:14" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 5, 13, 14</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">os,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:4:78" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 4, 78</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">virtus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:28:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 28, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fides,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 19, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">voluntas in se,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 4, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">victoria,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 47</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">vir bello egregius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 47</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 7, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,001:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> Agr. 14</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:5:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 5, 49</bibl>.—With <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">animi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:417" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 11, 417</bibl></cit>; so, fati mentisque <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:3:99" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 3, 99</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">linguae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:5:77" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 5, 77</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">egregii juvenum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:2:152" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 2, 152</bibl></cit>.—In the <hi rend="ital">neutr. subst.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut alia magna et egregia tua omittam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 10:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 10, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">postquam cuncta scelerum suorum pro egregiis accipi videt,</quote> <trans><tr>for distinguished acts</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:14:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 14, 60</bibl></cit>; cf. the foll.—</sense><sense id="n15332.2" n="II" level="1"> Post - Aug., esp. of rank and consequence, <hi rend="ital">distinguished</hi>, <hi rend="ital">illustrious</hi>, <hi rend="ital">honorable</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">si te privatus adoptarem, et mihi egregium erat Gnaei Pompeii subolem in penates meos asciscere, et, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 1</bibl></cit>, <cb n="EHO" /> 15; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">idque et sibi et cunctis egregium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:3:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 3, 6</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">ēgrĕgĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>: <cit><quote lang="la">egregium publicum,</quote> <trans><tr>the public honor</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:3:70" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 3, 70 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Egrĕgĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a title of public officers in high station</hi>, similar to <hi rend="ital">His Excellency</hi>, Cod. Th. 6, 22, 1; and: <cit><quote lang="la">Vir Egregius,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Grut.</author> 89, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">345, 3</bibl> et saep.; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 5, 14 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>—Hence, <pos>adv.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">ēgrĕgĭe</orth>, <hi rend="ital">excellently</hi>, <hi rend="ital">eminently; surpassingly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">exceedingly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">singularly; uncommonly well</hi> (cf.: eximie, unice, praesertim ; praecipue, maxime, potissimum, etc.). </sense><sense id="n15332.3" n="(a)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">verbs</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">studere (opp. mediocriter),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:1:1:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 1, 1, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pingere, fingere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:chapter=73" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 73 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">loqui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:6" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 2, 6 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vincere,</quote> <trans><tr>brilliantly</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 40</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">absolvi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 9, 26</bibl></cit> et saep.—Far more freq., </sense><sense id="n15332.4" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">adjectives</hi>: egregie cordatus homo, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:18" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 18</bibl> (Ann. v. 335 ed. Vahl.): <cit><quote lang="la">fortis et bonus imperator,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:66:268" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 66, 268</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">subtilis scriptor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:chapter=9" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">munitum oppidum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:2:29:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 2, 29, 2</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 9, 4</bibl>; 5, 11, 7 et saep.—</sense><sense id="n15332.5" n="(g)" level="5"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>, as an expression of assent, applause, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">egregie, Caesar, quod lacrimas parentum vectigales esse non pateris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:38:3" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 38, 3</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vit.:10" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Vit. 10</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">egregius cenat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:11:12" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 11, 12</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
egressio: <entryFree id="n15333" type="main" key="e_gressi^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ēgressĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>egredior</etym>, <sense id="n15333.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a going out</hi> or <hi rend="ital">forth</hi> (post-Aug.). </sense><sense id="n15333.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">nocturna (ex castello),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 8, p. 208, 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> Ep. 78, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">eorum ex Aegypto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,004:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Num. 1, 1</bibl></cit>; and so in gen. of <hi rend="ital">the Exodus</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">filiorum Israel,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 33, 38</bibl></cit>; 1 Reg. 18, 30.— </sense><sense id="n15333.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, in rhet. lang., <hi rend="ital">a digression</hi> in speaking, like <foreign lang="greek">pare/kbasis</foreign>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:3:12" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 4, 3, 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:15" default="NO">15</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:9:4" default="NO">3, 9, 4</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:3" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 4, 3</bibl>: de egressione.—In <number>plur.</number>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:164" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 11, 3, 164</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:10:60" default="NO">12, 10, 60</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
egressus: <entryFree id="n15334" type="main" key="e_gressus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ēgressus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from egredior.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n15335" type="main" key="e_gressus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ēgressus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>egredior</etym>, <sense id="n15335.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a going out</hi> or <hi rend="ital">away</hi> (class.). </sense><sense id="n15335.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n15335.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">egress</hi>, <hi rend="ital">departure.</hi> </sense><sense id="n15335.3" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">In abstr.</hi>: frequentia sua vestrum egressum (sc. in provinciam) ornando, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:chapter=13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Pis. 13 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Caesar rarus egressu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:15:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 15, 53</bibl></cit>.—In <number>plur.</number>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 35:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 35, 5</bibl> Kritz; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:3:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 3, 33</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">11, 12</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:1:138" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 1, 138</bibl>.—Of birds, <hi rend="ital">a flying out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">flight</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:11:748" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 11, 748</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:8:8:1" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 8, 8, 1</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n15335.4" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">In concreto</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">per tenebrosum et sordidum egressum extraho Gitona,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 91, 3</bibl></cit>.—In <number>plur.</number>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:16:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 16, 10</bibl>; and <usg type="style">poet.</usg> of <hi rend="ital">the mouths</hi> of the Ister, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:2:189" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 2, 189</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n15335.5" n="B" level="2"> In partic. (acc. to egredior, I. A. 2. b.), <hi rend="ital">a disembarking</hi>, <hi rend="ital">going ashore</hi>, <hi rend="ital">landing</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:8:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 8, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:23:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 3, 23, 1</bibl>; Auct. B. Afr. 3 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>—</sense><sense id="n15335.6" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, in rhet. lang. = egressio, II., <hi rend="ital">a digression</hi> in speaking, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:3:12" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 4, 3, 12</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">libero egressu memorare,</quote> <trans><tr>to narrate with freedom in digression</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 4, 32</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
egula: <entryFree id="n15336" type="main" key="e^gu^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĕgŭla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>perh. kindr. with <foreign lang="greek">a)xlu/s</foreign></etym>, <sense id="n15336.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of sulphur</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:175" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 35, 15, 50, § 175</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
egurgito: <entryFree id="n15337" type="hapax" key="e_gurgi^to"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ē-gurgĭto</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>gurges</etym>, <sense id="n15337.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to pour out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cast out</hi> (with the access. notion of extravagance), <hi rend="ital">to lavish</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">argentum domo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:4:2:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ep. 4, 2, 12</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
ehem: <entryFree id="n15338" type="main" key="e^hem"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĕhem</orth>, <pos>interj.</pos>, an exclamation of joyful surprise, <sense id="n15338.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">ha! what!</hi> ehem, optume! quam dudum tu advenisti? <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:2:4:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 2, 4, 43</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:3:2:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Most. 3, 2, 38</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:4:9:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 4, 9, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:3:5:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rud. 3, 5, 25</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:2:5:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 2, 5, 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ehem, pater me, tu hic eras?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:1:2:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Eun. 1, 2, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">3, 2, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:1:2:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ad. 1, 2, 1</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 2, p. 124, 29</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
eheu: <entryFree id="n15339" type="main" key="e_heu"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ēheu</orth>, <pos>interj.</pos>, an interjection of pain or grief, <sense id="n15339.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">ah! alas!</hi> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:1:2:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 1, 2, 49</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">5, 3, 18</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:2:4:102" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Trin. 2, 4, 102</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:4:8:32 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 4, 8, 32 al.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:1:1:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 1, 1, 31</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:1:1:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Hec. 1, 1, 17</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:1:4:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phorm. 1, 4, 10</bibl>.—Often followed by <hi rend="ital">quam</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">eheu, quam ego nunc totus displiceo mihi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:5:4:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 5, 4, 20</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:3:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 3, 66</bibl>. (The epic and lyric poets have everywhere ēheu; and hence many moderns, partly in accordance with better MSS., read everywhere heu heu; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">Burmann, Voss, Wagner, and Ribbeck,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:2:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 2, 58</bibl></cit>; also Forbig. ad loc.; Hand Turs. 2, 358 sq.; Sillig <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:page=283" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> p. 283</bibl>; Huschk. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:II. p. 711" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> II. p. 711</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">Fea and Keller,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:15:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 15, 9</bibl></cit>; but in <bibl default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 1, 35, 33</bibl>, and 2, 14, 1 al. the best editions have ēheu.)</sense></entryFree>
eho: <entryFree id="n15340" type="main" key="e^ho^"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĕhŏ</orth>, <pos>interj.</pos>; in the comic poets, used in asking, commanding, or scolding, <sense id="n15340.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">ha? ho! holla! soho!</hi> </sense><sense id="n15340.1" n="A" level="2"> In vehement questions, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:3:4:69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ep. 3, 4, 69</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">5, 2, 22</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:4:7:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Bacch. 4, 7, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">eho tu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:1:2:77" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Merc. 1, 2, 77</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:5:4:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 5, 4, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:4:4:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Eun. 4, 4, 24</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:2:3:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phorm. 2, 3, 35</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n15340.2" n="B" level="2"> In impetuous commands, Plaut. <cb n="EICI" /> Most. 3, 2, 157; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Men. 2, 3, 78</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ps. 1, 3, 114</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:5:9:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 5, 9, 13</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">eho puer,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:4:4:97" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Hec. 4, 4, 97</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n15340.3" n="C" level="2"> In angry remonstrance or invective, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:3:3:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 3, 3, 40</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:3:2:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 3, 2, 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:3:3:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pers. 3, 3, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:4:2:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 4, 2, 27</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:4:4:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phorm. 4, 4, 3</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n15340.4" n="II" level="1"> With affixed <hi rend="ital">dum</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:1:2:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 1, 2, 13</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 5, 10</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 1, 24</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:2:3:69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Eun. 2, 3, 69</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
ei: <entryFree id="n15341" type="main" key="e^i_1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĕī</orth>, <case>dat.</case> of is, q. v.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n15342" type="main" key="ei2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ei</orth>, <pos>interj.</pos>, <sense id="n15342.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">oh!</hi> etc., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:3:6:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cas. 3, 6, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:1:1:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 1, 1, 46</bibl>, v. hei.</sense></entryFree>
eia: <entryFree id="n15343" type="main" key="e_ia^"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ēiă</orth> (in MSS. also <orth extent="full" lang="la">hēiă</orth>), <pos>interj.</pos> <etym><foreign lang="greek">ei)/a</foreign></etym>. <sense id="n15343.0" n="I" level="1"> An expression of joy or of pleased surprise. </sense><sense id="n15343.1" n="A" level="2"> In admiring an object, <hi rend="ital">ah! ah ha! indeed!</hi> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:2:4:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 2, 4, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:2:3:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Men. 2, 3, 30</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:5:5:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 5, 5, 19</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 2, 10</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n15343.2" n="B" level="2"> In gentle remonstrance or persuasion, <hi rend="ital">ah! come!</hi> heia, mea Juno, non decet te, etc., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:2:3:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cas. 2, 3, 14</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:4:2:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Truc. 4, 2, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:4:3:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Bacch. 4, 3, 16</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 3, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:5:8:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 5, 8, 35</bibl>: heia quam ferocula est! Turp. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 75, 30</bibl> (R<bibl default="NO"><author>ib.</author> Fragm. Com. p. 98</bibl>).—</sense><sense id="n15343.3" n="C" level="2"> In strong affirmation, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:3:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 1, 3, 40</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:1:1:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Bacch. 1, 1, 43</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">and so ironically: eia credo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:5:2:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Capt. 5, 2, 9</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n15343.4" n="D" level="2"> With <hi rend="ital">vero</hi>, ironically, expressing amused doubt of what has been said, <hi rend="ital">pshaw!</hi> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:2:2:77" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ep. 2, 2, 77</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:4:4:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 4, 4, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:2:3:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rud. 2, 3, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:3:5" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 3, 5</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n15343.5" n="II" level="1"> Of impatient exhortation, <hi rend="ital">ho! quick! come on!</hi> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:3:1:71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 3, 1, 71</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:4:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 4, 29</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 9, 38</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:1:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 1, 18</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 6, 23</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">in the combination: eia age,</quote> <trans><tr>come then! up then!</tr></trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:569" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 569</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,003:2:198" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Ach. 2, 198</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Silv. 1, 2, 266</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
eicio: <entryFree id="n15344" type="main" key="e_i^ci^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ē-ĭcĭo</orth> (or <orth extent="full" lang="la">ejicio</orth>), <itype>jēci, jectum, 3</itype> (eicit, dissyl., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:877" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 877</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:1272" default="NO" valid="yes">4, 1272</bibl>), <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>jacio</etym>, <sense id="n15344.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to cast</hi>, <hi rend="ital">thrust</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">drive out; to eject</hi>, <hi rend="ital">expel</hi> (class.). </sense><sense id="n15344.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n15344.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem e senatu,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> de Sen. 12 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:43:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 43, 15</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ex oppido,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:30:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 30, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">de senatu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 40, 51</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:41:26" default="NO" valid="yes">41, 26</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">de collegio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Q. Fr. 2, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">a suis diis penatibus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Quint. 26, 83</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">finibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 14:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 14, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">domo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:1:3:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 1, 3, 9</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:4:7:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 4, 7, 3</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">aedibus foras,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:1:2:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 1, 2, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnes amasios foras,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:3:1:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Truc. 3, 1, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:42" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 42</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:chapter=38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 38 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:4:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 4, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 2, 19 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem in exsilium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:2:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 2, 7</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">o fortunatum rem publicam, si hanc sentinam hujus urbis ejecerit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 4, 7</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">eicere alone,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,006:1:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Lys. 1, 5</bibl></cit> et saep.; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">of a rider,</quote> <trans><tr>to throw</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:894" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 10, 894</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vitem ex se,</quote> <trans><tr>to shoot forth</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:31:3" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 31, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sanguinem,</quote> <trans><tr>to throw up</tr>, <tr>to vomit</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:24:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 24, 5, 10, § 15</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:14:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 14, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 1, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:27" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 27</bibl>.—<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg> (sc. fetum), <hi rend="ital">to miscarry</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:9:2:27:section=22" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 9, 2, 27, § 22</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:1272" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 1272</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">linguam,</quote> <trans><tr>to thrust out</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:66:266" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 66, 266</bibl></cit>: cervicem, <hi rend="ital">to dislocate</hi> (luxare), <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> Vet. 3, 41, 1</bibl>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">armum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 45, 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:984" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 10, 984</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">oculum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,002:9:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Marc. 9, 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">coxas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Fab. 57" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Fab. 57</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">voces pectore ab imo,</quote> <trans><tr>to utter</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 58</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fauces, e quibus eici vocem et fundi videmus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:2:24:57" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 2, 24, 57</bibl></cit> (al. elicere, v. elicio).—</sense><sense id="n15344.3" n="2" level="3"> Se (ex aliquo loco), <hi rend="ital">to rush out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sally forth</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:4:15:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 4, 15, 1</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">5, 15, 3</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">5, 21, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:16:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 3, 16, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:1:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 1, 12 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl> et saep.; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">sese in terram e navi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se in agros,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 6, 3</bibl></cit> (also in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:19:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 19, 2</bibl>, inst. of the vulg. reading effunderet): <cit><quote lang="la">se foras,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1, 40 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit> —</sense><sense id="n15344.4" n="B" level="2"> In partic., as a naut. t. t., <hi rend="ital">to drive</hi> a ship <hi rend="ital">to land.</hi> </sense><sense id="n15344.5" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To bring to land</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">naves,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:25:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 25, 4</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">navem in terram,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 28, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">naves ad Chium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:44:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 44, 28</bibl></cit>.—Far more freq., </sense><sense id="n15344.6" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To run aground</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cast ashore; to strand</hi>, <hi rend="ital">wreck.</hi> </sense><sense id="n15344.7" n="(a)" level="5"> Of vessels, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">scapham,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:1:2:80 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 1, 2, 80 sq.</bibl></cit> (v. the passage in connection): <cit><quote lang="la">naves in litore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:10:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 10, 2</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">naves in litora,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:29:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 29, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">classem ad Baleares insulas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 23, 34 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">naves apud insulas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 24</bibl></cit> et saep.—</sense><sense id="n15344.8" n="(b)" level="5"> Of persons, esp. in <hi rend="ital">perf. part. pass.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">wrecked</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:2:7:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 2, 7, 4</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 3, 78</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 5, 14</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:1:3:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 1, 3, 18</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">5, 4, 20</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:26:72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 26, 72</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:373" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 373</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:536" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 13, 536</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:7:89" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 7, 89</bibl> et saep.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n15344.9" n="b" level="4"> <usg type="style">Meton.</usg> (causa pro effectu): <cit><quote lang="la">ejectus homo,</quote> <trans><tr>a broken</tr>, <tr>ruined man</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Quint. 19 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit> (Acc. to others, <hi rend="ital">an outcast</hi>, acc. to II. B.)</sense><sense id="n15344.10" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n15344.11" n="A" level="2"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">to expel</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">curam ex animo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:prol. 23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cas. prol. 23</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:19:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 19, 53</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 28, 28</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:30:13" default="NO" valid="yes">30, 13</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">mollitiem animi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:2:1:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 2, 1, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">superstitionis stirpes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:72" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 72</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">ejectus die,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>deprived of light</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:4:617" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 4, 617</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n15344.12" n="b" level="4"> With <hi rend="ital">se</hi>: voluptates subito se nonnumquam<pb n="635" /> <cb n="EJUR" />  profundunt atque eiciunt universae, etc., <hi rend="ital">rush forth</hi>, <hi rend="ital">break forth</hi> or <hi rend="ital">out</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:31:75" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cael. 31, 75</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n15344.13" n="B" level="2"> In partic., like <foreign lang="greek">e)kba/llein</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">to reject</hi> disapprovingly: <cit><quote lang="la">Cynicorum ratio tota est eicienda,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:41:148" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 41, 148</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:31:86" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Clu. 31, 86</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:8:23" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 5, 8, 23</bibl> (in both passages with explodere), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:32:146" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 32, 146</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:2:24:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 2, 24, 2</bibl>.—Esp. of players, public speakers, etc., <hi rend="ital">to hiss</hi> or <hi rend="ital">hoot off</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 50 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 4, 47</bibl> (with deridere); cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">cantorum ipsorum vocibus eiciebatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:55:118" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sest. 55, 118</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
eidem: <entryFree id="n15345" type="main" key="e^i_dem"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĕīdem</orth>, <case>dat.</case> of idem, q. v.</entryFree>
eii: <entryFree id="n15346" type="main" key="eii"><orth extent="full" lang="la">eii</orth> and <orth extent="full" lang="la">eiius</orth>, v. is <sense id="n15346.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">init.</hi></sense></entryFree>
ejaculo: <entryFree id="n15347" type="main" key="e_ja^cu^lo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ējăcŭlo</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <sense id="n15347.0" n="I" level="1"><xr><lbl>v.</lbl> <ref type="sym" targOrder="U">the foll.</ref></xr> <hi rend="ital">init.</hi></sense></entryFree>
ejaculor: <entryFree id="n15348" type="main" key="e_ja^cu^lor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ē-jăcŭlor</orth>, <itype>ātus, 1</itype>, <sense id="n15348.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. dep. a.</hi> (and in the <hi rend="ital">act.</hi> form: <cit><quote lang="la">se in salum ejaculaverat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:16:19:21" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 16, 19, 21</bibl></cit>), <hi rend="ital">to shoot out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to hurl</hi> or <hi rend="ital">throw out</hi> (rare, and not ante-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">aquas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:124" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 124</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:1:270" default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 1, 270</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">se in altum (sanguis),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:6:259" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 6, 259</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">umbram in forum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:73" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 12, 23, § 73</bibl></cit>.!*? <orth extent="full" lang="la">ejaculari</orth>, <hi rend="ital">pass.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1011,001:Comp. 84" default="NO"><author>Scrib.</author> Comp. 84</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
ejectamentum: <entryFree id="n15349" type="main" key="e_jecta_mentum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ējectāmentum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>ejecto</etym>, <sense id="n15349.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that which is cast out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">refuse</hi> (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">cetera maris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,002:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> G. 45</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Mag. 35, p. 297</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
ejecticius: <entryFree id="n15350" type="hapax" key="e_jecti_ci^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ējectīcĭus</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">-tĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>eicio</etym>, <sense id="n15350.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that casts out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ejects</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vulva,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>that has miscarried</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:210" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 37, 84, § 210</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
ejectio: <entryFree id="n15351" type="main" key="e_jecti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ējectĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n15351.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a casting</hi> or <hi rend="ital">throwing out</hi> (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">sanguinis,</quote> <trans><tr>a spitting of blood</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:1:6:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 1, 6, 3</bibl></cit>: mortem et ejectionem timemus, i. e. <hi rend="ital">banishment</hi>, <hi rend="ital">exile</hi>, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:2:18:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 2, 18, 1</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Thren. 2, 14</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">articuli,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>dislocation</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 2:1:28" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Tard. 2, 1, 28</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
ejecto: <entryFree id="n15352" type="main" key="e_jecto"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ējecto</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. freq. a.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n15352.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to cast out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to throw up</hi> (a <usg type="style">poet.</usg> word of the Aug. per.): <cit><quote lang="la">arenas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:5:353" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 5, 353</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">favillam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:2:231" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 231</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">undas in campos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:10:320" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 10, 320</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quicquid ab auriferis fossis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:3:3:89" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 3, 3, 89</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cruentas dapes ore,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>to vomit</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:14:211" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 14, 211</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">saniem per ora,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:3:658" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 3, 658</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
ejectus: <entryFree id="n15353" type="main" key="e_jectus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ējectus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from eicio.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n15354" type="hapax" key="e_jectus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ējectus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>eicio</etym>, <sense id="n15354.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a casting out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">emission</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">largior animai foras,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>a breathing out</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:961" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 961</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
ejeratio: <entryFree id="n15355" type="main" key="e_je^ra_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ējĕrātĭo</orth> and <orth extent="full" lang="la">ējĕro</orth>, v. ejur.</entryFree>
ejicio: <entryFree id="n15356" type="main" key="e_jicio"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ējicio</orth>, v. eicio.</entryFree>
ejulabilis: <entryFree id="n15357" type="main" key="e_ju^la_bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ējŭlābĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>ejulo</etym>, <sense id="n15357.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">wailing loudly</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">plangor,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 4, p. 143, 31</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
ejulabundus: <entryFree id="n15358" type="main" key="e_ju^la_bundus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ējŭlābundus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n15358.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">abandoned to wailing</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1672,001:Rer. Gest. Alex. M. 2:16" default="NO"><author>Jul. Val.</author> Rer. Gest. Alex. M. 2, 16</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
ejulatio: <entryFree id="n15359" type="main" key="e_ju^la_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ējŭlātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>ejulo</etym>, <sense id="n15359.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a wailing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">lamenting</hi>, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:2:1:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 2, 1, 7</bibl>; * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:23" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 2, 23 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></sense></entryFree>
ejulatus: <entryFree id="n15360" type="main" key="e_ju^la_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ējŭlātus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n15360.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a wailing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">lamenting</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:2:23:55" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 2, 23, 55</bibl>; Auct. Or. de Har. Resp. 18, 39; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:1:26:7" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 1, 26, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,001:27:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Gen. 27, 38</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
ejulito: <entryFree id="n15361" type="hapax" key="e_ju^li^to"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ējŭlĭto</orth>, <itype>āvi, 1</itype>, <pos>v. freq. a.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n15361.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to lament greatly</hi>, Lucil. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 7:section=103" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 7, § 103</bibl> Müll., and ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 21, 20</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
ejulo: <entryFree id="n15362" type="main" key="e_ju^lo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ējŭlo</orth>, <itype>āre</itype> (also <sense id="n15362.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">dep.</hi> <orth extent="full" lang="la">hejulor</orth>, <itype>āri</itype>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> 797</bibl>), <pos>v. n.</pos> and <hi rend="ital">a.</hi> [from the exclamation hei, heu; cf. Doëd. Syn. 3, p. 156]. </sense><sense id="n15362.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Neutr.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to wail</hi>, <hi rend="ital">lament</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:2:4:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 2, 4, 39</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 9, 17</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 10, 66</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:4:1:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Merc. 4, 1, 16</bibl>; * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:2:7:19" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 2, 7, 19</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:12:5:9" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 12, 5, 9</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Job, 35, 9 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n15362.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to bewail</hi>, <hi rend="ital">lament over</hi> a person or thing (post - class.): <cit><quote lang="la">fortunas meas,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 3, p. 129</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sese altius,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4</bibl></cit>, p. 153, 24.</sense></entryFree>
ejuncesco: <entryFree id="n15363" type="hapax" key="e_juncesco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ē-juncesco</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, <sense id="n15363.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. inch. n.</hi> [juncus], <hi rend="ital">to grow</hi> or <hi rend="ital">shoot up like a rush</hi>: vitis, Plin: 17, 22, 35, § 182.</sense></entryFree>
ejuncidus: <entryFree id="n15364" type="main" key="e_junci^dus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ē-juncĭdus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n15364.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">grown</hi> or <hi rend="ital">shot up like a rush</hi>, <hi rend="ital">lean</hi>, <hi rend="ital">meagre</hi>, <hi rend="ital">slender</hi>: ejuncidum <foreign lang="greek">e)kleptwqe/n</foreign>, Gloss. Philox.: <cit><quote lang="la">sarmentum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:31:3" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 31, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mulieres,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:ib. 2:10:8" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 10, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vitis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:173" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 22, 35, § 173</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
ejuno: <entryFree id="n15365" type="gloss" key="E_ju_no"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ējūno</orth>, <sense id="n15365.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">inlerj.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">by Juno;</hi> v. Juno.</sense></entryFree>
ejuratio: <entryFree id="n15366" type="main" key="e_ju_ra_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ējūrātĭo</orth> (ējĕrātio, <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Spect. 4</bibl>; cf. ejuro), <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>ejuro, II.</etym>, <sense id="n15366.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an abjuring</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">a resigning</hi>, <hi rend="ital">abdication</hi>, <hi rend="ital">laying down</hi> of an office (post-Aug.). </sense><sense id="n15366.1" n="I" level="1"> Prop.: <cit><quote lang="la">ignominiosa consulum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:2:7:7" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 2, 7, 7 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>— </sense><sense id="n15366.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a resigning</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">bonae spei,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Vit. Beat. 26:5" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Vit. Beat. 26, 5</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
ejuro: <entryFree id="n15367" type="main" key="e_ju_ro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ē-jūro</orth> (mostly post-Aug., Cic. Fam., <sense id="n15367.0" n="I" level="1"><xr><lbl>v.</lbl> <ref type="sym" targOrder="U">infra</ref></xr>, and <orth extent="full" lang="la">ējĕro</orth>, <itype>like pejero</itype>, class., Scip. <cb n="ELAB" /> ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:70:285" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 70, 285</bibl> twice; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:12:7:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 12, 7, 18</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:60:section=137" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 60, § 137</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Spect. 24</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Idol. 18</bibl>), <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">to refuse</hi> or <hi rend="ital">reject by oath</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to abjure</hi>, a t. t. of jurid., polit., and mercant. lang. </sense><sense id="n15367.1" n="I" level="1"> In jurid. lang.: forum or judicem iniquum sibi, <hi rend="ital">to reject</hi>, <hi rend="ital">refuse on oath</hi> a court or a judge, as unjust, Scip. l. l.; Cic. Verr. l. l.; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Phil. 12, 7, 18</bibl> Manut. and Wernsd.—</sense><sense id="n15367.2" n="II" level="1"> In polit. law lang.: magistratum, imperium, etc., <hi rend="ital">to lay down</hi>, <hi rend="ital">resign</hi>, <hi rend="ital">abdicate</hi> an office, at the same time swearing to have administered it according to law: <hi rend="ital">jurando abdicare</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:3:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 3, 37</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">68</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 39</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:12:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 12, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:1:23:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 1, 23, 3</bibl>; and <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:13:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 13, 14</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n15367.3" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> beyond the polit. sphere (like abdicare), <hi rend="ital">to abandon</hi>, <hi rend="ital">forswear</hi>, <hi rend="ital">disown</hi> any thing: militiam, <hi rend="ital">to swear one's self unfit for service</hi>, cf. III. infra; Plaut. Fragm. ap. Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=77:17" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 77, 17</bibl> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">patriam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 4, 28</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">patriae nomen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:12:4:1" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 12, 4, 1</bibl></cit>; Asin. Pollio ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Suas. 7" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Suas. 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">liberos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Cons. ad Marc. 19" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Cons. ad Marc. 19</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">patrem (with aversari),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 6:4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ben. 6, 4</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">fidem domitoremque inimicum (leo),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Achill. 2, 188</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n15367.4" n="III" level="1"> In mercant. lang.: bonam copiam (as the opp. of <hi rend="ital">jurare</hi> bonam copiam), <hi rend="ital">to declare on oath that one has not wherewithal to pay his debts</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to swear that one is insolvent</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:9:16:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 9, 16, 7</bibl> Manut.</sense></entryFree>
ejus: <entryFree id="n15368" type="main" key="e_jus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ējus</orth>, <sense id="n15368.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">gen.</hi> of is, ea, id. q. v.</sense></entryFree>
ejusdemmodi: <entryFree id="n15369" type="main" key="e_jusdemmo^di"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ējusdemmŏdi</orth> <etym>idem - modus</etym>, <sense id="n15369.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of the same kind</hi>, <hi rend="ital">such</hi> (usually written as two words), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 9:section=84" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 9, § 84</bibl> and § 110 Müll.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:1:1:4:section=14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Q. Fr. 1, 1, 4, § 14</bibl>; al. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:16:8:10" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 16, 8, 10</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
ejusmodi: <entryFree id="n15370" type="main" key="e_jusmo^di"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ējusmŏdi</orth> <etym>is-modus</etym>, usually written ejus modi (sometimes trisyl.), <sense id="n15370.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of that kind</hi>, <hi rend="ital">of such a kind</hi>, <hi rend="ital">such</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui cum ingeniis conflictatur ejusmodi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:1:1:66 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 1, 1, 66 al.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">genus belli est ejus modi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> de Imp. 2, 6 al.</bibl></cit> —</sense><sense id="n15370.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">So</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in such a manner</hi>, = ita: <cit><quote lang="la">quam viam tensarum atque pompae ejus modi exegisti, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:59:section=154" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 59, § 154</bibl></cit>.— —<orth extent="full" lang="la">ējuscemŏdi</orth>, i. q. ejusmodi, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:16:8" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 16, 8 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl> al.</sense></entryFree>
elabor: <entryFree id="n15371" type="main" key="e_la_bor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ē-lābor</orth>, <itype>elapsus</itype> (elabsus), 3, <sense id="n15371.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. dep. n.</hi> and <hi rend="ital">a.</hi> </sense><sense id="n15371.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Neutr.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to slip</hi> or <hi rend="ital">glide away</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to fall out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">get off</hi>, <hi rend="ital">escape</hi> (class.). </sense><sense id="n15371.2" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">anguilla est, elabitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:2:4:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 2, 4, 57</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">so of a snake,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 56</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:19" default="NO" valid="yes">26, 19</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:244" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 244</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:9:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 9, 63</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum se convolvens sol elaberetur et abiret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:23:46" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 23, 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(animal) ex utero elapsum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:51:128" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 2, 51, 128</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:1:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cat. 1, 6 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">elapsae manibus tabellae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:9:571" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 9, 571</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">gladius ei e manu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:33:2:3" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 33, 2, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jumentum e manibus curantium elapsum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:44:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 44, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">animi corporibus elapsi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:6:26" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 6, 26 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:45" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 1, 45 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quicquid incidit, fastigio musculi elabitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:11:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 2, 11, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Manlii cuspis super galeam hostis elapsa est,</quote> <trans><tr>slipped along</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 8, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">foras elapsa corpora,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:489" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 489</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n15371.3" n="b" level="4"> In an upward direction of fire: <cit><quote lang="la">frondes elapsus in altas,</quote> <trans><tr>having crept</tr>, <tr>glided</tr>, <tr>upwards</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:305" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 305</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n15371.4" n="2" level="3"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n15371.5" n="(a)" level="5"> Of persons, <hi rend="ital">to slip off</hi>, <hi rend="ital">get clear</hi>, <hi rend="ital">escape</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex proelio elapsi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 37 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">e soceri manibus ac ferro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:10:4:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 10, 4, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">de caede Pyrrhi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:526" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 526</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">telis Achivum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 318</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">custodiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:5:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 5, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inter tumultum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 28, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mediis Achivis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:242" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 242</bibl></cit> et saep.—</sense><sense id="n15371.6" n="(b)" level="5"> Of limbs or joints, <hi rend="ital">to be dislocated</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">articuli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:8:11:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 8, 11, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">id quod in latus elapsum est, digitis restitui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:8:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 8, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">illi elapsos in pravum artus, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:81" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 4, 81</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n15371.7" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n15371.8" n="A" level="2"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">to slip away</hi>, <hi rend="ital">escape</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">causa e manibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 50</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">rei publicae statum illum elapsum scito esse de manibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:16:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 1, 16, 6</bibl></cit>; and with this cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:39:85" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mur. 39, 85</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">animus devinctus paulatim elapsus est Bacchidi,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>became estranged</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:1:2:94" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Hec. 1, 2, 94</bibl></cit>: libros adolescenti elapsos esse, <hi rend="ital">had slipped from him</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">had been published prematurely</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:1:20" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 3, 1, 20</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">in servitutem elapsi,</quote> <trans><tr>who had insensibly fallen into</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 37</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n15371.9" n="B" level="2"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n15371.10" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To get off</hi>, <hi rend="ital">get clear</hi>, <hi rend="ital">escape</hi> from condemnation, punishment: <cit><quote lang="la">ex tot tantisque criminibus elapsus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 58</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">2, 1, 39</bibl> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> de Sen. 12 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:3:4:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Q.
